cobblemon.species.mushpunky.desc: Mushpunky's arms are made of a rubbery material that can stretch up to a whopping 3 meters. Whenever two meet, they punch each other as a form of greeting.
cobblemon.species.mushilly.name: Mushilly
cobblemon.species.mushilly.desc: The size of the umbrella differs between individuals. There are stories of a Mushilly so big that it took root and it served as a home to a whole forest of Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.mushcary.name: Mushcary
cobblemon.species.mushcary.desc: It clamps shut on prey between its two halves and leeches their life energy. Masks are traditionally made in its resemblance and used as wards against evil spirits.
cobblemon.species.sakurovix.name: Sakurovix
cobblemon.species.sakurovix.desc: The guardian of Easter Island. It awakens in the spring, and its song causes all Pokemon Eggs in its vicinity to hatch. If it does not awaken, the islanders perform a ritual to rouse it from its slumber.
cobblemon.species.nephelith.name: Nephelith
cobblemon.species.nephelith.desc: Nephelith has the ability to create and manipulate clouds into a form of matter strong enough to walk and even build upon. It's believed that the sky region of Cloudia was built on clouds created by Nephelith, along with potentially others.
cobblemon.species.leafrog.name: Leafrog
cobblemon.species.ribbush.name: Ribbush
cobblemon.species.agacloakis.name: Agacloakis
cobblemon.species.giraze.name: Giraze
cobblemon.species.bonfah.name: Bonfah
cobblemon.species.magmaraffa.name: Magmaraffa
cobblemon.species.damphant.name: Damphant
cobblemon.species.droophant.name: Droophant
cobblemon.species.cyclodon.name: Cyclodon
cobblemon.species.solcorn.name: Solcorn
cobblemon.species.ferrutail.name: Ferrutail
cobblemon.species.tweejay.name: Tweejay
cobblemon.species.marchawk.name: Marchawk
cobblemon.species.harmosoar.name: Harmosoar
cobblemon.species.pipillar.name: Pipillar
cobblemon.species.pipillar.desc: Pipillar is not a bug to be messed with due to tough and stubborn nature. Its pincers can tear other small Pokemon to pieces.
cobblemon.species.vicoon.name: Vicoon
cobblemon.species.vicoon.desc: Vicoon enjoy hanging on high tree branches to purposely fall on trainers or Pokemon. Their main objective is to protect the sleeping larvae on its back. evolve: protect
cobblemon.species.arisfly.name: Arisfly
cobblemon.species.arisfly.desc: Arisfly use their glowing white patterns to lure unsuspecting prey to them at night. Their mating calls also make use of these patterns. evolve: air cutter
cobblemon.species.juvy.name: Juvy
cobblemon.species.juvy.desc: Juvy swoop down from the sky to quickly snatch any valuable that a trainer may be holding. They often work with Thefcoon to pull off larger heists.
cobblemon.species.convird.name: Convird
cobblemon.species.convird.desc: Convird are some of the most scandalous Pokemon as they attempt more large-scale robberies. There was once a report of a single Convird breaking into a high-security bank.
cobblemon.species.thefcoon.name: Thefcoon
cobblemon.species.thefcoon.desc: Despite their adorable appearance, Thefcoon are infamous for their incredible thieving ability. Thefcoon are so sly that their schemes are nearly undetectable.
cobblemon.species.rascoon.name: Rascoon
cobblemon.species.rascoon.desc: Unable to perform the same sneaky plots as before, Rascoon have other Thefcoon retrieve valuable items for them. They are known as the leader of the gang and are hardly ever seen in the wild.
cobblemon.species.bulpy.name: Bulpy
cobblemon.species.bulpy.desc: Families from all over the world pay large amounts of money to get their hands on their own pet Bulpy. Their cuteness has become an internet sensation.
cobblemon.species.filthound.name: Filthound
cobblemon.species.filthound.desc: Filthound's fur is easily covered in mud and saliva if not groomed daily. They are often abandoned due to their natural odor and dirtiness.
cobblemon.species.gleamuse.name: Gleamuse
cobblemon.species.spookrab.name: Spookrab
cobblemon.species.spookrab.desc: Spookrab are rarely ever seen in person as they haunt the beaches through the night. Their claws can mimic the sounds of screaming.
cobblemon.species.crustgeist.name: Crustgeist
cobblemon.species.crustgeist.desc: Crustgeist hide their bodies underground, only exposing their dish. They keep an old shell on their back to create an alluring aroma for their prey.
cobblemon.species.hermish.name: Hermish
cobblemon.species.conkamite.name: Conkamite
cobblemon.species.whirm.name: Whirm
cobblemon.species.grappore.name: Grappore
cobblemon.species.panditsy.name: Panditsy
cobblemon.species.panditsy.desc: Panditsy's unsteady movements are so mesmerizing that just a few moments of observation cause trainers and Pokemon to move in the same fashion. The hypnotic swirl on their head can be dangerous if one is not careful.
cobblemon.species.zangarsh.name: Zangarsh
cobblemon.species.beagasso.name: Beagasso
cobblemon.species.onnidix.name: Onnidix
cobblemon.species.onnibud.name: Onnibud
cobblemon.species.vittion.name: Vittion
cobblemon.species.maskost.name: Maskost
cobblemon.species.tomaskost.name: Tomaskost
cobblemon.species.threevilasks.name: Threevilasks
cobblemon.species.ogopoing.name: Ogopoing
cobblemon.species.ogospiral.name: Ogospiral
cobblemon.species.nesspin.name: Nesspin
cobblemon.species.bitumin.name: Bitumin
cobblemon.species.ligniter.name: Ligniter
cobblemon.species.conflaracite.name: Conflaracite
cobblemon.species.pyrockit.name: Pyrockit
cobblemon.species.zooboom.name: Zooboom
cobblemon.species.kraboom.name: Kraboom
cobblemon.species.audibaah.name: Audibaah
cobblemon.species.bellabaah.name: Bellabaah
cobblemon.species.marifin.name: Marifin
cobblemon.species.umiveil.name: Umiveil
cobblemon.species.sniffreze.name: Sniffreze
cobblemon.species.kloakold.name: Kloakold
cobblemon.species.blastine.name: Blastine
cobblemon.species.navolatle.name: Navolatle
cobblemon.species.lochnes.name: Lochnes
cobblemon.species.lochitent.name: Lochitent
cobblemon.species.turbilly.name: Turbilly
cobblemon.species.dynabuck.name: Dynabuck
cobblemon.species.kristallant.name: Kristallant
cobblemon.species.miniradae.name: Miniradae
cobblemon.species.sorbeak.name: Sorbeak
cobblemon.species.dulswoop.name: Dulswoop
cobblemon.species.dulswoop.desc: Dulswoop typically only come out during the summer, ironically. During migration, the chocolate they melt off forms a type of delicious rain. Children love to run out with bowls to try and catch the delicious syrup.
cobblemon.species.squiwer.name: Squiwer
cobblemon.species.squiwer.desc: Squiwer have the ability to absorb types of mold they are often found relaxing in. Their horrendous stench can drive off even the scariest of Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.quisewer.name: Quisewer
cobblemon.species.quisewer.desc: Quisewer's horrid appearance makes it an unpopular choice among trainers. They are known to be insanely greedy, only obeying those who feed it lots of garbage.
cobblemon.species.bactiny.name: Bactiny
cobblemon.species.bactiny.desc: Bactiny are believed to be tied to the origin of the Pokerus virus. Contact with these Pokemon can cause numerous illnesses.
cobblemon.species.liquphage.name: Liquphage
cobblemon.species.liquphage.desc: Liquphage have no solid form, allowing them to squeeze into the tiniest of spaces. Despite being dangerous to humans, the diseases they carry are ineffective on them.
cobblemon.species.katakun.name: Katakun
cobblemon.species.shurisan.name: Shurisan
cobblemon.species.shaltuff.name: Shaltuff
cobblemon.species.gnawgorus.name: Gnawgorus
cobblemon.species.polluga.name: Polluga
cobblemon.species.junkqual.name: Junkqual
cobblemon.species.trashan.name: Trashan
cobblemon.species.scrapiteer.name: Scrapiteer
cobblemon.species.cactabit.name: Cactabit
cobblemon.species.gymnozard.name: Gymnozard
cobblemon.species.gymnozard.desc: The bulb on its tail contains a carefully collected water supply which it can use to douse itself in water to ward off burns from the hot sun. If attacked, it may use this to soak its enemies.
cobblemon.species.tuxechik.name: Tuxechik
cobblemon.species.juavarrior.name: Juavarrior
cobblemon.species.luxereguin.name: Luxereguin
cobblemon.species.sliezen.name: Sliezen
cobblemon.species.glacitrave.name: Glacitrave
cobblemon.species.oofoe.name: Oofoe
cobblemon.species.intellifoe.name: Intellifoe
cobblemon.species.zallut.name: Zallut
cobblemon.species.zerbrahg.name: Zerbrahg
cobblemon.species.zerbrahg.desc: Curious beings, Zerbarhg typically try to avoid contact with other Pokemon, but rather study them from afar. No one has yet to discover what this research is for.
cobblemon.species.cryvus.name: Cryvus
cobblemon.species.etheeria.name: Etheeria
cobblemon.species.shocalf.name: Shocalf
cobblemon.species.voltuff.name: Voltuff
cobblemon.species.chargibull.name: Chargibull
cobblemon.species.sebrium.name: Sebrium
cobblemon.species.kirastrum.name: Kirastrum
cobblemon.species.vitoshum.name: Vitoshum
cobblemon.species.bubblea.name: Bubblea
cobblemon.species.bubblea.desc: Bubblea are known to float around large bodies of water, like lakes. Rumors say that popping Bubblea's bubbles by force brings it immense pain.
cobblemon.species.chesture.name: Chesture
cobblemon.species.acard.name: Acard
cobblemon.species.hiveum.name: Hiveum
cobblemon.species.gigantoid.name: Gigantoid
cobblemon.species.periyeti.name: Periyeti
cobblemon.species.periyeti.desc: Periyeti live in exile as they abandon themselves from all people and Pokemon. Due to their snow-colored fur, it's nearly impossible to spot one and makes many people doubt their existence.
cobblemon.species.magness.name: Magness
cobblemon.species.tyranntric.name: Tyranntric
cobblemon.species.phoeuck.name: Phoeuck
cobblemon.species.metamarine.name: Metamarine
cobblemon.species.metamarine.desc: Metamarine lurks beneath the deep oceans and in the deepest marinas, emitting an eerie blue glow that somehow shines to the surface of the sea. Those that see this glow flee, as it is an omen of tsunamis and terrible storms to come. The cannon on it's back is capable of obliterating nearly anything in it's path.
cobblemon.species.mechrazore.name: Mechrazore
cobblemon.species.mechrazore.desc: Mechrazore is a man-made mechanical beast, with it's gigantic strength used to fight the Ultra Beast threat. Though it proves ultimately destructive of any environment it's placed in, it's methods of disposing of Ultra Beasts are effective.
cobblemon.species.slanbolos.name: Slanbolos
cobblemon.species.slanbolos.desc: Capable of infesting the deepest reaches of the subconscious, Salanbolos corrupts the mind of those it torments, leaving anger and depression wherever it goes. Though fearsome, it prefers to hide away and remain undetected.
cobblemon.species.oceausky.name: Oceausky
cobblemon.species.nifflom.name: Nifflom
cobblemon.species.snampery.name: Snampery
cobblemon.species.descargot.name: Descargot
cobblemon.species.gastesla.name: Gastesla
cobblemon.species.flasinge.name: Flasinge
cobblemon.species.shaboon.name: Shaboon
cobblemon.species.lunaye.name: Lunaye
cobblemon.species.swolphin.name: Swolphin
cobblemon.species.norspear.name: Norspear
cobblemon.species.narvalor.name: Narvalor
cobblemon.species.cefireon.name: Cefireon
cobblemon.species.cefireon.desc: Draconeon are considered exotic and are rarely seen outside of Blackthorn City in Johto. Though smaller than most dragons, Draconeon are fierce and passionate.
cobblemon.species.polekin.name: Polekin
cobblemon.species.fungorse.name: Fungorse
cobblemon.species.cervantrier.name: Cervantrier
cobblemon.species.lugnis.name: Lugnis
cobblemon.species.luravit.name: Luravit
cobblemon.species.luxpiravit.name: Luxpiravit
cobblemon.species.quisquite.name: Quisquite
cobblemon.species.gambarrel.name: Gambarrel
cobblemon.species.bogaleon.name: Bogaleon
cobblemon.species.astrem.name: Astrem
cobblemon.species.unktena.name: Unktena
cobblemon.species.crabble.name: Crabble
cobblemon.species.crabble.desc: It uses its large claw to knock fruit down from trees. Although its soft outer layer makes it resemble a tasty fruit, its bright coloration is actually to warn predators that it tastes foul.
cobblemon.species.carapoma.name: Carapoma
cobblemon.species.carapoma.desc: The arm bearing the larger claw can extend to several times its resting length to clobber opponents. Conversely, the other claw is shrunken to near-uselessness.
cobblemon.species.crustorchard.name: Crustorchard
cobblemon.species.crustorchard.desc: Its shell is as rugged as stone, so all this Pokemon needs to avoid predators is to bunker down and pretend to be a particularly large and hard-to-chew fruit until they lose interest.
cobblemon.species.burrliz.name: Burrliz
cobblemon.species.burrliz.desc: When faced with danger, it prefers to stand its ground and fight no matter the odds, its spiny body making it hard for predators to safely attack.
cobblemon.species.reptack.name: Reptack
cobblemon.species.reptack.desc: Its tear ducts emit fire, and it can torch things with pinpoint accuracy as if shooting a ray of heat from its eyes, but it just as easily relies on its sharp claws to fight instead.
cobblemon.species.calientrop.name: Calientrop
cobblemon.species.calientrop.desc: By day, it buries itself to soak up heat from the sun and sand, with its spines jutting outward as a warning to stay away. Its spines routinely break off and regrow daily.
cobblemon.species.sharby.name: Sharby
cobblemon.species.sharby.desc: It's always on the move, so it rarely gets a chance to sleep. On the rare occasion it gets to take a nap, a strange aura emanates from it that pacifies everything around it too.
cobblemon.species.lamnaw.name: Lamnaw
cobblemon.species.lamnaw.desc: Every day, it dives to great depths that no human could explore without a submarine. Hunting in total darkness, it navigates using electrical pulses from its snout.
cobblemon.species.squalucid.name: Squalucid
cobblemon.species.squalucid.desc: Its own toxic blood enhances its psychic abilities by keeping it in a subconscious state. Though it is blind, it does not need eyesight in its deep sea habitat, and therefore its other senses are greatly heightened.
cobblemon.species.chirunner.name: Chirunner
cobblemon.species.chirunner.desc: At the slightest threat, it sprints away at remarkable speedsit can keep pace with a speeding car. The sand scattered by its running forms a cloud, allowing it to escape unseen.
cobblemon.species.roaduner.name: Roaduner
cobblemon.species.roaduner.desc: A master of speed and stealth that creates sandstorms to cover its tracks. Then, it strikes with the blade-like feathers under its wings. Roaduner runs fast enough to scale walls, and even ceilings.
cobblemon.species.hoppoint.name: Hoppoint
cobblemon.species.hoppoint.desc: A plant-eating Pokemon that uses its horned head to poke through tree bark and eat the fresh wood within. Farmers despise Hoppoint as they like to devour their precious berry crops.
cobblemon.species.helmhide.name: Helmhide
cobblemon.species.helmhide.desc: Between evolutions, it simply ducks into its armored shell to protect its developing body. The horn gradually lengthens an inch every day.
cobblemon.species.durabarge.name: Durabarge
cobblemon.species.durabarge.desc: The horn on its armored head looks different between regions. Some are so extravagantly shaped that their exact purpose is currently unknown to science.
cobblemon.species.imbirbe.name: Imbirbe
cobblemon.species.imbirbe.desc: It daintily sips nectar from flowers with its long beak. In turn, it helps the plants grow extra healthy because of the natural fertilizer in its saliva.
cobblemon.species.kolalibri.name: Kolalibri
cobblemon.species.kolalibri.desc: Because of its extreme resistance to toxins, it favors bitter plants. Its beak is very flexible, twisting and bending to reach deep within flowers and guzzle up every last drop of nectar within.
cobblemon.species.blastun.name: Blastun
cobblemon.species.blastun.desc: By igniting the gases in its body, it can jet through the air like a missile. A hard headbutt from this Pokemon can easily dent steel.
cobblemon.species.bugbardier.name: Bugbardier
cobblemon.species.bugbardier.desc: When approached, it shows the bright colors on its shell as a warning to stay away. If provoked, it flips over and shoots a burst of fire from the nozzle on its back.
cobblemon.species.ensprout.name: Ensprout
cobblemon.species.ensprout.desc: Farmers carefully tend to this Pokemon to ensure it grows healthily before evolving. Its leaves look different depending on the type of soil it grows in.
cobblemon.species.treenanza.name: Treenanza
cobblemon.species.treenanza.desc: An assortment of different fruits grows from its body, so it is economically important. When stripped bare of its fruits, it goes dormant until they regrow.
cobblemon.species.cykit.name: Cykit
cobblemon.species.cykit.desc: People who look into its eye find themselves unable to resist doting on it. Some say it's really just because of its infectiously affectionate nature, however.
cobblemon.species.feleye.name: Feleye
cobblemon.species.feleye.desc: Its gaze pacifies foes, making them bend to the whims of this rather aloof Pokemon. It sits as still as a statue unless in the presence of a trusted companion.
cobblemon.species.scribish.name: Scribish
cobblemon.species.scribish.desc: The ink-like black markings on its back are unique to each individual. It eats lots of wood and paper to strengthen its thin exoskeleton.
cobblemon.species.papyrush.name: Papyrush
cobblemon.species.papyrush.desc: It has a keen understanding of written language, so it knows which books are the tastiest. This makes them a nuisance to libraries and other places where books are kept.
cobblemon.species.dirtusk.name: Dirtusk
cobblemon.species.dirtusk.desc: By bathing in mud, this Pokemon can keep cool even during the hot summer months. Due to this coating of mud, plants are sometimes seen sprouting from its head.
cobblemon.species.stalagrus.name: Stalagrus
cobblemon.species.stalagrus.desc: It's able to crush rocks with its heavy body alone. This Pokemon is extremely patient and can wait weeks for food to come by, often becoming cloaked in sand and harder for its prey to spot.
cobblemon.species.buroot.name: Buroot
cobblemon.species.buroot.desc: A plant-like Pokemon that lives underground. Since it can't get energy from the sun, it absorbs nutrients from the roots of desert plants.
cobblemon.species.stinginger.name: Stinginger
cobblemon.species.stinginger.desc: When not on the move, it pokes its tail out of the soil in search of prey. What looks like a fruit is actually a stinger that it uses to drain the life force from anything that comes near.
cobblemon.species.cuptus.name: Cuptus
cobblemon.species.cuptus.desc: Cuptus are born from the sand itself when lightning strikes in the desert. There, they will grow and become a hazard to people traveling across the desert.
cobblemon.species.cactank.name: Cactank
cobblemon.species.cactank.desc: It stores cool, fresh water in its body to withstand the intense heat of the desert. Finding a Cactank often means life or death for weary travelers.
cobblemon.species.colsector.name: Colsector
cobblemon.species.colsector.desc: It wears the cast-off shell of a Bug Pokemon as armor. It hunts the largest Bug-types to carve off parts of their exoskeleton to strengthen its armor.
cobblemon.species.shardodon.name: Shardodon
cobblemon.species.shardodon.desc: As the crystal on its back grows taller, shards of it break off and are left behind. These pieces are often collected and sold as souvenirs, but they are razor-sharp.
cobblemon.species.solardon.name: Solardon
cobblemon.species.solardon.desc: Heat concentrates in its crystal sail while it sunbathes, making it burn to the touch. If it overheats, it can release all of its stored heat energy at once in a scorching wave.
cobblemon.species.buzzoo.name: Buzzoo
cobblemon.species.buzzoo.desc: It's already self-sufficient right after hatching, but it will usually trek in packs of three. Using its keen sense of smell, it can sniff out food from miles awayany scraps will satisfy it.
cobblemon.species.carrioon.name: Carrioon
cobblemon.species.carrioon.desc: Gas builds up under its feather coat and causes it to float in the air. It sprays a foul-smelling red liquid around itself to keep hungry predators away.
cobblemon.species.embuzzle.name: Embuzzle
cobblemon.species.embuzzle.desc: They construct massive nests inside cliff faces, where their eggs are safe from danger. They are called 'janitors of the desert' because they will eat anything they come across, no matter how rotten.
cobblemon.species.scrapint.name: Scrapint
cobblemon.species.scrapint.desc: This Pokemon is very popular, but it's terrible with childrenit often ends up released into the wild by unprepared owners. When it bites, it aims for the ankles to trip opponents much larger than it.
cobblemon.species.pupnacious.name: Pupnacious
cobblemon.species.pupnacious.desc: Pupnacious are popular guard Pokemon because of their tenacity and fearsome bite. Because of its diminutive size, people tend to underestimate it and learn their mistake the hard way.
cobblemon.species.lungob.name: Lungob
cobblemon.species.lungob.desc: A missing link between Pokemon of the land and sea. It digs burrows using its mouth, spitting out the sand as a compacted mud ball. Thousands of mud balls littering a lake shore are a sign that this Pokemon is around.
cobblemon.species.dessibello.name: Dessibello
cobblemon.species.dessibello.desc: It can survive on land for long periods of time. Using its powerful lungs, this Pokemon exhales mighty gusts to clear away sand and rock, searching for underground water that it will use to hydrate itself.
cobblemon.species.chardine.name: Chardine
cobblemon.species.chardine.desc: Born survivalists, they live only in remote basins in the desert, where they can handle even the hottest of temperatures. Threats to their unique habitat have made them rare.
cobblemon.species.volray.name: Volray
cobblemon.species.volray.desc: Because it likes to hide under the sand, swimmers are warned to shuffle their feet in the water to avoid stepping on this Pokemon's electrified body.
cobblemon.species.torplitz.name: Torplitz
cobblemon.species.torplitz.desc: The rings on its body are electrical organs, emitting pulses that help it navigate even in pitch-black waters. Touching any part of its body results in a nasty electric shock.
cobblemon.species.sprouton.name: Sprouton
cobblemon.species.sprouton.desc: It thrives on soil rich in metal content, which it stores in its bulb. When it is ready to evolve, it drills deep underground and sprouts.
cobblemon.species.utopion.name: Utopion
cobblemon.species.utopion.desc: Deep within is an organic plant core, protected by several layers of metal. In desolate, polluted lands, this Pokemon will take root, slowly healing the environment.
cobblemon.species.champiant.name: Champiant
cobblemon.species.champiant.desc: Although it is small, this Pokemon is able to lift practically anything, even heavy boulders. In numbers, they can carry an entire Metagross away.
cobblemon.species.filsick.name: Filsick
cobblemon.species.filsick.desc: It's a carrier of many strange diseases. It's believed that those who it points to with its antenna will fall ill, but modern medicine has made it mostly harmless.
cobblemon.species.fevirus.name: Fevirus
cobblemon.species.fevirus.desc: Its burning blood makes it combust at the slightest provocation. Fevirus are known to explode in a fiery burst if they don't simmer down fast enough.
cobblemon.species.shivirus.name: Shivirus
cobblemon.species.shivirus.desc: It's always shuddering and sniffling, even under the warm summer sun. When it sneezes, which is often, the fluid is ejected as razor-sharp bolts of ice.
cobblemon.species.quivirus.name: Quivirus
cobblemon.species.quivirus.desc: Its stiff body often twitches profusely from the pent-up electrical energy within. When touched, it flails about for a very brief moment before freezing up again.
cobblemon.species.snole.name: Snole
cobblemon.species.snole.desc: Tunneling through snow as if it were liquid, it hunts for Sleetle hibernating deep in the soil. Its nose is always covered in frost from constantly pushing against the snow it digs through.
cobblemon.species.digloo.name: Digloo
cobblemon.species.digloo.desc: Digloo is just as at home in the water as it is in soil. Able to cut through ice with ease, it waits for something to wander onto the water's frozen surface, then strikes from below.
cobblemon.species.frosmole.name: Frosmole
cobblemon.species.frosmole.desc: Though its claws are razor-sharp and it can fire off powerful ice beams from its snout, what it's really feared for are the avalanches caused by its constant tunneling.
cobblemon.species.gavile.name: Gavile
cobblemon.species.gavile.desc: Gavile's skin is as dark as a shadow, so during the night it becomes virtually invisible. Shine a light on it, however, and it will scramble away in a panic.
cobblemon.species.chirocodile.name: Chirocodile
cobblemon.species.chirocodile.desc: Its back is so dark it seems to swallow up all light, so you may never see it clinging to the walls of its cave until it springs off and swoops at you.
cobblemon.species.erradio.name: Erradio
cobblemon.species.erradio.desc: The strange energy generated by this Pokemon causes technology to malfunction. It climbs up telephone poles to drink electricity.
cobblemon.species.eyesi.name: Eyesi
cobblemon.species.eyesi.desc: During the day, they blend in among the trees they nest in. At night, however, their big eyes open and they become active, hunting for prey with their unparalleled night vision.
cobblemon.species.eyesaur.name: Eyesaur
cobblemon.species.eyesaur.desc: Eyesaur's eyes are always moving in different directions from each other, as they are sensitive to movement. Legends say that if you lock eyes with it, you turn to stone.
cobblemon.species.crozoicaneyesi.name: Eyesi
cobblemon.species.crozoicaneyesi.desc: It relies on electric currents from the ground to achieve lift without much effort. Its feathers stick out in the presence of these currents.
cobblemon.species.crozoicaneyesaur.name: Eyesaur
cobblemon.species.crozoicaneyesaur.desc: Hiding in the treetops, it entrances its prey with its hypnotic gaze, luring them up the tree. Then, it suddenly breaks the connection, causing its startled victim to fall to the ground.
cobblemon.species.disructor.name: Disructor
cobblemon.species.disructor.desc: Electricity that passes through it is amplified to extreme levels. It produces sound waves that cause disorientation, making it dangerous to aircraft.
cobblemon.species.rhinozer.name: Rhinozer
cobblemon.species.rhinozer.desc: Rhinozer travel in herds, and as they move along they create visible dirt paths. Other Pokemon learn to cross these paths with caution as they may get trampled by an oncoming herd if they aren't careful.
cobblemon.species.rhinolition.name: Rhinolition
cobblemon.species.rhinolition.desc: Its huge horn is shaped like a scoop, and as it charges forward, it bulldozes all in its path. Rhinolition are often used by construction crews due to their strength and ease of clearing land.
cobblemon.species.notifant.name: Notifant
cobblemon.species.notifant.desc: When it smells smoke with its sensitive trunk, it makes a loud, ringing call to alert other Pokemon to evacuate. Then, it douses the source of the smoke with a blast of water from its trunk.
cobblemon.species.fountusk.name: Fountusk
cobblemon.species.fountusk.desc: This Pokemon has a helpful disposition that makes it a trusted ally of people. Often, they are tasked to rescue trapped people and Pokemon by using their flexible trunks for safe retrieval.
cobblemon.species.eledrant.name: Eledrant
cobblemon.species.eledrant.desc: It can drink a whole swimming pool's worth of water, then blast it from its trunk and tusks. Herds of Eledrant easily combat the brushfires that are common in their native habitat.
cobblemon.species.wraggle.name: Wraggle
cobblemon.species.wraggle.desc: Soil that it walks on becomes enriched, forming fertile lands in the desert. It ruthlessly defends these places from thieves and troublemakers.
cobblemon.species.wranglash.name: Wranglash
cobblemon.species.wranglash.desc: Sensing vibrations in the earth allows it to catch thieves in the oases it calls home. It can extend its neck several times its length to ensnare its target, then drags it underground.
cobblemon.species.hayataga.name: Hayataga
cobblemon.species.hayataga.desc: By grabbing the end of its tail, it spins around and generates electricity. The designers of an experimental all-terrain vehicle were inspired by it.
cobblemon.species.welweed.name: Welweed
cobblemon.species.welweed.desc: Feigning helplessness, it cries for sympathy, pretending to be someone trapped in the sand. Then, it suddenly uproots itself, attacking with its long, sharp-edged leaf.
cobblemon.species.welwitch.name: Welwitch
cobblemon.species.welwitch.desc: Upon evolving, its grudges from its isolation in the desert manifest as power too great to be contained. It cackles wickedly as it ensnares everything with its leaves.
cobblemon.species.vespark.name: Vespark
cobblemon.species.vespark.desc: It's said to have the most excruciatingly painful sting of any Pokemon. Because of this, nothing will challenge it for territory, not even other Vespark.
cobblemon.species.volthroe.name: Volthroe
cobblemon.species.volthroe.desc: The stinger is always surging with electricity. When two Volthroe spar for territory, the impact of their stingers clashing together creates brilliant bursts of sparks.
cobblemon.species.snooseat.name: Snooseat
cobblemon.species.snooseat.desc: From the moment of birth, it searches for a piece of old wood to live in. Once it's found a comfortable-enough object to rest on, it never leaves.
cobblemon.species.taraxaconk.name: Taraxaconk
cobblemon.species.taraxaconk.desc: Bundles of cottony spores cover its fists, cushioning them from the heavy impacts of its punches. If the force of the punch doesn't KO its target, the spores will.
cobblemon.species.phoncrawl.name: Phoncrawl
cobblemon.species.phoncrawl.desc: An early foray into communications tech that became a Pokemon. It can broadcast messages to other Phoncrawl over very long distances.
cobblemon.species.techknot.name: Techknot
cobblemon.species.techknot.desc: It was once a cutting-edge artificial Mon, but was discarded. The frayed wires at its sides crackle with so much electrical energy that it often shorts itself out.
cobblemon.species.trawlossus.name: Trawlossus
cobblemon.species.trawlossus.desc: It stretches the sticky web between its legs to catch prey that fly into it, where they are digested by toxic fluid in the silk. Its paper-thin body easily drifts away in the wind.
cobblemon.species.puppest.name: Puppest
cobblemon.species.puppest.desc: A tricky Pokemon made of cloth that seems to eat and attack only through the puppets on its arms. It is fiercely protective of its puppets and will never let go of them.
cobblemon.species.socktopus.name: Socktopus
cobblemon.species.socktopus.desc: The puppets it holds are made of psychic energy, and they divert attacks away from its soft body. If one of them gets destroyed, it simply generates a new one.
cobblemon.species.germuck.name: Germuck
cobblemon.species.germuck.desc: It was accidentally unearthed from beneath a glacier, but it's mostly harmless. It forms colonies with such exponential growth that it will exhaust all food in the area within days.
cobblemon.species.germasaur.name: Germasaur
cobblemon.species.germasaur.desc: Germasaur is made entirely of tiny Germuck packed together into a form that can be as solid or liquid as it wishes. It's so deathly afraid of cleanliness that it may hide its trainer's soap while they're asleep.
cobblemon.species.flaskantine.name: Flaskantine
cobblemon.species.flaskantine.desc: It uses freezing cold to keep the biohazardous bacteria within from growing out of control. To forcefully remove the plug from atop its head is to ensure certain demise.
cobblemon.species.flingzer.name: Flingzer
cobblemon.species.flingzer.desc: It grows spherical fruit, which it then throws with its enlarged leaf. It catches incoming projectiles with its mouth and spits them back out with twice the force.
cobblemon.species.partae.name: Partae
cobblemon.species.partae.desc: On special occasions, a flame lights on the wick on its head, counting down to something. Once the wick is fully burned away, Partae becomes overcome with vigor and it begins to dance all night long.
cobblemon.species.lostislandspartae.name: Partae
cobblemon.species.lostislandspartae.desc: On special occasions, a flame lights on the wick on its head, counting down to something. Once the wick is fully burned away, Partae becomes overcome with vigor and it begins to dance all night long.
cobblemon.species.loftival.name: Loftival
cobblemon.species.loftival.desc: On the first hour of the new year, it illuminates the night with a dazzling show of pyrotechnics. Dancing synchronously with its allies causes the flames to glow even brighter.
cobblemon.species.lostislandsloftival.de: On the first hour of the new year, it illuminates the night with a dazzling show of pyrotechnics. Dancing synchronously with its allies causes the flames to glow even brighter.
cobblemon.species.hotdach.name: Hotdach
cobblemon.species.hotdach.desc: Its tail constantly grows in segments that fall off as they get too long, leaving behind a trail for other Hotdach to follow. A severed tail segment may continue to burn for several days.
cobblemon.species.schnausage.name: Schnausage
cobblemon.species.schnausage.desc: Its nose-flame is attuned to the quality of the surrounding air, so it burns differently when detecting certain scents. It burns the brightest in the presence of other Schnausage in the pack.
cobblemon.species.hammerod.name: Hammerod
cobblemon.species.hammerod.desc: It delights in showing off on busy roads, causing havoc. The side pods can separate from the main body and move on their own to scope out the surrounding territory.
cobblemon.species.pictolith.name: Pictolith
cobblemon.species.pictolith.desc: The majority of its body is animated by the living paint on its face. If a Pictolith is washed clean, it stops moving entirely.
cobblemon.species.canvalith.name: Canvalith
cobblemon.species.canvalith.desc: This Pokemon allows people to paint on its body because it feeds on the materials in the paint. Eventually, the paint is absorbed and it becomes a blank canvas again.
cobblemon.species.sinklot.name: Sinklot
cobblemon.species.sinklot.desc: This Pokemon makes its home inside of pipes, causing them to become clogged. Its fur is slick and oily to help it move through tight spaces.
cobblemon.species.snareball.name: Snareball
cobblemon.species.snareball.desc: Snareball's fur is extremely coarse and abrasive, like steel wool. It is a welcome sight at sewage treatment plants because it filters out toxic garbage from the water with its fur.
cobblemon.species.whaxzza.name: Whaxzza
cobblemon.species.whaxzza.desc: Whaxzza is covered in an incredibly hot wax that it can control the solidity ofit can be as solid or liquid as the situation requires. Its flame produces a sweet scent that carries for miles.
cobblemon.species.beatzza.name: Beatzza
cobblemon.species.beatzza.desc: It picks berries constantlynot to eat, but to wear on its head. The most extravagantly decorated Beatzza becomes the leader of the pack.
cobblemon.species.manchinade.name: Manchinade
cobblemon.species.manchinade.desc: Its leaves act as a limiter that keeps the energy within from overflowing. If it loses them in a fight, it explodes, sending sharp seeds flying in all directions.
cobblemon.species.mandrazooka.name: Mandrazooka
cobblemon.species.mandrazooka.desc: It grabs Manchinade and spits them out at high speeds to ward off enemies from its territory. Intense heat and toxic gases emanate from its bodyparking a car near one will melt the paint right off.
cobblemon.species.buoybie.name: Buoybie
cobblemon.species.buoybie.desc: A bird Pokemon that can neither fly nor swim very well, so it relies on its parents to guide it along. Its feathers are buoyant enough to keep it afloat without needing to tread water, but it can't dive and is often helpless if left unattended.
cobblemon.species.albalue.name: Albalue
cobblemon.species.albalue.desc: Albalue are masters of the sky and sea, able to maneuver through water as swiftly as in the air. However, they're so adapted to this lifestyle that their walking skills leave something to be desired.
cobblemon.species.soponge.name: Soponge
cobblemon.species.soponge.desc: Its porous body can swell to four times its original size by taking in water. It can violently expel this stored water from the tubes on its head.
cobblemon.species.bubbaluffa.name: Bubbaluffa
cobblemon.species.bubbaluffa.desc: Despite its boneless, absorbent body, it has a very tough, rigid texture, and remarkable resistance to pain. Enough of them lined up on a beach could soak up an entire tsunami.
cobblemon.species.anemeany.name: Anemeany
cobblemon.species.anemeany.desc: It gathers in swarms by the water's edge, attacking intruders by stretching out and flailing itself like a club. The colony pushes away boats that try to sail over their land.
cobblemon.species.truculony.name: Truculony
cobblemon.species.truculony.desc: It's so territorial that it will not rest until it has scared off all other Pokemon from its habitat. Colonies of this Pokemon will enter blood feuds that last for generations.
cobblemon.species.lusigusi.name: Lusigusi
cobblemon.species.lusigusi.desc: It perches on rocks with its sucker-foot. It's often mistaken for a bird Pokemon from a distance, but it's only shaped like one; it can't even fly.
cobblemon.species.hermice.name: Hermice
cobblemon.species.hermice.desc: Water vapor in the air around it condenses and freezes into its shell of ice. It must shed this ice daily or risk its whole body fatally freezing over.
cobblemon.species.hermafrost.name: Hermafrost
cobblemon.species.hermafrost.desc: Its icy shell makes it float on the water's surface, which is where it hunts. Its blood temperature is always cold enough to prevent its shell from melting.
cobblemon.species.hagma.name: Hagma
cobblemon.species.hagma.desc: Its body is coated in super-flammable slime that ignites easily. Holding onto this Pokemon is difficult because the slippery slime allows it to wriggle through even the tightest grip.
cobblemon.species.conhagrant.name: Conhagrant
cobblemon.species.conhagrant.desc: It shoots hot slime from its mouth like a cannon to blast apart its food. This slime is hot and corrosive enough to bore through a sunken ship with ease.
cobblemon.species.mesmarine.name: Mesmarine
cobblemon.species.mesmarine.desc: Mesmarine slowly creep across the seafloor collecting minerals from the sand. They use these to form their disorientingly sparkly shells, which are tough enough to resist the battering of waves which would sweep away most other Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.jellop.name: Jellop
cobblemon.species.jellop.desc: Underneath its rubbery head are thin tentacles that can stretch up to a mile long. Get stung by one and you'll be wracked with pain for days.
cobblemon.species.irukarate.name: Irukarate
cobblemon.species.irukarate.desc: Irukarate makes up for its lack of physical strength with its sheer agility, able to dodge an opponent's attack and incapacitate it with a swift pinch in the back of the neck.
cobblemon.species.craberrant.name: Craberrant
cobblemon.species.craberrant.desc: A temperamental Pokemon that emerges from the sea at night, or if disturbed by offshore human activity. Its hard shell is highly resistant to undersea pressures but is also very flexible.
cobblemon.species.frogfew.name: Frogfew
cobblemon.species.frogfew.desc: Frogfew lays flat on the ground in swampy riverbanks, covered in mud and leaf litter except for its sweet-smelling lure. Its sticky body is sometimes stepped upon by unwary creatures too big to be prey, and so it ends up tracked along and somewhat irritated by the whole experience.
cobblemon.species.sundangler.name: Sundangler
cobblemon.species.sundangler.desc: Floating on the water's surface, the flowery tree on its back might look safe to rest under, but its entire body is as sticky as flypaper. Bird Pokemon will roost on top of it and find themselves unable to fly away as it submerges to drown them.
cobblemon.species.psyder.name: Psyder
cobblemon.species.psyder.desc: It spins its web in a spiral pattern, then twirls it around in a disorienting fashion. It is usually most active under the light of the full moon.
cobblemon.species.lunarach.name: Lunarach
cobblemon.species.lunarach.desc: It can manifest a nearly-invisible psychic web between its two horns to catch flying prey, then balls them up in silk and snacks on them.
cobblemon.species.rotpot.name: Rotpot
cobblemon.species.rotpot.desc: It is said this Pokemon was born from the remains of an abandoned greenhouse. Its entire body is dry and brittle, but can reform if torn apart. Rotpot doesn't care at all when this happens.
cobblemon.species.woebehind.name: Woebehind
cobblemon.species.woebehind.desc: It's able to hide itself behind any object, such as a thin pole, tree, or even its own tail, then ambushes its victims when they least expect it. However, it only intends to startle.
cobblemon.species.skuzzly.name: Skuzzly
cobblemon.species.skuzzly.desc: It sticks debris to its head to hide its face, as it believes it's too ugly to be seen. If its face is shown, it vanishes in a blink of light from its glowing tail.
cobblemon.species.clockoo.name: Clockoo
cobblemon.species.clockoo.desc: A nervous Pokemon always fretting about as if it has some overdue business. Every night for a single hour, however, it focuses itself and prowls for those lost in the woods with deadly precision.
cobblemon.species.nocturvian.name: Nocturvian
cobblemon.species.nocturvian.desc: It falls asleep at noon and awakens at midnight, never breaking from this schedule. Old tales tell of a Nocturvian that would kidnap and punish naughty children.
cobblemon.species.lumbrawl.name: Lumbrawl
cobblemon.species.lumbrawl.desc: Should the central head prove too much of a nuisance, the other two will break apart from it. None of them are hindered by this for long due to Lumbrawl's miraculous regenerative abilities.
cobblemon.species.unifly.name: Unifly
cobblemon.species.unifly.desc: A pesky Pokemon infamous for swarming people in large numbers, yet being nearly impossible to fend off. It flies off with whatever human food it can carry.
cobblemon.species.multifly.name: Multifly
cobblemon.species.multifly.desc: Rather than gather food on its own, it prefers to gives orders to the Unifly around it. These underlings will protect it at all costs.
cobblemon.species.amplifly.name: Amplifly
cobblemon.species.amplifly.desc: The swarm has grown large enough to form a pseudo-body, which Amplifly commands its underlings from within. At the slightest disruption, the swarm will disperse and reform elsewhere, good as new.
cobblemon.species.tadpunk.name: Tadpunk
cobblemon.species.tadpunk.desc: It will always follow the lead of the strongest fighter. It's flaky too, being quite likely to ditch a former ally if the tables start to turn.
cobblemon.species.flatriarch.name: Flatriarch
cobblemon.species.flatriarch.desc: Leading its family of Tadpunk, it rules the swamp with an iron fist. However, it has no attachment to them; it is even relentless enough to abandon them if it'd be advantageous to.
cobblemon.species.shiverme.name: Shiverme
cobblemon.species.shiverme.desc: Rumors tell of a feared pirate captain who went down with his ship and all its treasure. At the bottom of the ocean, his soul became a Shiverme and continues to haunt the seas in search of riches.
cobblemon.species.whalpool.name: Whalpool
cobblemon.species.whalpool.desc: When it inhales, it creates a powerful vortex that pulls waterand everything in itinto its mouth. It will intentionally capsize fishing boats solely to gobble up the whole catch.
cobblemon.species.numerea.name: Numerea
cobblemon.species.numerea.desc: It's tiny and weak, making it easy prey, but it can clone itself so quickly that one Numerea can become a swarm of thousands in only a few minutes.
cobblemon.species.amberado.name: Amberado
cobblemon.species.amberado.desc: It's thought that a Combee hive left abandoned with honey reserves still inside will eventually turn into Amberado, a honey Pokemon with its own unique intellect. It will do whatever it takes to defend the hives of its fellow Bug Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.laharva.name: Laharva
cobblemon.species.laharva.desc: It swims in exposed pools of lava. Every day, it migrates to the edge of the shore to eat hardened volcano rocks.
cobblemon.species.ignuana.name: Ignuana
cobblemon.species.ignuana.desc: After a long swim in the lava to heat its body up, Ignuana sneezes out leftover bits of molten rock that had gotten caught in its nose.
cobblemon.species.grily.name: Grily
cobblemon.species.grily.desc: It needs constant exposure to high temperatures to stay happy and healthy, so it lives in hot places where nothing else can grow. Its fireproof shell lets it comfortably float on top of lava.
cobblemon.species.charcool.name: Charcool
cobblemon.species.charcool.desc: It thrives in soil enriched with volcanic ash. Its flowers take on their most spectacular color and size only after a wildfire has burned away all competing plants.
cobblemon.species.denkyu.name: Denkyu
cobblemon.species.denkyu.desc: These lighter-than-air Pokemon often get stuck to each other due to the static electricity they generateand release. A startled Denkyu may start a chain reaction of electrical bursts through all its neighbors.
cobblemon.species.electrocuke.name: Electrocuke
cobblemon.species.electrocuke.desc: It controls its electric field to form a raging thundercloud around itself. It is sometimes considered an emissary of the Forces of Nature.
cobblemon.species.shankrosite.name: Shankrosite
cobblemon.species.shankrosite.desc: This Pokemon was once hunted to near-extinction as food. Over time, the remaining population adapted and became armored, inedible Rock-type Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.teayke.name: Teayke
cobblemon.species.teayke.desc: Teayke's head fills up with water and leaves when it rains. When it gets angry, its blood comes to a boil and brews the leaves into fresh tea. Generally it's angry because it has a hard time drinking from its own head.
cobblemon.species.teayrant.name: Teayrant
cobblemon.species.teayrant.desc: It's greedy and antisocial, hoarding as much food as it can for itself. It hides its favorite berries inside its pouch, slowly turning their juice into a rare drink that it is fiercely protective of.
cobblemon.species.thermonster.name: Thermonster
cobblemon.species.thermonster.desc: Thermonster is irritable, and blood rises up into its horns in tandem with its level of anger. When it reaches a boiling point, it attacks everything around it in a berserk fury before cooling off and settling back down.
cobblemon.species.pteroast.name: Pteroast
cobblemon.species.pteroast.desc: It's lightweight for a Steel-type Pokemon, so it can easily fly. Flocks of them congregate in volcanic plains, frolicking in the warm updrafts that emerge from the ground.
cobblemon.species.ferrodactyl.name: Ferrodactyl
cobblemon.species.ferrodactyl.desc: The gear in its head moves to stimulate its brain. It can fly across the world without tiringits fiery blood runs so hot that it can even brave the icy cold of the poles.
cobblemon.species.clawhyde.name: Clawhyde
cobblemon.species.clawhyde.desc: It lives in deep caves and reflexively snatches up passing prey in the dark with its huge hands. Even a tiny cut from its claws can prove fatal.
cobblemon.species.voltato.name: Voltato
cobblemon.species.voltato.desc: It communicates with other Voltato with gentle electric vibrations. If you feel the ground periodically shivering under you, it may be this Pokemon at work.
cobblemon.species.levitato.name: Levitato
cobblemon.species.levitato.desc: The electrical pulses this Pokemon emits cause it to float in the air. When it burrows into the ground to gather nutrients from the soil, it releases waves that jam communication signals.
cobblemon.species.sleetle.name: Sleetle
cobblemon.species.sleetle.desc: Sleetle spends all day rolling a ball of snow around. This snowball actually contains frozen food collected from its surroundings that it will use as rations to sustain its evolution.
cobblemon.species.cacold.name: Cacold
cobblemon.species.cacold.desc: It hides in a cocoon made of snow and tree bark. When the seasons change and it becomes warmer outside, it thaws and evolves.
cobblemon.species.scaralanche.name: Scaralanche
cobblemon.species.scaralanche.desc: It's a sturdy Pokemon that tirelessly accumulates snow onto its snowball to make it bigger. When time comes to lay eggs, it hides them deep within the snowball to protect them from predators. Occasionally, it may roll the snowball down the mountain slopes, and anything trampled beneath it becomes food for the young Sleetle within.
cobblemon.species.aquaz.name: Aqua-Z
cobblemon.species.aquaz.desc: A high-tech artificial Pokemon designed to explore the deepest depths of the ocean. The bubble on its head contains a lens that lets it record what it finds, which can then be uploaded onto a computer for study.
cobblemon.species.auroreel.name: Auroreel
cobblemon.species.auroreel.desc: A rare and peaceful Pokemon, sailors fear its silhouette which resembles more dangerous Pokemon, but those courageous enough to approach it kindly are said to be blessed with good luck.
cobblemon.species.lurelit.name: Lurelit
cobblemon.species.lurelit.desc: A cave-dwelling Pokemon that leads prey astray with misleading beams of light. It hates the touch of sunlight.
cobblemon.species.grimfernal.name: Grimfernal
cobblemon.species.grimfernal.desc: Its glowing eye is shaped like a Poke Ball. The eye flickers enticingly while the rest of its body remains hidden in darkness.
cobblemon.species.skite.name: Skite
cobblemon.species.skite.desc: It floats in the wind, firmly anchored to the ground by the barbs on its tail. When in danger, it detaches itself and flutters away.
cobblemon.species.despairay.name: Despairay
cobblemon.species.despairay.desc: It swoops down and engulfs prey whole with its flat body. At the dawn of winter, Despairay migrate in great flocks to the warmer regions south, in such numbers that they may block out the sun.
cobblemon.species.channichill.name: Channichill
cobblemon.species.smolter.name: Smolter
cobblemon.species.smolter.desc: It eats hot coals to keep its heart burning. Because the energy produced inside them is more efficient than a regular coal engine, a crew of Smolter can keep a train running for weeks.
cobblemon.species.boilunk.name: Boilunk
cobblemon.species.boilunk.desc: It sprays suffocating smoke from the spout on top of its head. The whistle of a contented Boilunk is regarded as a sign of good luck by people in northern Ferroa and locomotive aficionados alike.
cobblemon.species.crystabrawl.name: Crystabrawl
cobblemon.species.crystabrawl.desc: Crystabrawl's body brims with energy that can't be contained, so it moves erratically. It always knows when its opponent will make a move, then swiftly blocks with one of its hands.
cobblemon.species.icicrawl.name: Icicrawl
cobblemon.species.icicrawl.desc: A film of ice-cold slime coats its body. By spitting this slime from its mouth, it aids humans in factories to keep machinery from overheating.
cobblemon.species.glacicrawl.name: Glacicrawl
cobblemon.species.glacicrawl.desc: It captures its food by freezing it with blasts of liquid nitrogen. Because it's totally blind, it detects movement with a thin net of ice along the ground.
cobblemon.species.velvedrake.name: Velvedrake
cobblemon.species.velvedrake.desc: This Pokemon's body is cold enough to quickly lower a room's temperature to freezing. It constantly shoots blasts of ice out of its shoulder vents.
cobblemon.species.snipion.name: Snipion
cobblemon.species.snipion.desc: In ancient seas, it held its prey down with its claws and stabbed them with its heavy tail. When this tail is reared up, it warns potential predators to stay away.
cobblemon.species.crozoicansnipion.name: Snipion
cobblemon.species.crozoicansnipion.desc: After hiding itself in mud or seaweed, it remains perfectly still, waiting for something to swim close. Then, it grabs its prey and repeatedly jabs it with its sharp tail.
cobblemon.species.chainscraw.name: Chainscraw
cobblemon.species.chainscraw.desc: It was part of a now-extinct lineage of Bug Pokemon relatives. The undersides of its claws spin and vibrate at such rates that it is easily able to grind through stone.
cobblemon.species.crozoicanchainscraw.de: The speed at which it can strike with its pincers is unmatched, able to shear a log in half in a blink. To keep the edges of its pincers sharp, it will claim a specific rock face as its personal whetstone.
cobblemon.species.enigmore.name: Enigmore
cobblemon.species.enigmore.desc: Schools of Enigmore dig for food with their clawed snouts. Its fossils, found in ancient shales, are among the oldest of all Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.oculustrous.name: Oculustrous
cobblemon.species.oculustrous.desc: It is thought to be the first creature to have evolved advanced intelligence, and that its psychic eye foretold its species' extinction.
cobblemon.species.remainstone.name: Remainstone
cobblemon.species.remainstone.desc: An attempted reconstruction from several shattered fossils resulted in this strange new Pokemon. It sometimes acts as though it is tethered between multiple different realities. (Resurrected from Broken Fossil)
cobblemon.species.broogah.name: Broogah
cobblemon.species.broogah.desc: An ancient Pokemon that builds tools and armor from stone. Though they have a tough and rugged exterior, they're known to be quite compassionate and cooperative among each other.
cobblemon.species.platoul.name: Platoul
cobblemon.species.platoul.desc: It wears a piece of metal like a mask to shield its face. Historically, Platoul wore discarded shields and armor, though modern Platoul are often found holding on to pieces of scrap metal instead.
cobblemon.species.victorelic.name: Victorelic
cobblemon.species.victorelic.desc: Victorelic frequently appear in the aftermath of a great catastrophe, salvaging the armor from fallen warriors and wearing it as a shell. At a glance, this Pokemon is sometimes mistaken for a loved one returned from the grave.
cobblemon.species.batellite.name: Batellite
cobblemon.species.batellite.desc: A spacefaring Pokemon that sleeps in the planet's orbit and enters the atmosphere to feed. If a manmade object in space suddenly breaks out of orbit, a jealous Batellite is likely to blame.
cobblemon.species.purrth.name: Purrth
cobblemon.species.purrth.desc: With its pair of beaks, it will deliver a vicious nip if handled. It takes a very skilled trainer to earn the trust of this skittish Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.terrachnid.name: Terrachnid
cobblemon.species.terrachnid.desc: It is able to maneuver easily across rough terrain as it stalks its prey, even able to walk on walls and ceilings to ambush an unsuspecting target.
cobblemon.species.miserachnid.name: Miserachnid
cobblemon.species.miserachnid.desc: It's told of in storybooks where it is a feared devourer of humans, and is hunted by a vengeful warrior who must slay it in its cavernous lair.
cobblemon.species.messoul.name: Messoul
cobblemon.species.messoul.desc: It came from a meteor that passed through a cloud of smog. Very large ones can be found near major cities and highways, gorging on the exhaust fumes of cars.
cobblemon.species.wastenaut.name: Wastenaut
cobblemon.species.wastenaut.desc: The interior of its tough skin is filled with toxic slime. It sucks up as much poison as it can hold, then explosively releases it all.
cobblemon.species.celestar.name: Celestar
cobblemon.species.celestar.desc: This Pokemon drifts through the upper atmosphere in large groups. It is made of a dense material not common on Earth.
cobblemon.species.celestroid.name: Celestroid
cobblemon.species.celestroid.desc: As Celestroid moves, it leaves behind a very long and bright trail of light. It is common practice in many parts of the world to wish upon a Celestroid as it flies overhead.
cobblemon.species.ufi.name: UFI
cobblemon.species.ufi.desc: An unidentified infantile Pokemon, from beyond the visible universe. It has taken up residence in the Oort Cloud.
cobblemon.species.wogglejr.name: Woggle Jr.
cobblemon.species.wogglejr.desc: (Grease type.) Woggle Jr. communities live a secluded life away from all other Pokemon. It is difficult to find one away from its family.
cobblemon.species.plantis.name: Plantis
cobblemon.species.plantis.desc: Their parents lay their eggs in the canopy of jungles, where they blend in. They make a high-pitched chirping noise so their parents can find them afterwards.
cobblemon.species.savantis.name: Savantis
cobblemon.species.savantis.desc: Despite being a cocoon, it is capable of limited movement. Air blowing through its shell's pores produces a flute-like sound.
cobblemon.species.vivantis.name: Vivantis
cobblemon.species.vivantis.desc: Its two massive claws are completely hollow. The sound they make as air flows through them stimulates plant life around it.
cobblemon.species.blastpole.name: Blastpole
cobblemon.species.blastpole.desc: It can blow fire out of a pore in its backside, propelling it through the air. The fire is fueled by toxins inside its body.
cobblemon.species.wogfire.name: Wogfire
cobblemon.species.wogfire.desc: The pores in its back lead to a sac of flammable, corrosive liquid. When Wogfire takes a blow, the liquid is forced out.
cobblemon.species.pyroad.name: Pyroad
cobblemon.species.pyroad.desc: Where Pyroad roams, it is revered as king. The thunderous croaks it lets out strikes fear in the hearts of any Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.aqualisk.name: Aqualisk
cobblemon.species.aqualisk.desc: Its paws are adhesive, which allow Aqualisk to climb both on walls and on the surface of water. It dives down when it is over a fish Pokemon to catch it.
cobblemon.species.pearlizz.name: Pearlizz
cobblemon.species.pearlizz.desc: It is impossible to separate it from the pearl it holds fiercely. When it has to move, it simply rolls the pearl along with it.
cobblemon.species.reptide.name: Reptide
cobblemon.species.reptide.desc: It is manipulative, commanding fish Pokemon to work as toadies for it. The pearls adorning its body focus its psychic energy into powerful beams.
cobblemon.species.whipcrat.name: Whipcrat
cobblemon.species.whipcrat.desc: Its tail always has a lot of tension held inside it. When threatened, it whips using its tail, releasing all the tension at once.
cobblemon.species.ratonine.name: Ratonine
cobblemon.species.ratonine.desc: Its tail splits into several prehensile whips. It also has a cruel fighting style; other Fighting-types don't like being associated with it.
cobblemon.species.hogspur.name: Hogspur
cobblemon.species.hogspur.desc: The fur on its back condenses into thick spikes that it uses for protection. When in danger, it curls up to become a spiked ball and rolls into the attacker.
cobblemon.species.knucquill.name: Knucquill
cobblemon.species.knucquill.desc: The spikes on its knuckles are unbreakable. A single punch can easily gouge its enemy's vital areas.
cobblemon.species.raddash.name: Raddash
cobblemon.species.raddash.desc: It lives its live underground near clear bodies of water, only its leaves showing. If uprooted, it will retaliate with a flurry of kicks before running off at high speeds.
cobblemon.species.parceps.name: Parceps
cobblemon.species.parceps.desc: It takes pride in the musculature of its immensely powerful legs. If another Parceps enters its territory, they have a 'pose-off', the loser being exiled from the area.
cobblemon.species.plastree.name: Plastree
cobblemon.species.plastree.desc: Its glossy body resembles a small plant. In barren wastelands and desert, they gather in great numbers pretending to be grass.
cobblemon.species.forestic.name: Forestic
cobblemon.species.forestic.desc: It is comfortable in the sand or floating above the water. They are known to ferry people from island to island.
cobblemon.species.chemito.name: Chemito
cobblemon.species.chemito.desc: Their abdomen contains dangerous chemicals that leach into the blood it drinks. It will only attack with it if absolutely necessary.
cobblemon.species.cyanidae.name: Cyanidae
cobblemon.species.cyanidae.desc: Cyanidae venom is potent enough to knock out a Thermedary. They lance their prey and slurp up blood in under a second.
cobblemon.species.bagly.name: Bagly
cobblemon.species.bagly.desc: It's face is supposedly so ugly it keeps itself hidden under a paper bag. It can commonly be seen around Poke Marts, scouring the dumpsters.
cobblemon.species.haggage.name: Haggage
cobblemon.species.haggage.desc: The bag mask around its head fits so tight it'd take a tow truck to pull it off. Anyone who sees its unmasked face is said to turn to dust.
cobblemon.species.pooyo.name: Pooyo
cobblemon.species.pooyo.desc: It's body is made mostly of extremely fertile soil. Wherever it roams, plants always grow behind it.
cobblemon.species.poogurt.name: Poogurt
cobblemon.species.poogurt.desc: As it eats a mostly herbivorous diet, they fiercely guard whatever crops they end up growing. Trained ones can replenish a farm in mere hours.
cobblemon.species.poolem.name: Poolem
cobblemon.species.poolem.desc: It drips soil infront of it which is flattened into neatly organized rows by it's rolling pin shaped arms. Anything that attacks it's farm is composted into the soil beneath it.
cobblemon.species.bulberry.name: Bulberry
cobblemon.species.bulberry.desc: The bulb on its backside attracts bugs at night. When the bugs touch the bulb, it electrocutes them and they are promptly eaten.
cobblemon.species.florascent.name: Florascent
cobblemon.species.florascent.desc: Its tongue can glow as bright as the sun when it's angry. They used to illuminate the lush jungles here, but deforestation and pollution drove them off.
cobblemon.species.gumuppi.name: Gumuppi
cobblemon.species.gumuppi.desc: Genetically engineered in a lab to sell as pets, but they managed to thrive in the wild once released. They are blind, and adept at smelling each other's blood.
cobblemon.species.finbred.name: Finbred
cobblemon.species.finbred.desc: Its diet consists mostly of other Gumuppi, which it hunts by smell. Dissection reveals that it actually does have eyes; its own skull has grown over them.
cobblemon.species.tangrue.name: Tangrue
cobblemon.species.tangrue.desc: Its tail has sharp spikes on the backside, which it curls into a leg-sized snare. It clamps shut as soon as its prey steps on it, allowing it to feed with ease.
cobblemon.species.hangrove.name: Hangrove
cobblemon.species.hangrove.desc: It hides in a tree, coils of its body hanging low to create a deadly trap. The spikes on its back have a thin hole at the tip it uses to drain the blood of anything that falls onto it.
cobblemon.species.eggue.name: Eggue
cobblemon.species.eggue.desc: It is a bird Pokemon's worst nightmare to find their eggs replaced with Eggue. Anything pulled into its shell is impossible to get back.
cobblemon.species.vomelet.name: Vomelet
cobblemon.species.vomelet.desc: Its shell is a foot thick and harder than stone. Its courtship ritual involves rolling into each other at ludicrous speed until one of them cracks.
cobblemon.species.crawjabby.name: Crawjabby
cobblemon.species.crawjabby.desc: Crawjabby are aquatic Pokemon that take pride in their fists. They live in solitude, engaging other Crawjabby in violent boxing matches.
cobblemon.species.lobbercut.name: Lobbercut
cobblemon.species.lobbercut.desc: What Lobbercut lacks in brains or brawn, it makes up for in confidence. It will continue to fight onwards no matter how hard the odds are stacked against it.
cobblemon.species.elekrab.name: Elekrab
cobblemon.species.elekrab.desc: It has two anemone Pokemon attached to its otherwise unimpressive claws. The anemones protect Elekrab with their paralyzing sting.
cobblemon.species.krustinger.name: Krustinger
cobblemon.species.krustinger.desc: Its anemone symbiotes have evolved, growing across its carapace as well. When it punches, it aims for the opponent's chest to stop their heart.
cobblemon.species.sakaline.name: Sakaline
cobblemon.species.sakaline.desc: It lives in polluted lakes. Poisonous water that flows through it exits clean and fresh enough to drink.
cobblemon.species.amoebolt.name: Amoebolt
cobblemon.species.amoebolt.desc: Pollutants processed by its cytoplasm are converted into electrical energy. This makes it one of the most versatile Pokemon when it comes to environmental preservation, being both a reliable source of renewable energy and a cleaner of oceanic pollution.
cobblemon.species.dumpchin.name: Dumpchin
cobblemon.species.dumpchin.desc: Decades ago, they were covered in sharp bristles. Nowadays, their skin is simply covered by a firm, but fuzzy mantle.
cobblemon.species.urchimpale.name: Urchimpale
cobblemon.species.urchimpale.desc: It gathers sharp trash and metal scrap and glues it onto its body using sludge and mud. The poison it naturally produces adds to the already dangerous rust on the metal it collects.
cobblemon.species.schwincer.name: Schwincer
cobblemon.species.schwincer.desc: An infamous kleptomaniac. Their claws are especially adept at gripping onto anything metal. Some people have become lost exploring their burrows, trying to strike it rich.
cobblemon.species.cleame.name: Cleame
cobblemon.species.cleame.desc: Notoriously easy to provoke and even easier to offend. When something upsets it greatly, steam puffs from holes on its shell.
cobblemon.species.furiousc.name: Furiousc
cobblemon.species.furiousc.desc: Its blood is so hot it begins to boil, heating the water around it. So much steam builds up in its shell that it creates a violent explosion when it releases it all.
cobblemon.species.clambat.name: Clambat
cobblemon.species.clambat.desc: Its long tongue is pure, densely packed muscle. It punches holes in the tidepool rocks to build its home inside of.
cobblemon.species.mussuplex.name: Mussuplex
cobblemon.species.mussuplex.desc: It has two tongues, one for attacking and the other for breathing. It can take in water to bulk up its dominant tongue even larger.
cobblemon.species.maptus.name: Maptus
cobblemon.species.maptus.desc: The sign attached to its tail is actually part of its body. It is covered in sharp spines which it uses to ambush bug Pokemon, its prey.
cobblemon.species.diverguare.name: Diverguare
cobblemon.species.diverguare.desc: It slowly crawls in one direction for days on end; whenever it changes direction, it grows a new spine. Old ones are covered in sharp spikes.
cobblemon.species.fungusite.name: Fungusite
cobblemon.species.fungusite.desc: This Pokemon controls its host's every move. It uses its disguise to enter its host's habitat unnoticed and spread itself to other Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.controll.name: Controll
cobblemon.species.controll.desc: It lives and hides under bridges and other man-made structures. When a person or Pokemon approaches, it sprays them with toxic spores.
cobblemon.species.decomposite.name: Decomposite
cobblemon.species.decomposite.desc: Anything grabbed by its tentacles is instantly bended to its will. The husks of former hosts are arranged in its lair like trophies.
cobblemon.species.dubalae.name: Dubalae
cobblemon.species.dubalae.desc: Its thin shell holds an alkaline material which it uses to produce electricity. Wrapping a cord around its leg will transfer its electrical energy to any device.
cobblemon.species.batterode.name: Batterode
cobblemon.species.batterode.desc: It has grown too big for its shell, breaking it apart. The flaky substance making up its body is corrosive enough to burn through lead.
cobblemon.species.camelt.name: Camelt
cobblemon.species.camelt.desc: Its hump is full of water, which is constantly boiling from its body heat. Contracting its hump allows it to erupt boiling water everywhere.
cobblemon.species.thermedary.name: Thermedary
cobblemon.species.thermedary.desc: One of the most important species in southern Enriko. Travelers will use Camboil's hump to boil food in. It can even be used as a mobile hot spring.
cobblemon.species.womblock.name: Womblock
cobblemon.species.womblock.desc: They chew rocks into perfect cubes with their teeth and use the bricks to build shelter. It is believed they inspired the invention of bricks and mortar.
cobblemon.species.harihary.name: Harihary
cobblemon.species.harihary.desc: An extremely elusive Pokemon that supposedly only lives deep in the darkest woods. Anybody who claims to have seen one also claims it disappeared in a puff of scraggly hairs upon capture.
cobblemon.species.wigfoot.name: Wigfoot
cobblemon.species.wigfoot.desc: It stomps around the deepest forests in Enriko, leaving huge footprints and a trail of hair behind it. Its fur goes for a fortune in certain markets.
cobblemon.species.fleesquach.name: Fleesquach
cobblemon.species.fleesquach.desc: The only evidence of Fleesquach existing is a blurry video taken decades ago. Other cases of Fleesquach sightings are quickly laughed off or ignored.
cobblemon.species.conkid.name: Conkid
cobblemon.species.conkid.desc: Highly social, known to get very uncomfortable outside of its group. They sleep in huge piles to protect eachother and preserve body heat.
cobblemon.species.bonkrete.name: Bonkrete
cobblemon.species.bonkrete.desc: Their heavy bodies are made by Conkid, fusing together at the edges. While it is notoriously difficult to break through, they will separate if things get rough.
cobblemon.species.khancrete.name: Khancrete
cobblemon.species.khancrete.desc: It swings its head, recklessly throwing its wrecking ball about to destroy anything in its wake. They have a rivalry with Conkeldurr.
cobblemon.species.cemu.name: Cemu
cobblemon.species.cemu.desc: Their feathers provide perfect camouflage in the sand. Despite their small stature, they pack a vicious kick.
cobblemon.species.solkiwi.name: Solkiwi
cobblemon.species.osstillery.name: Osstillery
cobblemon.species.figura.name: Figura
cobblemon.species.figura.desc: Believed to be summoned via ancient cave drawings. Figura is two-dimensional; it will always appear flat from any angle to an observer.
cobblemon.species.tofigur.name: Tofigur
cobblemon.species.tofigur.desc: It is curious and seems to study the three dimensional world around it. If one were to look at it from the side, they would find it to be infinitely thin and dangerously sharp.
cobblemon.species.velveil.name: Velveil
cobblemon.species.velveil.desc: Groups of Velveil form in circles under the light of the full moon and stare up at the moon overhead. It is impossible to distract them during their ritual.
cobblemon.species.lunartic.name: Lunartic
cobblemon.species.lunartic.desc: Its appearance underneath its cloak is distressing to the point of causing insanity if viewed for too long. You can tell a Lunartic's age through the velvet on its arm.
cobblemon.species.encyst.name: Encyst
cobblemon.species.encyst.desc: It can't survive long without a host, so seeing one in the wild is rare. Their eggs are laid under the skin of Probee and goomyroast.
cobblemon.species.decapasite.name: Decapasite
cobblemon.species.decapasite.desc: Decapasite's venom is sterile, which prevents the head it lives in from rotting. They lure in prey with odd signals before injecting eggs into them.
cobblemon.species.syreist.name: Syreist
cobblemon.species.syreist.desc: Its eyeball is its main body, and it feeds off of bacteria. It latches onto sick people during the night, sucking their blood to keep itself nourished.
cobblemon.species.injectoplasm.name: Injectoplasm
cobblemon.species.injectoplasm.desc: Its body contains a woopertail of hideous bloodborne illnesses. Entire towns can be shut down because of Injectoplasm sightings.
cobblemon.species.wanupp.name: Wanupp
cobblemon.species.wanupp.desc: Its unassuming appearance masks a very malicious personality. Its cap is covered in spore-filled slime that causes necrosis instantly if touched.
cobblemon.species.sluggummy.name: Sluggummy
cobblemon.species.sluggummy.desc: It leaves a trail of sticky slime behind itself as it moves. The trail is sweet, leading predators to go after the slime instead of itself.
cobblemon.species.gumsopod.name: Gumsopod
cobblemon.species.gumsopod.desc: Its shell is made of 38 different layers of sugar. If swallowed, a Gumsopod can survive in the stomach for up to 7 years.
cobblemon.species.whelasse.name: Whelasse
cobblemon.species.whelasse.desc: Whelasse's hide is so rubbery that it's impossible to take a bite out of. Would-be predators attack it, only to fall into its gaping mouth.
cobblemon.species.derpants.name: Derpants
cobblemon.species.derpants.desc: It lives an amphibious lifestyle, as it is constantly producing a sweat-like poisonous film around itself that repels water.
cobblemon.species.laundronaut.name: Laundronaut
cobblemon.species.laundronaut.desc: If you see a heap of clothes in the wilderness, stay away! It's a sleeping Laundronaut - when grumpy, they spray noxious fumes everywhere.
cobblemon.species.chrone.name: Chrone
cobblemon.species.chrone.desc: A presumably manmade Pokemon that can be seen spying on people. It seems to subsist solely on visual stimulation, as it can only die if its lens is blocked for too long.
cobblemon.species.reconuisance.name: Reconuisance
cobblemon.species.reconuisance.desc: Its lens can zoom in extremely far, allowing it to watch a single person from a mile away. It can relay what it has seen like a projector to its trainer, should it trust them.
cobblemon.species.wotwot.name: Wotwot
cobblemon.species.wotwot.desc: Wotwot will do the bidding of whatever they look up to, no matter how dark or unsafe the job is. For this reason, they're often stereotyped as 'evil' Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.dunnoboss.name: Dunnoboss
cobblemon.species.dunnoboss.desc: Dunnoboss will never abandon whatever duty they are given. Fancy establishments tend to hire them as bouncers.
cobblemon.species.steank.name: Steank
cobblemon.species.steank.desc: (Hemo type.) Although it resembles a slab of meat, this Pokemon tastes incredibly foul. It tends to wander around without aim or purpose, as if entranced by something.
cobblemon.species.infesteak.name: Infesteak
cobblemon.species.infesteak.desc: (Hemo/Poison type.) The worm embedded in its body impairs its vision, but also alerts it to danger. The bone in its gut can be removed and used as a weapon.
cobblemon.species.wormeaty.name: Wormeaty
cobblemon.species.wormeaty.desc: (Hemo/Poison type.)A vast colony of symbiotic worms slithers in and out of its body. The worms govern its every move, although they cannot suppress its hunger.
cobblemon.species.maglut.name: Maglut
cobblemon.species.maglut.desc: They feed on rotting things and other inedible substances, taking in enormous amounts of food at a time. They appear in the hundreds if they find a stable food source.
cobblemon.species.scavengore.name: Scavengore
cobblemon.species.scavengore.desc: Actually a colony of multiple Maglut, with different specialized forms serving different roles for the colony. They'll disperse if threatened, but will come back together when the coast is clear.
cobblemon.species.wrigormort.name: Wrigormort
cobblemon.species.wrigormort.desc: Notorious for defiling graves to search for food, able to strip meat from an entire carcass in minutes. When in danger, it regurgitates rotting meat.
cobblemon.species.lymfite.name: Lymfite
cobblemon.species.lymfite.desc: It marks its territory with hyper-sterile blue goo it produces from its fingertips. If it sees a poison-type, it goes on a rampage.
cobblemon.species.leukofite.name: Leukofite
cobblemon.species.leukofite.desc: It can see bacteria and viruses on any surface, sending it into an outrage. Anything it deems unclean is drowned in its slime.
cobblemon.species.ceresplit.name: Ceresplit
cobblemon.species.ceresplit.desc: An elusive lava-bodied Pokemon that only grows a protective shell on one half of its body. If, by accident, it were to grow one on the other half, it would break it off. Nobody really knows why it does this.
cobblemon.species.probee.name: Probee
cobblemon.species.probee.desc: Each individual Probee is nearly identical. They have weak telepathic abilities, mostly used to communicate with eachother.
cobblemon.species.dysolony.name: Dysolony
cobblemon.species.dysolony.desc: Its abdomen is made out of a substance it produces which is lighter than foam but harder than titanium. Thousands of 'drones' live in its abdomen, repairing breaks in the hull and fending off attackers.
cobblemon.species.tictoc.name: Tictoc
cobblemon.species.tictoc.desc: An ancient Pokemon with impeccable foresight. It is impossible to get the upper hand on it, as it can read the future almost perfectly.
cobblemon.species.outatime.name: Outatime
cobblemon.species.outatime.desc: Its body is made of thousands of moving parts, which seem to affect the time-space continuum around it. It can travel into the past and future at will, making it extremely hard to capture.
cobblemon.species.wahundo.name: Wahundo
cobblemon.species.wahundo.desc: Its diet consists mostly of cotton and paper. It lays flat on its face to imitate a regular dollar so unaware explorers will hopefully take it.
cobblemon.species.swallet.name: Swallet
cobblemon.species.swallet.desc: Their mouth generally remains closed at all times, to keep the hoard of money inside. It only opens it when absolutely necessary to pelt an attacker with an onslaught of coins.
cobblemon.species.pleech.name: Pleech
cobblemon.species.pleech.desc: Their sucker-shaped heads are flexible. Once it latches onto an artery or vein, it thrusts in and out, forcing blood to the surface like a plunger.
cobblemon.species.denartery.name: Denartery
cobblemon.species.denartery.desc: It has grown to take on a more predatory lifestyle. Old habits die hard, though, as it is commonly seen trying to latch onto a larger Pokemon and getting dragged around uncomfortably.
cobblemon.species.psyrus.name: Psyrus
cobblemon.species.psyrus.desc: They tend to pop up in heavily diseased areas. It can cut through flesh with its legs, but it won't cause any pain at all.
cobblemon.species.adnaviria.name: Adnaviria
cobblemon.species.adnaviria.desc: Its strange, warped anatomy is the result of mutations in its genetic makeup. Its legs are surgically sharp and leave wounds completely sterile, making it a lifesaver in the operating room.
cobblemon.species.caecarette.name: Caecarette
cobblemon.species.caecarette.desc: While they normally live buried in the ash of volcanoes, global warming has led to their spread to urban environments. When threatened, they belch out clouds of smoke.
cobblemon.species.tobamander.name: Tobamander
cobblemon.species.tobamander.desc: Feeding off of rare herbs, each Tobamander's smoke has a distinct smell. When they shed, the old skin is burnt off, leaving trails of ash.
cobblemon.species.planeedle.name: Planeedle
cobblemon.species.planeedle.desc: It fishes for prey with its pointed tail, which is also used in battles for territory. The loser must leave the swamp forever.
cobblemon.species.dualance.name: Dualance
