cobblemon.species.tullabaloo.desc: It was thought that just looking at it was enough to leave a person in a confused stupor, but it's really caused by accidentally breathing in the gas that it uses to float.
cobblemon.species.drambam.name: Drambam
cobblemon.species.drambam.desc: An inelegant swimmer with few remarkable qualities that has nonetheless captivated all those lucky to witness it. When it opens its jawless mouth, it takes in water and filters out the edible bits.
cobblemon.species.takoyuki.name: Takoyuki
cobblemon.species.squicecone.name: Squicecone
cobblemon.species.dangoceras.name: Dangoceras
cobblemon.species.dangoceras.desc: Its icy shell moved from its head to its tentacles to allow room for its three brains to grow, heightening its mental prowess to incredible degrees at the cost of its mobility.
cobblemon.species.tenkoi.name: Tenkoi
cobblemon.species.tenchondri.name: Tenchondri
cobblemon.species.tenchondri.desc: It feeds on lost souls, detected with its sensitive nose. If you find yourself besieged by one, throw a handful of pepper at it, and it will sneeze, sending it back where it came from.
cobblemon.species.gustwee.name: Gustwee
cobblemon.species.gustwee.desc: They fly in great numbers with incredible coordination. Sometimes, what might be mistaken for a cloud is actually a massive flock of Gustwee.
cobblemon.species.elegyre.name: Elegyre
cobblemon.species.elegyre.desc: It uses its beak as a dowsing rod in search of clean water. It's regarded as a herald of calm seas, as entire flocks of Elegyre can divert away heavy storms with their wingbeats.
cobblemon.species.palagaia.name: Palagaia
cobblemon.species.palagaia.desc: Powerful swipes from its tail can easily fell a tree. In ancient times, its fossils had been used to forge weapons and armor.
cobblemon.species.ginkorale.name: Ginkorale
cobblemon.species.pachibrik.name: Pachibrik
cobblemon.species.pachibrik.desc: By forming and shoveling blocks of ice with its nose, it diligently builds sturdy barriers to protect its herd.
cobblemon.species.pachicorn.name: Pachicorn
cobblemon.species.pachicorn.desc: It plows snow to repair the ice covering its broad nose. Most of its apparent 'fur' is actually just snow piled up onto its thin feather coat; it keeps warm just fine primarily from its sheer size.
cobblemon.species.onsentient.name: Onsentient
cobblemon.species.onsentient.desc: Entire hot springs are often formed by a troop of Onsentient hibernating in the mountains. It has a jolly personality, and gladly allows others to enjoy the warm, clean water it produces.
cobblemon.species.stegairy.name: Stegairy
cobblemon.species.stegairy.desc: It can fly by using its broad plates, even fearlessly leaping from cliffs to evade danger, so it's very rarely seen. It's proven quite easy to tame and ride.
cobblemon.species.reptor.name: Reptor
cobblemon.species.reptor.desc: An armored pack hunter that uses speed and cunning to bring down its prey. However, it seems to have mysteriously appeared in its environment very suddenly, suggesting an unnatural origin.
cobblemon.species.ordovice.name: Ordovice
cobblemon.species.ordovice.desc: After a series of mysterious beaching events, it crawled out of the sea one night. With a beat of its tail, it could freeze the ocean and strip it of its life-bearing productivity.
cobblemon.species.permiblaze.name: Permiblaze
cobblemon.species.permiblaze.desc: It emerged from the depths of the earth one day. It implacably charges forth like a wildfire, consuming all in its path and growing exponentially larger.
cobblemon.species.kretozone.name: Kretozone
cobblemon.species.kretozone.desc: Arriving from distant space, it heralds the end of a dynasty. The flapping of its wings is said to rain down meteorites upon the land.
cobblemon.species.ucarya.name: Ucarya
cobblemon.species.ucarya.desc: An incredibly primordial organism. Its knuckles conceal retractable tentacles that it can use to record and copy the DNA of other beings.
cobblemon.species.bulbite.name: Bulbite
cobblemon.species.bulbite.desc: In the day, Bulbite screw themselves into empty lightbulb sockets in abandoned houses. They fly around at dusk absorbing electricity from power lines, generators, and the occasional electric car.
cobblemon.species.lampire.name: Lampire
cobblemon.species.lampire.desc: Flying around with their bulb powered down, Lampire drop in front of other unsuspecting Electric types, stunning them with a powerful blast of light. They then drain their victim's electricity reserves, before vanishing into the night.
cobblemon.species.obliterat.name: Obliterat
cobblemon.species.obliterat.desc: Obliterat arrived on the island of Harsholme on a ship, where they proceeded to decimate the local ecosystem. Fortunately, they have been brought down to a manageable number in recent years. However, as a result, their anger towards humans has never been higher.
cobblemon.species.exverminate.name: Exverminate
cobblemon.species.exverminate.desc: The ominous way Exverminate floats across the floor leaves many disturbed. What some believe to be hands are actually its two tails.
cobblemon.species.wicruet.name: Wicruet
cobblemon.species.wicruet.desc: A very persistent Mon, Wicruet can gather a following like no other. Its vessel contains water, which is thought to symbolise the sweat and tears it pours into attaining evolution. Legends state that a holy man once visited Tonbury Town with a Wicruet.
cobblemon.species.eucharite.name: Eucharite
cobblemon.species.eucharite.desc: Upon evolution the water in its vessel has turned into a sweet red wine, which Eucharite shares freely with its following, never seeming to deplete no matter the numbers.
cobblemon.species.punkyhunk.name: Punkyhunk
cobblemon.species.punkyhunk.desc: Punkyhunk are rather sweet and shy, despite their appearance. However, most of this perculiar mon's attempts at making friends end in tears.
cobblemon.species.carvesque.name: Carvesque
cobblemon.species.carvesque.desc: Carvesque, embittered by how it was mistreated, has adopted a smug and pompous demeanour. It hates to listen to its trainer.
cobblemon.species.palodefena.name: Palodefena
cobblemon.species.palodefena.desc: This tiny Pokemon curls up inside its shell when attacked. Despite only learning the weakest, most basic attacks, it makes up for it with a sturdy defence.
cobblemon.species.paloshield.name: Paloshield
cobblemon.species.paloshield.desc: Having solidified, Pentashield's defence has increased tenfold. Now too heavy to hang from trees, it's not uncommon for passing trainers to trip over Pentashield that have fallen from branches.
cobblemon.species.escutchidae.name: Escutchidae
cobblemon.species.escutchidae.desc: Scientists aren't sure how Escutchidae manage to fly with such heavy bodies. In times of crisis, Escutchidae wrap their wings around their faces, causing them to drop from the sky like a bowling ball.
cobblemon.species.mouhemian.name: Mouhemian
cobblemon.species.mouhemian.desc: Mouhemian are passive, sometimes to a fault. They rarely bathe, so aren't popular with urban-dwelling trainers; more alternative, travelling trainers love it however. Their large, misty eyes have been the subject of many traditional folk songs.
cobblemon.species.herburrow.name: Herburrow
cobblemon.species.herburrow.desc: Often found buried in soil, sleeping Herburrow's leaves have become a source of macronutrients for local Stug populations. Fortunately these curious creatures grow extremely quickly, making them very popular with students of herbalism.
cobblemon.species.professherb.name: Professherb
cobblemon.species.professherb.desc: Professherb love nothing more than to bestow their wisdom to humans, sometimes tearing their own leaves out to demonstrate the remedial properties. These leaves will grown back within 24 hours.
cobblemon.species.yoink.name: Yoink
cobblemon.species.yoink.desc: Yoink hide in orchards, patiently waiting for farmers to take their eyes off the trees. When they do, Yoink steal as much fruit as they can hold, before hightailing it back to their dens.
cobblemon.species.hogrump.name: Hogrump
cobblemon.species.hogrump.desc: Now much larger and belligerent in nature, it's impossible for Hogrump to steal fruit without getting caught by farmers. As a result, they bully and steal instead from weaker Yoink.
cobblemon.species.stug.name: Stug
cobblemon.species.stug.desc: Stug are the ultimate pest, with their metal bodies withstanding even the most concentrated insecticide. They have evolved to be able to eat literally anything organic, ranging from vegetables and plants, to other deceased Pokemon. Whilst this sounds bleak, Stug are essential parts of their local ecosystem.
cobblemon.species.chainsnail.name: Chainsnail
cobblemon.species.chainsnail.desc: With their metal bodies getting significantly heavier upon evolution, Chainsnail are the slowest Pokemon encounterable in Lonava, second to Stug. Their eyestalks are extremely sensitive, and retract when Chainsnail feel threatened.
cobblemon.species.dorhouse.name: Dorhouse
cobblemon.species.dorhouse.desc: Dorhouse carry around a hollowed wooden stump, which at night they climb inside and sleep. Locals know not to disturb the stumps should they find one, instead leaving fruit offerings outside.
cobblemon.species.nomadent.name: Nomadent
cobblemon.species.nomadent.desc: Leaving its stump house behind, Nomadent has packed its belongings and taken to the road. They prefer to travel at night, sleeping inside tree hollows during the day.
cobblemon.species.cygnicuffs.name: Cygnicuffs
cobblemon.species.cygnicuffs.desc: Cygnicuffs are scrappy, often found fighting with their siblings. When they come of fledging age and evolve, they leave their parent Swallops, heading out into the world alone.
cobblemon.species.swallop.name: Swallop
cobblemon.species.swallop.desc: These waterbirds mate for life, only settling down with a Swallop of equal strength. They battle relentlessly to pick their partner, resulting in the creation of the Lonavan Society for the Protection of Birds  or the LSPB  whose members hide near lakes, waiting to jump in and apply medical aid to injured Swallop.
cobblemon.species.shrey.name: Shrude
cobblemon.species.shrey.desc: Shrude are notoriously savvy, often liberating food from pantries by squeezing through holes the size of a pencil and unlocking doors with their key-shaped tail.
cobblemon.species.ashrute.name: Ashrute
cobblemon.species.ashrute.desc: Ashrute are now too big to fit through small gaps, as a result their snouts have become more adept at unlocking doors. They favour the night, and can often be found in the day curled up asleep in dense underbrush.
cobblemon.species.polebite.name: Polebite
cobblemon.species.polebite.desc: Ecologically similar to Bulbite, Polebite swim in shallow ponds and urban canals. They charge up static as they swim, ready to share with any other of its species.
cobblemon.species.flightjar.name: Flightjar
cobblemon.species.flightjar.desc: They nest on the ground in the day, often startling walkers, and on the odd and often tragic occasion, drivers. As night falls, their calls can be heard all across the region.
cobblemon.species.fungroove.name: Fungroove
cobblemon.species.fungroove.desc: This spongy Pokmon loves nothing more than a good bassline, often spurred on by their own psychedelic spores. If you ever wish to find a Fungroove, play music in a forest clearing.
cobblemon.species.discodelic.name: Discodelic
cobblemon.species.discodelic.desc: Discodelic light up any space they sashay into, emitting psychedelic but harmless spores into the air. It's not uncommon to find forest raves organised by these radiant Pokmon.
cobblemon.species.agog.name: Agog
cobblemon.species.agog.desc: Agog are kindhearted, often grouping together to protect vulnerable forest areas. It's said if you burn an Agog, accidentally or deliberately, the devil appears.
cobblemon.species.demagog.name: Demagog
cobblemon.species.demagog.desc: When set alight, usually by candles placed in its mouth, Agog evolve, becoming wrathful in the process. Demagog rule over forests by exploiting the fears and insecurities of its inhabitants.
cobblemon.species.seekadeer.name: Seekadeer
cobblemon.species.seekadeer.desc: The antlers of a Seekadeer still contain toxins after their shedding season. They only venture out after the sun sets, draining the blood of sleeping Pokmon.
cobblemon.species.redear.name: Redear
cobblemon.species.redear.desc: Viewed as sacred and favoured by druids, seeing this fragile Pokemon means that you will soon experience great happiness. Its nimble nature allows it to avoid predators with ease, silently moving through forests and thickets.
cobblemon.species.deerie.name: Deerie
cobblemon.species.deerie.desc: After a life of constant roaming across the Lonavan wilderness, Deerie learn how to move beyond physicality itself. When a Deerie is sighted, it is taken as an omen of something catastrophic to come. The Spell Tags hanging from its antlers are said to ward off a 'ceaseless evil.'
cobblemon.species.morbod.name: Morbod
cobblemon.species.morbod.desc: Its glowing eyes and aloof personality startle many that stumble upon it, allowing it to avoid capture. Cryptozoologists suspect that Morbod play a significant part in local folktales, with their eerie cries resembling crying babies.
cobblemon.species.bodmeast.name: Bodmeast
cobblemon.species.bodmeast.desc: The subject of many local legends, these evasive creatures have become known as the Beasts of Tonbury. No official records of Bodmeast exist, only blurry photographs, pawprints, and the occasional clump of its sharp, wiry fur.
cobblemon.species.standeolith.name: Standeolith
cobblemon.species.standeolith.desc: Constructed 5000 years ago from stones dragged hundreds of miles, Standeolith were supposedly animated by ancient settlers. The symbol on their center stone is believed to mean 'motion'.
cobblemon.species.predictabun.name: Predictabun
cobblemon.species.predictabun.desc: It has very mild extrasensory perception, making it able to anticipate its opponent's attacks on occasion. Unfortunately their round bodies and small feet mean that very rarely are they able to actually dodge these moves.
cobblemon.species.harevoyant.name: Harevoyant
cobblemon.species.harevoyant.desc: Harevoyant are commonly found in thick grasslands, where they teleport around erratically to avoid predators. Their feet are considered lucky in Lonavan culture, with many merchants selling ceramic replicas.
cobblemon.species.boilink.name: Boilink
cobblemon.species.boilink.desc: Boilink find food by heating small bodies of water, then eating whatever floats to the surface first. Their glistening coats are the envy of both Pokemon and trainers alike.
cobblemon.species.morbotch.name: Morbotch
cobblemon.species.morbotch.desc: A bastardised attempt to recreate the illusive Morbod from a child's drawing. Following activist intervention, several specimens managed to escape the lab and breed, ravaging many local ecosystems. As a result of this, they're often bullied by wild Pokemon, though they're not smart enough to understand why.
cobblemon.species.bodmess.name: Bodmess
cobblemon.species.bodmess.desc: The sound of this clumsy but well-meaning creature hopping around often scares away others, worried that it'll embarrass them with its awkward features and dopey demeanour. Despite all this, with the help of a loving trainer, Bodmess can become quite agile.
cobblemon.species.willowanne.name: Willowanne
cobblemon.species.willowanne.desc: Willowanne languidly stroll through fields on sunny days, hoping their dry skin catches alight in a spectacular show of fire.
cobblemon.species.aromatick.name: Aromatick
cobblemon.species.aromatick.desc: Disguising itself as a flower, Aromatick emits a sweet fragrance to lure in unsuspecting prey. Several diseases have been attributed to this Pokmon. As a result, many Lonavans refuse to wear shorts when walking through grass, even in Summer.
cobblemon.species.fragrantick.name: Fragrantick
cobblemon.species.fragrantick.desc: Fragrantick disguise themselves as berries and cling to trees and bushes with their hind legs, waiting for prey to walk past. Their long proboscis is able to both suck out blood, and inject a debilitating poison.
cobblemon.species.altarock.name: Altarock
cobblemon.species.altarock.desc: Altarock are peaceful, sociable creatures that love to be useful. What many believe to be a mouth is actually a hollow, druids were said to place candles inside their mouths when praying.
cobblemon.species.caltarcite.name: Caltarcite
cobblemon.species.caltarcite.desc: Despite a natural hatred of water, Caltarcite are often found around ceremonial baths. Their flat heads are perfect for placing candles and other ritualistic items on.
cobblemon.species.theragong.name: Theragong
cobblemon.species.theragong.desc: Theragong emit calming vibrations from their metal disc. They're popular among complementary therapists, practitioners of alternative medicine and ASMR fanatics alike.
cobblemon.species.kyuukit.name: Kyuukit
cobblemon.species.kyuukit.desc: Kyuukit adore hot springs, especially those found near the western seaboard of Lonava. These scrappy Pokemon can alter the humidity of the surrounding air to slow down their opponents, though it usually leaves their fur very poofy.
cobblemon.species.kitsunny.name: Kitsunny
cobblemon.species.kitsunny.desc: These Pokemon appear during droughts, summoning prevailing rains that rehydrate land deemed cruel by the sun. Originally discovered in Okeno, Kitsunny in Lonava are popular amongst doctors for their healing skills, but also because of their calming dispositions.
cobblemon.species.scaldrip.name: Scaldrip
cobblemon.species.scaldrip.desc: Scaldrip are feisty and unpredictable, often transforming the landscape of their habitat by blasting a combination of blistering water and jagged rocks at the walls of their caves. Spas will often employ Scaldrip to regulate the humidity of their steam rooms.
cobblemon.species.dousear.name: Dousear
cobblemon.species.dousear.desc: Absorbing water through their porous scales, Dousear keep the environment around them heavily misted. All that pass through its mist cite the soothing effect it has.
cobblemon.species.geyseror.name: Geyseror
cobblemon.species.geyseror.desc: Each Geyseror has a unique hissing sound as it emits steam. Despite its fearsome appearance, locals are fond of these 'singing' Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.mellowick.name: Mellowick
cobblemon.species.mellowick.desc: Mellowick's burning wax body emits the most divine scent, which changes depending on its mood. Candlemakers from all over the world have tried to reproduce these scents, with little success. Lonavan artisans know the secret, but refuse to share the formula, only ever bringing it out for specific occasions.
cobblemon.species.rewaxation.name: Rewaxation
cobblemon.species.rewaxation.desc: The smell of a Rewaxation is usually the first thing any tourist will experience when they first step into Lonava. They have a good-natured disposition, but aren't afraid to defend themselves should any mons attracted by their scent get a bit too close.
cobblemon.species.foreminn.name: Foreminn
cobblemon.species.foreminn.desc: Foreminn are only found deep underground in very specific bodies of water, far from the ocean. It's believed they swim for miles through complex cave systems in search of a particular plant.
cobblemon.species.finpact.name: Finpact
cobblemon.species.finpact.desc: Finpact use their incredibly hard heads to break through rocks in search of their favourite plants. Folklore suggest they were shaped out of mud and then animated by a mystical being.
cobblemon.species.brunelectric.name: Brunelectric
cobblemon.species.brunelectric.desc: Created by an esteemed civil engineer, Brunelectric are remnants of a previous era. The mere fact that they are still going centuries later is a testament to the genius of their maker.
cobblemon.species.avocadoze.name: Avocadoze
cobblemon.species.avocadoze.desc: This sleepy Pokemon never wakes for anything, often leaving it vulnerable to predators. As a result of this, Avocadoze has become an endangered species. If spotted, Lonavan locals will place them somewhere obscured and away from harm.
cobblemon.species.avocallite.name: Avocallite
cobblemon.species.avocallite.desc: Through evolution Avocallite has gained the power of levitation, helping it keep far from the reach of predators. It's unknown which part of Avocallite is the Pokemon: the seed, the fruit slice, or both.
cobblemon.species.jarmalade.name: Jarmalade
cobblemon.species.jarmalade.desc: Jarmalade love nothing more than being placed on a shelf. Specialist glassmakers train for years to be able to make replacement jars that won't shatter upon impact.
cobblemon.species.jamphibian.name: Jamphibian
cobblemon.species.jamphibian.desc: Their dramatic evolutionary change has baffled scientists for years, along with questions over how it retains its form without the glass jar it formally lived in.
cobblemon.species.charitot.name: Charitot
cobblemon.species.charitot.desc: Charitot are unconditionally kind from the moment they hatch. Regardless of their trainer's intentions, it will support them. When it reaches evolution, it'll try to steer its trainer towards a more charitable path, usually with success.
cobblemon.species.agapray.name: Agapray
cobblemon.species.agapray.desc: This loving Pokemon is often found working in hospitals, assisting medics in the field, or running clinics out of caves or trees to help injured wild Pokemon. Their acts of kindness come without expectation, and many respect Agapray for this reason.
cobblemon.species.boongus.name: Boongus
cobblemon.species.boongus.desc: Though it appears to be a ghost, Boongus is actually a mushroom. The 'eyes' on its cap are coagulated poison, it's strongly advised not to touch them.
cobblemon.species.oogashroomga.name: Oogashroomga
cobblemon.species.oogashroomga.desc: Trying to look underneath Oogashroomga's cap is a sure-fire way to get yourself hurt. It lumbers and throws its tendrils around to scare off predators.
cobblemon.species.gassault.name: Gassault
cobblemon.species.gassault.desc: Gassault are brutal pranksters, attacking passing trainers with a Shadow Punch before vanishing into the dark. Their violent nature culminates in trainers widely avoiding raising one, in fear of constant attack.
cobblemon.species.goldenghast.name: Goldenghast
cobblemon.species.goldenghast.desc: Supposedly immortal, Goldenghast love nothing more than shiny metals. Churches often keep one around to protect their precious artefacts from thieves.
cobblemon.species.burnshee.name: Burnshee
cobblemon.species.burnshee.desc: When Burnshee gets going, there's no stopping it. The tears it sheds have been compared to molten rock, with local merchants sometimes turning them into sellable jewellery. Despite being a fire type, touching its flames doesn't hurt, your hand just goes straight through.
cobblemon.species.dragimo.name: Dragimo
cobblemon.species.dragimo.desc: To avoid being eaten, these tiny creatures huddle tightly to form a 'carpet', disguising themselves as moss. Their spongy backs can absorb the weight of a human with ease.
cobblemon.species.sphagern.name: Sphagern
cobblemon.species.sphagern.desc: Gaining size during evolution, the now more conspicuous Sphagern set off alone. When frightened or tired, they can blend into the surrounding landscape, appearing to be a mossy hummock.
cobblemon.species.humpeat.name: Humpeat
cobblemon.species.humpeat.desc: Despite being the largest non-legendary Pokemon native to Lonava, Humpeat are extremely difficult to find. Their ability to blend into the surrounding landscape is truly astonishing, gaining them the nickname of 'moving mountain range'.
cobblemon.species.moortaur.name: Moortaur
cobblemon.species.moortaur.desc: These cumbersome and strong Pokemon roam the moors of Lonava. Their stubborn disposition has made their species impossible to domesticate.
cobblemon.species.druidune.name: Druidune
cobblemon.species.druidune.desc: Druidune are usually found on beaches, where they like to blend in amongst the sand dunes. The extensive roots of its kelp antlers help its body maintain form on windy days.
cobblemon.species.pagune.name: Pagune
cobblemon.species.pagune.desc: When it finds a shell it likes, Druidune evolves and multiplies in a process called binary fission. Both heads are identical in biological composition, but only the original head retains its kelp antlers; this new head instead adorns itself with the shell it found.
cobblemon.species.threemasune.name: Threemasune
cobblemon.species.threemasune.desc: Having added another head, Threemasume is now significantly more intelligent than its pre-evolved forms. What appear to be antlers are pieces of dead coral that broke off and washed up on the dunes it inhabits.
cobblemon.species.bluboon.name: Bluboon
cobblemon.species.bluboon.desc: Bluboon move through water by condensing the air in their inflatable sac. Their tentacles are ice cold, allowing Bluboon to easily stun anything passing by.
cobblemon.species.tentaclubble.name: Tentaclubble
cobblemon.species.tentaclubble.desc: Locals are warned to leave wandering Tentaclubble alone. Even brushing by their razor-tipped tentacles is known to cause severe frostbite.
cobblemon.species.sealver.name: Sealver
cobblemon.species.sealver.desc: Their metallic bodies reflect light even underwater, making them easy for conservationists to track. They're often found sunbathing on beaches, or bobbing around harbours.
cobblemon.species.pinneral.name: Pinneral
cobblemon.species.pinneral.desc: Pinneral dive to the depths of the deepest oceans to collect scrap metal from ship wrecks. They then use these scraps to construction floating, impenetrable shelters to sleep in.
cobblemon.species.walrust.name: Walrust
cobblemon.species.walrust.desc: Walrust use their powerful incisors to fashion pieces of scrap metal into sharp (and deadly) armour. Over time this armour is absorbed into their skin, meaning that the older a Walrust, the tougher and more dangerous they are.
cobblemon.species.slackonch.name: Slackonch
cobblemon.species.slackonch.desc: A peaceful inhabitant of the sea who rarely moves. Its shell is covered with fuzzy algae, giving it a soft texture.
cobblemon.species.burreel.name: Burreel
cobblemon.species.burreel.desc: Burreel have adapted to dig into sand to avoid being eaten by avian predators. Their limited strength, however, means they're only able to live in shallow waters.
cobblemon.species.osheangle.name: Osheangle
cobblemon.species.osheangle.desc: Driven by a desire to burrow in deeper waters, Burreel evolves. Osheangle are extremely aggressive, and will eat anything that can fit in their mouth.
cobblemon.species.morabyssal.name: Morabyssal
cobblemon.species.morabyssal.desc: Their growing aggression supersedes their innate desire to burrow, and so they take off into the deepest of oceans in search of new, more formidable prey.
cobblemon.species.shrewphin.name: Dolphin1
cobblemon.species.dolpride.name: Dolphin2
cobblemon.species.aukward.name: Aukward
cobblemon.species.aukward.desc: It has poor sense of balance, which makes it self-conscious.
cobblemon.species.snaukler.name: Snaukler
cobblemon.species.snaukler.desc: Snaukler developed their signature beak as a result of overhunting. Unable to fly away due to their short wings, whenever they spot a predator they simply jump off the sea cliffs they live in into the ocean below.
cobblemon.species.fledgwing.name: Fledgwing
cobblemon.species.fledgwing.desc: Delicate and helpless, Fledgwing anchor themselves to the ground by burying their feet into long grass or sand to avoid being blown away in a strong breeze.
cobblemon.species.sheardrop.name: Sheardrop
cobblemon.species.sheardrop.desc: These Pokmon move silently through the air scanning for food. Their slim bodies and streamlined wings allow Sheardrop to fall from the sky in seconds, plucking prey from the ground before they even see it coming.
cobblemon.species.buffin.name: Buffin
cobblemon.species.buffin.desc: After centuries of having their eggs and food snatched away by other bird Pokmon with better flying capabilities, Buffin developed extremely thick muscle mass in order to protect its food and young.
cobblemon.species.seagulp.name: Seagulp
cobblemon.species.seagulp.desc: Seagulp are so bloated and round from stealing food that their ability to fly has become limited. As a result, it takes a lot of work to get one to battle.
cobblemon.species.seaguzzle.name: Seaguzzle
cobblemon.species.seaguzzle.desc: Upon evolution, Seaguzzle's appetite evolves with it. Fortunately, its insatiable hunger has helped keep the local rodent population on Harsholme from exploding and affecting other ecosystems.
cobblemon.species.gobblegannet.name: Gobblegannet
cobblemon.species.gobblegannet.desc: Gobblegannet are voracious, eating anything that comes their way, including other Pokmon. A popular old wives' tale mentions a Gobblegannet that once ate its Trainer.
cobblemon.species.chalker.name: Chalker
cobblemon.species.chalker.desc: It uses its limestone-rich claws to mark its territory on cliffs and cave walls. A large hill figure of this creature has been dated back centuries.
cobblemon.species.terrapir.name: Terrapir
cobblemon.species.terrapir.desc: These sturdy Pokemon sleep in the day and roam the forests and hills of Lonava at night. Despite their placid demeanour and appearance, they can pack a nasty bite if disturbed or threatened.
cobblemon.species.lagerm.name: Lagerm
cobblemon.species.lagerm.desc: Lagerm pick up heavy minerals and gems as they move through the ground. As a result, they'll rarely get an attack off first.
cobblemon.species.anguiterra.name: Anguiterra
cobblemon.species.anguiterra.desc: These enormous beasts can tunnel through rock as though swimming through water. They collect crystals and minerals as they go, slowly absorbing them into their rocky armour.
cobblemon.species.tentpest.name: Tentpest
cobblemon.species.tentpest.desc: Tentpest are a plague upon the music-loving citizens of Lonava, frequently disrupting the annual Tonbury Festival with their nasty winds and storm-conjuring habits. Anyone willing to raise one is considered bad luck and banned from entering the Festival grounds.
cobblemon.species.cladobe.name: Cladobe
cobblemon.species.cladobe.desc: Cladobe have been dug up on farms all across Lonava, with the oldest specimen being dated back 1800 years.
cobblemon.species.terrapotta.name: Terrapotta
cobblemon.species.terrapotta.desc: Created by combining pottery fragments excavated from Lonava's many pastoral fields, Snagment are surprisingly tough. Some Snagment pieces have been dated back centuries, from a time now lost to history.
cobblemon.species.chooft.name: Chooft
cobblemon.species.chooft.desc: Chooft are docile Pokemon, and choose to spend most of their days asleep in a field or grazing. If mishandled, they may spit or refuse to move.
cobblemon.species.alpacurrent.name: Alpacurrent
cobblemon.species.alpacurrent.desc: These intelligent Pokemon travel predominantly in herds, and are revered for their luxurious wool. Its high conductivity means that Alpacurrent attract lightning more than most Electric type Pokemon. As a consequence, it can't be kept in a barn.
cobblemon.species.feralamb.name: Feralamb
cobblemon.species.feralamb.desc: These rambunctious Pokmon are antisocial to the core, attacking anyone that passes by. The older a Feralamb, the more matted its fur.
cobblemon.species.savagewe.name: Savagewe
cobblemon.species.savagewe.desc: Savagewe's matted fur causes it to pick up anything it brushes against: leaves, brambles, barbed wire, or even small Pokmon.
cobblemon.species.whud.name: Whud
cobblemon.species.whud.desc: Whud are often found bathing in rivers and dirty puddles to keep their naturally dry bodies moist. They slam their heavy bodies against walls and obstacles to startle opponents.
cobblemon.species.pussour.name: Pussour
cobblemon.species.pussour.desc: Upon evolution their formally saturated bodies turn rock hard, increasing their weight substantially. Their appearance and unpleasant demeanour leave many upset, so it takes an incredibly brave trainer to commit to raising one.
cobblemon.species.dimwraith.name: Dimwraith
cobblemon.species.dimwraith.desc: Originally discovered in faraway Mystis, this regional variant lingers around farms, suppressing the growth of crops. A common Lonavan 'saying goes worry not about your bountiful harvests, or risk attracting the Dimwraith.'
cobblemon.species.mystisiandimwraith.des: Dimwraith like to play pranks to scare people. According to researchers, there are theoretically unlimited ways to evolve Dimwraith, although only a few have been discovered.
cobblemon.species.grainghoul.name: Grainghoul
cobblemon.species.grainghoul.desc: Lonavan farmers live in fear of this creature. Its long black tongue can make an entire field inhospitable in minutes, and it has a nasty habit of lighting itself ablaze, torching every crop in its periphery.
cobblemon.species.sneep.name: Sneep
cobblemon.species.sneep.desc: Able to continue grazing in even the most frigid of weather, Sneep's face is constantly coated in snow. Dorhouse that have lost their stumps sometimes sleep inside its stiff wool.
cobblemon.species.ammutt.name: Ammutt
cobblemon.species.ammutt.desc: As Ammutt grow in age and size, their drooping puppy fat fills out and they gain greater stability.
cobblemon.species.pointriever.name: Pointriever
cobblemon.species.pointriever.desc: Pointriever are the ideal partner in every way. Their loyalty to their trainer is famous, and people from all across the world spend thousands to purchase a purebred Lonavan Pointriever.
cobblemon.species.kaelpie.name: Kaelpie
cobblemon.species.kaelpie.desc: Usually found clinging to seaweed in shallow waters, Kaelpie appear a lot in Lonavan mythology. They're known for their nobility, often risking their lives to help drowning people.
cobblemon.species.balanoral.name: Balanoral
cobblemon.species.balanoral.desc: Balanoral prefer shallower waters where they can absorb energy from sunlight. Anyone unfortunate enough to step on one will receive a nasty electric shock.
cobblemon.species.comenoid.name: Comenoid
cobblemon.species.comenoid.desc: Comenoid are known as the 'Meteor of the Sea' due to the way they use their flowing pinnules to swim. Despite living in cold water, touching one can result in severe burns.
cobblemon.species.honkream.name: Honkream
cobblemon.species.honkream.desc: An ice cream shop in Tonbury Town, named the Silly Creamer and owned by local legend Silly Sally, is filled with Honkream and its evolution, Conedian. They use their Ice-type moves to keep the ice cream from melting, as well as greeting customers with their delightful personalities.
cobblemon.species.conedian.name: Conedian
cobblemon.species.conedian.desc: Scientists have studied Conedian's biological make-up extensively in order to find out why its ice cream body and chocolate arms never melt, even under the most extreme of temperatures.
cobblemon.species.balloonga.name: Balloonga
cobblemon.species.balloonga.desc: Their balloons consist of an elastic film made from ice and filled with internally-converted helium. As a result, Balloonga can fly!
cobblemon.species.aeroluga.name: Aeroluga
cobblemon.species.aeroluga.desc: The combination of Aeroluga's sharp horn and propeller tail help it to tear through the sky at the speed of a plane, for this reason no flights are allowed over the Lonavan mainland.
cobblemon.species.gobbeel.name: Gobbeel
cobblemon.species.gobbeel.desc: Gobbeel are found in every waterway in Lonava, though their natural ability to change colours will make it a much harder task to actually acquire one.
cobblemon.species.inviseel.name: Inviseel
cobblemon.species.inviseel.desc: Inviseel take their pre-evolution's characteristic colour-changing abilities one step further by actually turning invisible when threatened. Limnologists aren't sure exactly where Inviseel can be found, though it's suspected that they could live anywhere.
cobblemon.species.auroreal.name: Auroreal
cobblemon.species.auroreal.desc: Now too large to travel through waterways, Auroreal move to the ocean, lakes, and reservoirs. Their radiant energy and powerful jaws make them a truly powerful ally to have, though getting an Inviseel to evolve is no small task.
cobblemon.species.blizzarcher.name: Blizzarcher
cobblemon.species.blizzarcher.desc: Blizzarcher is thought to have been born from the remains of a comet that burnt up in the atmosphere long ago. It's found in Lonava's infamously brutal Bruemoor Beacons, where it hides in mountain caves, waiting for anyone to dare trespass on its territory.
cobblemon.species.caprihorn.name: Caprihorn
cobblemon.species.caprihorn.desc: Caprihorn are commonly spotted on Lonavan family crests, albeit a heavily romanticised version, given that a Caprihorn hasn't been sighted in centuries. It's believed this creature is extinct, though many have faked sightings for attention.
cobblemon.species.leilyne.name: Leilyne
cobblemon.species.leilyne.desc: Leilyne's existence can't be scientifically proven, so a sighting often brings with it extensive media attention. They're rumoured to travel via invisible channels connecting sites of historical importance.
cobblemon.species.angloch.name: Angloch
cobblemon.species.angloch.desc: Said to have originated from a nearby region, fossilised Angloch remains have been found all around Lonava's shores. Despite its size, it's not quite big enough to ferry passengers.
cobblemon.species.drakkoar.name: Drakkoar
cobblemon.species.drakkoar.desc: Drakkoar are mean-tempered and prone to violence, especially against others of its species. Invaders rode Drakkoar in ancient times, with its powerful oars allowing for quick and effective ambush.
cobblemon.species.eldorchard.name: Eldorchard
cobblemon.species.eldorchard.desc: Said to be the spirit of the oldest tree in an apple orchard, local farmers pay tribute to Eldorchard on winter's eve by offering up their last mug of mulled cider. If this Pokemon ever perishes, its entire orchard will perish too.
cobblemon.species.gemolofry.name: Gemolofry
cobblemon.species.gemolofry.desc: Gemolofry can detect whether a crystal or gemstone is authentic or not, making it popular amongst lapidarists and gemcutters. Despite its heavy gemstone encasing, it can swim very well.
cobblemon.species.appreciafin.name: Appreciafin
cobblemon.species.appreciafin.desc: A Pokmon with unparalleled pattern recognition. While it is often used to examine gems and rare stones, each Appreciafin has a preferred object it likes to observe and study.
cobblemon.species.enchantice.name: Enchantice
cobblemon.species.enchantice.desc: Enchantice guard sacred wells, disguising themselves as lids covering the entrance. They wrap their vines around opponents, enchanting them in the process.
cobblemon.species.mossowl.name: Mossowl
cobblemon.species.mossowl.desc: Wandering the planet for centuries, the pelt of a Mossowl is a small insight into their travels. Different flowers and herbs grow within the moss depending on where they have been.
cobblemon.species.corobelisk.name: Corobelisk
cobblemon.species.corobelisk.desc: Considered to be a sun deity by locals, Corobelisk is depicted in murals as emitting a beautiful shining light. Thousands gather on the height of the summer solstice to pay tribute to this radiant Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.monumoon.name: Monumoon
cobblemon.species.monumoon.desc: Considered to be a moon deity by locals, Monumoon is depicted in murals as controlling the tides. It exists in another astral plane, only choosing to becoming visible as a reflection in still water.
cobblemon.species.faeleaf.name: Faeleaf
cobblemon.species.faeleaf.desc: Faeleaf can fly by rotating their ears. Upon reaching a great height, Faeleaf then drift slowly downwards in a motion akin to dancing. Seeing one means that Autumn's arrival is imminent.
cobblemon.species.aetumnal.name: Aetumnal
cobblemon.species.aetumnal.desc: A sighting of this Mythical Pokemon heralds the end of Autumn and the coming of Winter. Lonavan folklore refers to it as the Harvest Prince, with local farmers often waiting until a sighting before reaping their crops.
cobblemon.species.llampas.name: Llampas
cobblemon.species.llampas.desc: Llampas are cheerful Pokemon with carefree attitudes, which makes them a common choice for new trainers. Although, the Pollen from their fur is especially strong, causing anyone nearby to sneeze violently.
cobblemon.species.danfluff.name: Danfluff
cobblemon.species.danfluff.desc: Danfluff aren't particularly bright, but they are devoted to their trainer. With a single command, they can spread out thousands of pollen spores with one swipe of their tail, causing entire Pollen Storms all on their own.
cobblemon.species.alfalphalops.name: Alfalphalops
cobblemon.species.alfalphalops.desc: The rocky hump on the back of an Alfalphalops can hold nearly a hundred of gallons of water. These special humps allow both them and their lucky trainers to endure even the most extreme of weather conditions.
cobblemon.species.therpal.name: Therpal
cobblemon.species.therpal.desc: The fluid visible in a Therpal's chest is a heated mixture of gases and oil. This allows them to travel at incredible speeds for short bursts, but due to their small size, they have to make frequent stops to make sure they don't run dry.
cobblemon.species.aspfault.name: Aspfault
cobblemon.species.aspfault.desc: Aspfault are highly social creatures. They often use their high body heat to drill through solid rock and stone, creating large tunnel networks inhabited by scores of Therpal and Asfault.
cobblemon.species.tarmendoa.name: Tarmendoa
cobblemon.species.tarmendoa.desc: Tarmendoa's glowing underside and breakneck speeds cause it look like little more than a blur of flame at night. Children often make wishes when they seem them, mistaking a Tarmendoa for a shooting star.
cobblemon.species.burbwhirl.name: Burbwhirl
cobblemon.species.burbwhirl.desc: A Burbwhirl's bubble can be used as a gauge for their emotions. Normally their bubble is rather small, but when they're out exploring the world, their bubble will expand with child-like wonder. However, if a Burbwhirl is frightened, its bubble will pop.
cobblemon.species.spoutlaw.name: Spoutlaw
cobblemon.species.spoutlaw.desc: When in battle, Spoutlaw will motionlessly stare down their opponent, hands hovering over the water pouches on their hips. At the slightest noise, Spoutlaw will lash out and shoot water from its pouches at blinding speeds.
cobblemon.species.vaquamael.name: Vaquamael
cobblemon.species.vaquamael.desc: Vaquamael are natural leaders and are often seen protecting other Pokemon. When someone is out causing trouble, a Vaquamael will rush to catch them using its powerful water lasso.
cobblemon.species.chewmunk.name: Chewmunk
cobblemon.species.chewmunk.desc: Chewmunk are prolific enough to have established a firm population in Kaskade's cities. Their friendly attitude towards people is a trait of a desirable pet, but their need to constantly shave their teeth by chewing makes them difficult pets.
cobblemon.species.cheekat.name: Cheekat
cobblemon.species.cheekat.desc: Cheekat isn't able evolve in the wild, so it's thought that they chose a feline form to be better suited for humans. This seems to have worked, as Cheekat are often used for their hypnotic abilities by those with insomnia.
cobblemon.species.specoey.name: Specoey
cobblemon.species.specoey.desc: Specoey are trained in acting from a young age. Due to this lifelong ability, they often partake in stage plays alongside young children. In some cases, the audience is unable to tell the difference.
cobblemon.species.opakespiel.name: Opakespiel
cobblemon.species.opakespiel.desc: Opakespiel are known for their constant ramblings and monologuing. But when the situation calls for it, an Opakespiel can stop its pulse and play dead for up to a month at a time.
cobblemon.species.kwaile.name: Kwaile
cobblemon.species.kwaile.desc: Scared of everything and often abandoned by their parents, young Kwaile will band together in militant groups. These groups often hunt young Sighlo and Sewaddle to showcase their superiority, but it rarely ever goes their way.
cobblemon.species.quailert.name: Quailert
cobblemon.species.quailert.desc: The need to protect its young is always on its mind. It digs holes and then covers Kwaile with its large wings.
cobblemon.species.quailstion.name: Quailstion
cobblemon.species.quailstion.desc: Its wings are caked with dirt and mud. When it comes to the ground, they combine their wings with the earth below them, creating a very strong barrier.
cobblemon.species.sighlo.name: Sighlo
cobblemon.species.sighlo.desc: It does almost nothing aside from sitting and eating all day. Easily eating its body weight in a sitting. It lets out an occasional sigh from loneliness.
cobblemon.species.cooreds.name: Cooreds
cobblemon.species.cooreds.desc: Like its previous evolution, it is pretty immobile. While waiting to evolve again, it practices making noises with its trumpet-like mouth.
cobblemon.species.probaska.name: Probaska
cobblemon.species.probaska.desc: After evolution, Probaska becomes upbeat and energetic. They are known to have large parties in some forests at night.
cobblemon.species.histameanie.name: Histameanie
cobblemon.species.histameanie.desc: Histameanie are infamous for hiding in tall grass and attacking unsuspecting passerby. Due to this, it is uncommon to see a trainer in Kaskade without a repel.
cobblemon.species.apheed.name: Apheed
cobblemon.species.apheed.desc: Apheed like to eat fruits and other plants together in a large swarm from the inside out. In the summer, berry farmers are very wary of Apheed.
cobblemon.species.musleafo.name: Musleafo
cobblemon.species.musleafo.desc: Musleafo are most common in the spring and summer, always on the hunt for more and more sweet nectar. They like to hunt together, although loners are not unheard of.
cobblemon.species.eecroach.name: Eecroach
cobblemon.species.eecroach.desc: Eeroach like to go in cities and disguise themselves as weeds in between sidewalks, they look for any sugary foods Pokemon or Humans leave behind.
cobblemon.species.swarm_eecroach.name: Eecroach
cobblemon.species.clamtrip.name: Clamtrip
cobblemon.species.clamtrip.desc: Being attracted to shiny objects, Clamtrip often fight among themselves, trying to steal the others pearls. Clamperl are their favorite prey.
cobblemon.species.rowviar.name: Rowviar
cobblemon.species.rowviar.desc: These small Pokemon travel in schools of 12 and tend to swim in a V formation. When one evolves into Sanook, they leave their colony to start a new one.
cobblemon.species.sanook.name: Sanook
cobblemon.species.sanook.desc: Sanook have immensely strong jaws that rival Pokemon such as Drednaw. Their beaks grow sharper with age, making elder Sanook the most powerful in their colony.
cobblemon.species.tofrug.name: Tofrug
cobblemon.species.kaskazog.name: Kaskazog
cobblemon.species.ananot.name: Ananot
cobblemon.species.ananot.desc: Ananots have a sticky mucus that smells like that of ripe Nanab berries. Although this mucus is inherently toxic, when properly processed they can be used for medicinal purposes.
cobblemon.species.ananoop.name: Ananoop
cobblemon.species.ananoop.desc: Ananoop are commonly mistaken for ripe fruit by tourists, though if touched have a gooey toxin so powerful it could cause temporary paralysis lasting several hours.
cobblemon.species.mosster.name: Mosster
cobblemon.species.mosster.desc: Mosster like to lay on roofs, using its fur to plant itself between the shingles. Large colonies of Mosster can form if not checked regularly.
cobblemon.species.mosskrat.name: Mosskrat
cobblemon.species.mosskrat.desc: Mosskrat run around in small packs, they choose the leader by who has the longest tail, although some packs follow alternate colored Mosskrat.
cobblemon.species.catteraxe.name: Catteraxe
cobblemon.species.catteraxe.desc: Catteraxe swing their axe like tail to clear anything in it's path. They are wild and uncontrollable pokemon, although many older women have a fondness for it.
cobblemon.species.catatomb.name: Catatomb
cobblemon.species.skinka.name: Skinka
cobblemon.species.skinka.desc: Known for their trademark blue tongue, these mischievous Pokmon are always ready for a fight. Skinka have the uncanny ability to adapt and evolve based on their surroundings, making them a perfect fit for Kaskades rapid climate.
cobblemon.species.dredgen.name: Dredgen
cobblemon.species.dredgen.desc: Dredgen break rocks into bite-sized bits with their shovel-like tail, which they also do when combating opponent Gigalith. They enjoy sunbathing and cleaning themselves in the dust, making them some of the cleanest ground pokemon!
cobblemon.species.stalagen.name: Stalagen
cobblemon.species.chromagen.name: Chromagen
cobblemon.species.chromagen.desc: Chromagen are frequently spotted roaming the mountainside with Hattena riding on their backs. They roam around, defending lesser Pokmon they encounter along the way, especially against Bludgen.
cobblemon.species.aerogen.name: Aerogen
cobblemon.species.aerogen.desc: Aerogen is a lord among flying-type Pokmon, soaring through the skies at sonic speeds. They were originally considered as the fastest Pokmon in the air until Ninjask migrated to Kaskade.
cobblemon.species.caragen.name: Caragen
cobblemon.species.caragen.desc: Caragen are terrifying Pokmon that hide in dark places with their tails pointing out as if they were heads looking around. Any unsuspecting victim who looks at the head is cut.
cobblemon.species.bludgen.name: Bludgen
cobblemon.species.bludgen.desc: Even when confronted by a large number of opponents, Bludgen attacks with all of its body parts at the same time, a breathtakingly terrifying display of brute strength and technique.
cobblemon.species.pathagen.name: Pathagen
cobblemon.species.pathagen.desc: Despite their appearance, Pathagen are extremely caring, frequently accepting abandoned Pokmon into their lounge. Their venom is incredibly powerful, and a single bite is enough to knock a Mamoswine out in minutes.
cobblemon.species.ectogen.name: Ectogen
cobblemon.species.ectogen.desc: Ectogen evolves into pure spiritual energy as it evolves. It inhabits the husk of its former self, rendering it physically incapable of feeling pain. Ectogen follows Skinka wherever they go. When their skin deteriorates, they can quickly inhabit a new shell and continue to live.
cobblemon.species.legen.name: Legen
cobblemon.species.enigmeon.name: Enigmeon
cobblemon.species.enigmeon.desc: The origins of this Pokemon remain shrouded in mystery. While it evolves from the use of a Mist Stone, there is no record of Enigmeon existing at any point in the past.
cobblemon.species.desoray.name: Desoray
cobblemon.species.desoray.desc: With their whip like tail, they can attack with intense speed and power. They like to hide in the sand, using it as camouflage to catch their prey.
cobblemon.species.pudet.name: Pudet
cobblemon.species.pudet.desc: Pudet are very friendly pokemon, commonly kept as family pets. They will not hesitate to protect the ones it loves, even if it isn't strong enough to handle many threats.
cobblemon.species.woond.name: Woond
cobblemon.species.woond.desc: Back before the current era, a group of Woond saved many Kaskadian, Alolan, and Unovian soldiers in the Continental War. They are known for their bravery and intense perseverance.
cobblemon.species.pramblo.name: Pramblo
cobblemon.species.pramblo.desc: This Pokemon has a tube of hot glass coming off of its protective shell. This tube is formed from the glass leftover after the shells formation. Pramblo use it to interact with the outside world.
cobblemon.species.glashulimp.name: Glashulimp
cobblemon.species.drout.name: Drout
cobblemon.species.drout.desc: Drout is regarded as an ancestor to Sanook, although scientists are unsure of how both pokemon can co-exist in the same time period. They have weak lungs but choose to breathe through their gills.
cobblemon.species.dry_drout.name: Drout
cobblemon.species.guruchi.name: Guruchi
cobblemon.species.guruchi.desc: Guruchi have turbine-like tails which they use to process and condense water. This processed water can be shot at incredibly fast rates through the gap between its teeth, allowing Guruchi to cut wood with ease.
cobblemon.species.porygonomega.name: Porygon-Omega
cobblemon.species.estoe.name: Estoe
cobblemon.species.estoe.desc: Some say this Pokemon originated from another plane of existence. Lingering in its presence is considered dangerous due to the strange, cell altering energy it emits.
cobblemon.species.perpetua.name: Perpetua
cobblemon.species.perpetua.desc: As mysterious as Perpetua is, several high influencing leaders in history have shown odd favoritism for this Pokemon. It can emit a strange light from its frills.
cobblemon.species.tooburm.name: Tooburm
cobblemon.species.tooburm.desc: Tooburm are rarely seen above ground, choosing to eat potatoes and stay hidden. They have very weak electric type attacks that are launched from their prongs.
cobblemon.species.detrarc.name: Detrarc
cobblemon.species.detrarc.desc: The potato around Detrarc's neck is mature enough to appear to be fully grown. Farmers sometimes grab Detrarc up and get shocked as a result of it.
cobblemon.species.qayagus.name: Qayagus
cobblemon.species.auditaur.name: Auditaur
cobblemon.species.auditaur.desc: It's said that if an Auditaur begins to sing while you pet it, you'll receive many years of good luck. Its voice is very soft and used to calm small children down.
cobblemon.species.oxillery.name: Oxillery
cobblemon.species.oxillery.desc: Oxillery are among the loudest Pokemon ever recorded, although they prefer to replicate the noises they hear through their sensitive horns.
cobblemon.species.mienflux.name: Mienflux
cobblemon.species.gneckle.name: Gneckle
cobblemon.species.gneckle.desc: Gneckle are too weak to completely leave their shell, leaving them in a mostly immobile state. Female Rabyoose will do anything to protect a newborn Gneckle.
cobblemon.species.rabyoose.name: Rabyoose
cobblemon.species.rabyoose.desc: Most wild Rabyoose have no interest in humans or other Pokemon, making them hostile to anyone not of their kind. Rabyoose are known to aggressively charge at others in their pack to assert dominance.
cobblemon.species.tamroast.name: Tamroast
cobblemon.species.vitisquash.name: Vitisquash
cobblemon.species.vitisquash.desc: Vitisquash use their large feet to squish grapes it grows with fellow farmers. No one knows where they came from, just that they are gentle souls.
cobblemon.species.dionysseur.name: Dionysseur
cobblemon.species.umbralu.name: Umbralu
cobblemon.species.umbralu.desc: Umbralu have a dark aura in their underskirt that is pitch black and impossible to see through. Strong Unbralu can concentrate this energy to shoot beams of darkness that leach the opponents life force.
cobblemon.species.nomobjeka.name: Nomobjeka
cobblemon.species.nomobjeka.desc: The existence of Nomobjeka, a fun-loving guardian Pokemon, was just recently proven. It goes out in search of fainted wild Pokemon and guards them until they recover. These Pokemon can only be found in hidden areas shrouded by foliage, making them a rare sight in the wild.
cobblemon.species.kleptarak.name: Kleptarak
cobblemon.species.kleptarak.desc: These menacing Pokemon use their long legs and hand-like tail to rapidly climb in ways that defy gravity. Kleptarak are notorious for stalking their prey at night and snatching them into the shadows.
cobblemon.species.kituff.name: Kituff
cobblemon.species.beadamup.name: Beadamup
cobblemon.species.rascoom.name: Rascoom
cobblemon.species.faebril.name: Faebril
cobblemon.species.faebril.desc: By touching a pokemon or human with their wings, they can send healing pulses through them. They also are very strong defibrillator, even being able to start the heart of Wailord.
cobblemon.species.botnyak.name: Botnyak
cobblemon.species.botnyak.desc: Originally created by Tom Bezzle as a companion Pokemon, Botnyak were engineered to be extremely marketable. When the product flopped, Botnyak were repurposed by Amaze-All for other projects.
cobblemon.species.vendrom.name: Vendrom
cobblemon.species.buwuve.name: Buwuve
cobblemon.species.wasgrowl.name: Wasgrowl
cobblemon.species.worcane.name: Worcane
cobblemon.species.worcane.desc: This Pokemon is notoriously hard to train, but very rewarding when done right. Worcane are the alpha of the ocean, leading Pokemon on their team to victory.
cobblemon.species.probat.name: Probat
cobblemon.species.jemineye.name: Jemineye
cobblemon.species.jemineye.desc: Under the water, nothing is more aware than Jemineye. It always sees through its gem like eyes, even while it rests, it always is ready to escape.
cobblemon.species.oracub.name: Oracub
cobblemon.species.bearvoyance.name: Bearvoyance
cobblemon.species.bearvoyance.desc: Bearvoyance can use their psychic abilities to wisely predict their foes next move. Elder Bearvoyance love to work at daycares, giving words of wisdom to Pokemon while theyre still in eggs.
cobblemon.species.folleming.name: Folleming
cobblemon.species.folleming.desc: Follemings are mind controlled by the leader Folleming to do things against their will. When a Folleming is strong enough to resist the leaders mental commands, they will overthrow the current leader.
cobblemon.species.drosabell.name: Drosabell
cobblemon.species.drosabell.desc: Kaskadian Bellsprout who study on Spectoul Mountain awaken their true psychic abilities, evolving into Drosabell. They can force their presence into any creatures mind, normally using this ability to eat any weak pokemon around.
cobblemon.species.yanmage.name: Yanmage
cobblemon.species.bloomage.name: Bloomage
cobblemon.species.bloomage.desc: Shooting fireballs everywhere, they are known for causing trouble and chaos wherever they run to.
cobblemon.species.obsidious.name: Obsidious
cobblemon.species.obsidious.desc: Obsidious are unpleasant to be around, often rampaging and spewing magma wildly. They can be uncharacteristically jolly when fully fed, making scientists hypothesize that its constant flailing is due to its overwhelming hunger.
cobblemon.species.mercryni.name: Mercryni
cobblemon.species.mercryni.desc: When startled, Mercryni cry tears of mercury. Its sharp spikes are corroded and rusty. Touching the spikes or tears of a Mercryni may result in hospitalization.
cobblemon.species.meraculisk.name: Meraculisk
cobblemon.species.meraculisk.desc: This Pokemon has gone under rigorous training to overcome even it's darkest fears and has mastered the manipulation of it's poison.
cobblemon.species.golgre.name: Golgre
cobblemon.species.prospectre.name: Prospectre
cobblemon.species.skideer.name: Skideer
cobblemon.species.yuleigh.name: Yuleigh
cobblemon.species.feafurr.name: Feafurr
cobblemon.species.feafurr.desc: Feafurr havent mastered the ability to control their fire based abilities, putting their bodies in an imbalanced limbo. Although they seem cowardly, Feafurr will always try their best.
cobblemon.species.vaicear.name: Vaicear
cobblemon.species.vaicear.desc: With a new found homeostasis, Vaicear have mastered the balance between fire and ice. This apex Pokemon once used their heated claws to traverse through the frigid arctic.
cobblemon.species.phisnooz.name: Phisnooz
cobblemon.species.phisnooz.desc: By waving their trunk, Phisnooz emit psychic waves that can put people to sleep in mere seconds. In a previous time they were the prey of Vaicear.
cobblemon.species.telemac.name: Telemac
cobblemon.species.telemac.desc: Telemac can speak telepathically with other Telemac, allowing them to call others when under attack by a pack of Vaicear. When in battle, Telemac use this ability to confuse other Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.macedontus.name: Macedontus
cobblemon.species.macedontus.desc: As an ancestor to Sandshrew, a Macedontus can resist even the strongest attacks. Using their spiky tail, Macedontus can crush foes while defending itself.
cobblemon.species.crynorawst.name: Crynorawst
cobblemon.species.crynorawst.desc: Crynorawst are selfless, thinking only of others in a time of need. In Kaskadian mythology, a herd of Crynorawst were said to have moved mountains using their impressive horns.
cobblemon.species.rotomb.name: Rotomb
cobblemon.species.tamunk.name: Tamunk
cobblemon.species.tamunk.desc: As a scout for Manadza, it prepares the land for summer. It's said to have once been a Chewmunk and blessed with great power.
cobblemon.species.temunk.name: Temunk
cobblemon.species.temunk.desc: After being blessed by Arcitkull, Temunk was tasked with preparing Kaskade for Winter. Its touch causes plants to wither.
cobblemon.species.manadza.name: Manadza
cobblemon.species.manadza.desc: This Pokemon is known as 'The embodiment of Summer' by those who know of its existence. Its sheer power locked Kaskade in a seemingly endless summer thousands of years ago.
cobblemon.species.arctikull.name: Arctikull
cobblemon.species.arctikull.desc: This legendary Pokemon is called 'The embodiment of winter' by those who know of its existence. When its mouth opens, extremely cold fog flows out.
cobblemon.species.wicoot.name: Wicoot
cobblemon.species.wicoot.desc: This mythical Pokemon is cunning and intelligent, although these skills are mostly used to play pranks on others. Even with their mischievous demeanor, Wicoot is said to have brought peace between a clash of titans.
cobblemon.species.orbtholod.name: Orbtholod
cobblemon.species.pestalation.name: Pestalation
cobblemon.species.revylon.name: Revylon
cobblemon.species.leoseace.name: Leoseace
cobblemon.species.lamentu.name: Lamentu
cobblemon.species.endramodai.name: Endram-Odai
cobblemon.species.neschick.name: Neschick
cobblemon.species.neschick.desc: Neschick can't fly, so they attack foes with their tiny feet instead.
cobblemon.species.phloxling.name: Phloxling
cobblemon.species.phloxling.desc: Phloxling are very caring. They defend their friends with powerful kicks.
cobblemon.species.mosstrich.name: Mosstrich
cobblemon.species.mosstrich.desc: With great power, they beat aggressors into submission with their strong kicking legs.
cobblemon.species.treetle.name: Treetle
cobblemon.species.treetle.desc: When a Treetle finds a seed it likes, it holds onto it for the rest of its life. It doubles as a weapon which they use to defend themselves from predators in the wild.
cobblemon.species.tumball.name: Tumball
cobblemon.species.titanoss.name: Titanoss
cobblemon.species.pepinch.name: Pepinch
cobblemon.species.torpepo.name: Torpepo
cobblemon.species.melauncher.name: Melauncher
cobblemon.species.charrat.name: Charrat
cobblemon.species.charrat.desc: It can take in light from the sun and turn it into heat. When disturbed from rest, it blasts the heat right out.
cobblemon.species.blashrew.name: Blashrew
cobblemon.species.blashrew.desc: Its round body, which has a shell-like toughness and sheen, stores heat that can be expelled at will. Though playful, it can become aggressive in an instant if it or its allies are threatened.
cobblemon.species.explodent.name: Explodent
cobblemon.species.explodent.desc: Its thick claws are as sharp as thick metal. It can fire blazing eruptions of heat from its mouth, hot enough to melt rock.
cobblemon.species.squiddle.name: Squiddle
cobblemon.species.squignite.name: Squignite
cobblemon.species.cephlame.name: Cephlame
cobblemon.species.drimp.name: Drimp
cobblemon.species.drimp.desc: Drimp have a slippery coating on their skin, making foes slip right off its slimy body. They propel themselves across the ocean floor using their fan-like tail.
cobblemon.species.prawnee.name: Prawnee
cobblemon.species.prawnee.desc: Prawnee are very mischievous and always happy. Playfully, they throw around foes while laughing.
cobblemon.species.fabulusk.name: Fabulusk
cobblemon.species.fabulusk.desc: Fabulusk are filled with pride and vain. They will even go as far as taking a swipe at their trainers if they insult their appearance.
cobblemon.species.cheekii.name: Cheekii
cobblemon.species.cheekii.desc: Cheekii have pouches inside of their cheeks in which they store berries and nuts. A single Cheekii can collect up to 150 berries in one day.
cobblemon.species.grumpster.name: Grumpster
cobblemon.species.grumpster.desc: A leading Grumpster can direct a horde of up to 35 Cheekii to forage berries and nuts for itself. It sleeps the majority of the day sometimes blocking paths on routes.
cobblemon.species.ferasquab.name: Ferasquab
cobblemon.species.ferasquab.desc: Cherm and Cherrish are Ferasquab's favourite meal. It uses its sharp beak to sniff out the sweetest Cherm.
cobblemon.species.streedove.name: Streedove
cobblemon.species.urbigeon.name: Urbigeon
cobblemon.species.principillar.name: Principillar
cobblemon.species.kookoon.name: Kookoon
cobblemon.species.fluttereign.name: Fluttereign
cobblemon.species.larvake.name: Larvake
cobblemon.species.larvake.desc: With their large antennae, they scare off any predators who think they are dangerous dragons.
cobblemon.species.mockoon.name: Mockoon
cobblemon.species.mockoon.desc: Upon evolution, Larvake develop a strong outer shell which protects them from being eaten. They mimic a dragon's mouth to scare off foes.
cobblemon.species.mimoth.name: Mimoth
cobblemon.species.mimoth.desc: Mimoth's colouring and shape mimic ferocious dragons to scare away potential predators.
cobblemon.species.cherm.name: Cherm
cobblemon.species.cherm.desc: Often hunted by hungry predators, Cherm releases a sweet aroma from its body. The leaf on its head can be used to make tea.
cobblemon.species.cherrish.name: Cherrish
cobblemon.species.cherrish.desc: Cherrish's two heads work together in perfect unison. At night time, they hang from tall branches and sleep peacefully out of reach from any hungry Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.denshirui.name: Denshirui
cobblemon.species.denshirui.desc: Denshirui store large amounts of electric energy in its cheeks, which it then fires out through its tail when threatened.
cobblemon.species.melabuzz.name: Melabuzz
cobblemon.species.mieltz.name: Mieltz
cobblemon.species.mieltzar.name: Mieltzar
cobblemon.species.budcheep.name: Budcheep
cobblemon.species.budcheep.desc: Budcheep are very friendly and common house pets. They come in many different colours.
cobblemon.species.paratweet.name: Paratweet
cobblemon.species.paratweet.desc: Dual WingbeatSTAB Flying Tailwind Flying Helping Hand Normal SnoreSTAB Normal UproarSTAB Normal Thunderbolt Electric Thunder Wave Electric Play Rough Fairy Sunny Day Fire Shadow Claw Ghost Bullet Seed Grass Ice Beam Ice Attract Normal Body SlamSTAB Normal Confide Normal CutSTAB Normal Double Team Normal Double-EdgeSTAB Normal Echoed VoiceSTAB Normal FacadeSTAB Normal False SwipeSTAB Normal FrustrationSTAB Normal Giga ImpactSTAB Normal Heartfelt PulseSTAB Normal Hidden PowerSTAB Normal Hyper BeamSTAB Normal Protect Normal Psych Up Normal ReturnSTAB Normal RoundSTAB Normal Safeguard Normal Sleep Talk Normal StrengthSTAB Normal Substitute Normal Swagger Normal Toxic Poison Rest Psychic Steel Wing Steel
cobblemon.species.pinksqueek.name: Pinksqueek
cobblemon.species.pinkaboo.name: Pinkaboo
cobblemon.species.stalittle.name: Stalittle
cobblemon.species.stalittle.desc: Sturdy Pokemon that hide in caves full of mineral-rich water. The rocky spikes on their bodies are deposits of this water.
cobblemon.species.sedinane.name: Sedinane
cobblemon.species.sedinane.desc: Their hair is thick and coarse, commonly getting small rocks and other debris caught in it. Sedinane love to chew on these rocks.
cobblemon.species.carrauntain.name: Carrauntain
cobblemon.species.carrauntain.desc: With powerful jaws and thick, durable legs, this Pokemon is a force to be reckoned with if you step foot in its territory.
cobblemon.species.tuburrow.name: Tuburrow
cobblemon.species.tuburrow.desc: Tuburrow live in caves. They dig elaborate and complex tunnels using their rocky tails.
cobblemon.species.tunnelurm.name: Tunnelurm
cobblemon.species.tunnelurm.desc: With its powerful drill on its head, it powers through even the strongest of metals. They have been found to dig up to 8 kilometers into the earth.
cobblemon.species.audibat.name: Audibat
cobblemon.species.audibat.desc: Playful but mischevous, it's known to fly out of caves at night to mess with unsuspecting Cherm. Its cry can be heard from nearly a mile away.
cobblemon.species.chiraudio.name: Chiraudio
cobblemon.species.echolocave.name: Echolocave
cobblemon.species.echolocave.desc: - Supersonic Normal - Scratch Normal - Screech Normal - Astonish Ghost 9 BiteSTAB Dark 12 Wing AttackSTAB Flying 15 Flatter Dark 18 Feint AttackSTAB Dark 21 Echolocate Normal 24 Echoed Voice Normal 27 Air CutterSTAB Flying 30 Snatch Dark 33 Round Normal 36 Embargo Dark 39 Beat UpSTAB Dark 44 Air SlashSTAB Flying 49 Jumpscare Ghost 53 Drain LifeSTAB Dark 57 Aerial AceSTAB Flying 61 Parting Shot Dark 65 Throat ChopSTAB Dark 69 WindblastSTAB Flying
cobblemon.species.flintten.name: Flintten
cobblemon.species.scruffur.name: Scruffur
cobblemon.species.olynx.name: Olynx
cobblemon.species.hairibble.name: Hairibble
cobblemon.species.furrocious.name: Furrocious
cobblemon.species.furrocious.desc: - Sand Attack Ground - Jab Normal - Leer Normal - Poison StingSTAB Poison - Scary Face Normal - Pinch Bug - Acupressure Normal - Spikes Ground - Toxic Spikes Poison - Toxic Poison 6 Bide Normal 11 Sand TombSTAB Ground 14 Bite Dark 18 Slash Normal 21 Prickle BarbsSTAB Poison 25 MagnitudeSTAB Ground 27 Bug Bite Bug 29 DigSTAB Ground 31 Toxic Thread Poison 33 Fell Stinger Bug 35 BulldozeSTAB Ground 37 Cross PoisonSTAB Poison 41 Hair Sweep Psychic 44 LandslideSTAB Ground 47 Poison FangSTAB Poison 51 Night Slash Dark 54 Poison JabSTAB Poison 57 Corrosive BiteSTAB Poison 59 EarthquakeSTAB Ground 63 Gunk ShotSTAB Poison 66 Stomping TantrumSTAB Ground 71 Thrash Normal
cobblemon.species.glyptic.name: Glyptic
cobblemon.species.glyptic.desc: Glyptic are filled with mysterious power. They live in desert ruins.
cobblemon.species.buttereef.name: Buttereef
cobblemon.species.oarful.name: Oarful
cobblemon.species.pyrant.name: Pyrant
cobblemon.species.piluma.name: Piluma
cobblemon.species.killarumi.name: Killarumi
cobblemon.species.metalien.name: Metalien
cobblemon.species.lunetal.name: Lunetal
cobblemon.species.galextrial.name: Galextrial
cobblemon.species.shrimpond.name: Shrimpond
cobblemon.species.pekaboo.name: Pekaboo
cobblemon.species.aviafel.name: Aviafel
cobblemon.species.cursour.name: Cursour
cobblemon.species.frankensour.name: Frankensour
cobblemon.species.halux.name: Halux
cobblemon.species.visiangel.name: Visiangel
cobblemon.species.marshun.name: Marshun
cobblemon.species.brailien.name: Brailien
cobblemon.species.cereboost.name: Cereboost
cobblemon.species.pix.name: Pix
cobblemon.species.pix.desc: Pix are born from errors in code lines. It likes to cause trouble by interrupting electrical signals and breaking computer programs.
cobblemon.species.pixe.name: Pix-E
cobblemon.species.pixe.desc: It is capable of travelling in and out of cyberspace. Large gatherings of Pix-E feed on electrical currents, so they are seen as pests.
cobblemon.species.pixl.name: Pix-L
cobblemon.species.pixl.desc: Computers spontaneously bug out when Pix-L are nearby. Its form is unstable and constantly changing.
cobblemon.species.twinkluppy.name: Twinkluppy
cobblemon.species.notillunar.name: Notillunar
cobblemon.species.rosinella.name: Rosinella
cobblemon.species.rosinella.desc: These tiny Pokemon are very adventurous and tend to be oblivious when it comes to danger. They often get lost.
cobblemon.species.sinsenella.name: Sinsenella
cobblemon.species.dysmerella.name: Dysmerella
cobblemon.species.signapsi.name: Signapsi
cobblemon.species.signapsi.desc: Signal Beam Bug Magnet Rise Electric Rising VoltageSTAB Electric Shock WaveSTAB Electric Pain Split Normal Snore Normal Expanding ForceSTAB Psychic Gravity Psychic Magic Coat Psychic Telekinesis Psychic Wonder Room Psychic U-turn Bug Dark Pulse Dark Embargo Dark Nasty Plot Dark Taunt Dark Charge BeamSTAB Electric Electric Terrain Electric ElectrocuteSTAB Electric ThunderSTAB Electric ThunderboltSTAB Electric Thunder Wave Electric Volt SwitchSTAB Electric Flame Charge Fire Flamethrower Fire Sunny Day Fire Will-O-Wisp Fire Energy Ball Grass Attract Normal Confide Normal Double Team Normal Echoed Voice Normal Facade Normal Flash Normal Frustration Normal Heartfelt Pulse Normal Hidden Power Normal Protect Normal Psych Up Normal Return Normal Round Normal Safeguard Normal Sleep Talk Normal Strength Normal Substitute Normal Swagger Normal Sludge Bomb Poison Sludge Wave Poison Toxic Poison Venoshock Poison Calm Mind Psychic Dream EaterSTAB Psychic Light Screen Psychic PsychicSTAB Psychic Psychic Terrain Psychic PsyshockSTAB Psychic Reflect Psychic Rest Psychic Trick Room Psychic Gyro Ball Steel

cobblemon.species.reneuron.desc: Signal Beam Bug Magnet Rise Electric Rising VoltageSTAB Electric Shock WaveSTAB Electric Pain Split Normal Snore Normal Expanding ForceSTAB Psychic Gravity Psychic Magic Coat Psychic Telekinesis Psychic Wonder Room Psychic U-turn Bug Dark Pulse Dark Embargo Dark Fling Dark Nasty Plot Dark Taunt Dark Thief Dark Torment Dark Charge BeamSTAB Electric Electric Terrain Electric ElectrocuteSTAB Electric ThunderSTAB Electric ThunderboltSTAB Electric Thunder Wave Electric Volt SwitchSTAB Electric Focus Blast Fighting Flamethrower Fire Sunny Day Fire Will-O-Wisp Fire Energy Ball Grass Attract Normal Body Slam Normal Confide Normal Double Team Normal Echoed Voice Normal Facade Normal Flash Normal Frustration Normal Heartfelt Pulse Normal Hidden Power Normal Protect Normal Psych Up Normal Return Normal Round Normal Safeguard Normal Sleep Talk Normal Strength Normal Substitute Normal Swagger Normal Sludge Bomb Poison Sludge Wave Poison Toxic Poison Venoshock Poison Calm Mind Psychic Dream EaterSTAB Psychic Light Screen Psychic PsychicSTAB Psychic Psychic Terrain Psychic PsyshockSTAB Psychic Reflect Psychic Rest Psychic Trick Room Psychic Flash Cannon Steel Gyro Ball Steel
cobblemon.species.brainergy.name: Brainergy
cobblemon.species.primmella.name: Primmella
cobblemon.species.primmella.desc: Primmella are very light and wispy pokemon that are swept up even in light breezes. Often times, especially in rain and storms, they clump together and are blown by the strong winds.
cobblemon.species.primmadame.name: Primmadame
cobblemon.species.primmadame.desc: People try to keep close to them and use their floating bodies for protection from the downpour.
cobblemon.species.primmoiselle.name: Primmoiselle
cobblemon.species.primmoiselle.desc: Primmoiselle are very sophisticated and classy Pokemon, but fierce fighters in battle nonetheless.
cobblemon.species.plasduck.name: Plasduck
cobblemon.species.plasduck.desc: Plasduck keep their feet tucked under their body while they float on the surface effortlessly.
cobblemon.species.fauxmingo.name: Fauxmingo
cobblemon.species.swandola.name: Swandola
cobblemon.species.buldough.name: Buldough
cobblemon.species.buldough.desc: It's beloved as a pet among families of all sizes. Both throughout Nosto and overseas, they're often used as a mascot for bakeries because of their resemblance to certain types of pastries.
cobblemon.species.duggout.name: Duggout
cobblemon.species.duggout.desc: The largest head decides where the team goes. They work cooperatively to drill powerfully through tough ground.
cobblemon.species.seasaw.name: Seasaw
cobblemon.species.chainjaw.name: Chainjaw
cobblemon.species.atlarv.name: Atlarv
cobblemon.species.atlagon.name: Atlagon
cobblemon.species.pigstyk.name: Pigstyk
cobblemon.species.lumboar.name: Lumboar
cobblemon.species.hogstead.name: Hogstead
cobblemon.species.planebe.name: Planebe
cobblemon.species.staurbor.name: Staurbor
cobblemon.species.mantaqua.name: Mantaqua
cobblemon.species.merineon.name: Merineon
cobblemon.species.teslax.name: Teslax
cobblemon.species.teslax.desc: Their bodies are almost completely transparent, making them extremely hard to find in daylight. At night, however, their multicoloured lights flicker beautifully.
cobblemon.species.zexalax.name: Zexalax
cobblemon.species.zexalax.desc: Specialised cords connect each unit together, forming one collective mind. A strong electrical field surrounds them. Anything that breaches that field will be shocked with huge amounts of electricity.
cobblemon.species.diagem.name: Diagem
cobblemon.species.cephalotox.name: Cephalotox
cobblemon.species.feiring.name: Feiring
cobblemon.species.feiring.desc: If it takes a liking to a human, it will give them its ring and protect that person from any harm.
cobblemon.species.pendelf.name: Pendelf
cobblemon.species.pendelf.desc: It pays close attention to its wearer's heartbeat to monitor its health. It radiates an aura that wards off hex.
cobblemon.species.encrona.name: Encrona
cobblemon.species.encrona.desc: Monarchs from the distant past always kept Encrona by their side to protect them from bewitching spells.
cobblemon.species.tilow.name: Tilow
cobblemon.species.tilow.desc: Tilow produce a small, warm flame on top of their head by using an oil they produce inside their bodies.
cobblemon.species.candhoul.name: Candhoul
cobblemon.species.candhoul.desc: Their bodies are very gooey and sticky. They drip behind them as they walk leaving a big mess, so wild Candhoul are often labelled as pests.
cobblemon.species.chandemise.name: Chandemise
cobblemon.species.chandemise.desc: - OverheatSTAB Fire - Phantom ForceSTAB Ghost - Night ShadeSTAB Ghost 5 EmberSTAB Fire 9 Confuse Ray Ghost 11 Ominous WindSTAB Ghost 16 Flame BurstSTAB Fire 20 Grudge Ghost 24 IncinerateSTAB Fire 29 Will-O-Wisp Fire 33 HexSTAB Ghost 39 Dazzling Gleam Fairy 43 Fire BlastSTAB Fire 48 Shadow BallSTAB Ghost 50 Memento Dark 54 PoltergeistSTAB Ghost 60 Recover Normal 65 InfernoSTAB Fire 73 Perish Song Normal
cobblemon.species.novil.name: Novil
cobblemon.species.novil.desc: It is said that if you stare into its eye for long enough, you will have visions of unspeakable horrors from the past.
cobblemon.species.azatome.name: Azatome
cobblemon.species.azatome.desc: Each book possesses various writings in an alien language, they are rumoured to tell the story of the end of the universe.
cobblemon.species.necromanos.name: Necromanos
cobblemon.species.necromanos.desc: Necromanos absorb people's souls, leaving only the lifeless body leftover. It is said that each soul becomes a new tendril.
cobblemon.species.vaniteeny.name: Vaniteeny
cobblemon.species.vaniteeny.desc: Vaniteeny are very shy and will not move in the presence of another being. They stand very still on all 4 of their legs.
cobblemon.species.boodoir.name: Boodoir
cobblemon.species.boodoir.desc: Now more powerful, each 4 of its separate faces fight for control over what they will do. Boodoir tend to be indecisive which is hinders their ability to battle.
cobblemon.species.maspook.name: Maspook
cobblemon.species.cresprit.name: Cresprit
cobblemon.species.spectmare.name: Spectmare
cobblemon.species.spectmare.desc: - Moonlight Fairy - Cosmic Power Psychic 22 Rock TombSTAB Rock 46 TombstonerSTAB Rock
