cobblemon.species.bistodum.desc: Added Oct 27 2021 Evo line: Open to suggestions and submissions Origin: Created by JaneJewel for the April 2020 Around The World Fakeathon Day 28 prompt, Ocean
cobblemon.species.coldfin.name: Coldfin
cobblemon.species.coldfin.desc: Added Oct 27 2021 Etymology: cold + dolphin + fin Evo line: Open to suggestions and submissions Origin: Created by JaneJewel for the April 2020 Around The World Fakeathon Day 21 prompt, Antarctica
cobblemon.species.raveclem.name: Raveclem
cobblemon.species.raveclem.desc: When Raveclem are in combat, they surprise their opponent with a dazzling light show. Some Raveclem are used in set designs because of the unique patterns of light they can emit.
cobblemon.species.galats.name: Galats
cobblemon.species.galats.desc: Added Oct 27 2021 Created by JaneJewel for the April 2020 Around The World Fakeathon Day 20 prompt, Australia
cobblemon.species.coldier.name: Coldier
cobblemon.species.coldier.desc: Added Oct 27 2021 Created by JaneJewel for the April 2020 Around The World Fakeathon Day 15 prompt, Russia Etymology: cold + soldier
cobblemon.species.eyeziant.name: Eyeziant
cobblemon.species.ghostea.name: Ghostea
cobblemon.species.bihaund.name: Bihaund
cobblemon.species.bihaund.desc: It emits sonar waves from the eye-like patterns on its hands, using them to echolocate in cold, dark caves. If it were to open its real eyes, anything that sees into them would be turned to ice.
cobblemon.species.serpendage.name: Serpendage
cobblemon.species.serpendage.desc: It hunts other Pokmon not for food, but simply to freeze them and hoard them inside of its den like statues or trophies. Never make direct eye contact with a wild Serpendage, or else you'll be part of its collection too.
cobblemon.species.jerbalm.name: Jerbalm
cobblemon.species.kiwatt.name: Kiwatt
cobblemon.species.kiwatt.desc: Added Oct 27 2021 Etymology: kiwi + watt Evo line: Open to suggestions and submissions Origin: Created by JaneJewel for the April 2020 Around The World Fakeathon Day 26 prompt, Random Country (New Zealand)
cobblemon.species.kikiwi.name: Kikiwi
cobblemon.species.kikiwi.desc: Fossil findings indicate that Kikiwi used to be bigger and more powerful. Scientists are trying to pinpoint the sudden turn in history that made it weak and flightless.
cobblemon.species.magmaraca.name: Magmaraca
cobblemon.species.magmaraca.desc: Added Oct 27 2021 Etymology: magma + maraca Evo line: Complete Origin: Created by JaneJewel for the April 2020 Around The World Fakeathon Day 4 prompt, Mexico
cobblemon.species.magmaligna.name: Magmaligna
cobblemon.species.magmaligna.desc: Added Oct 27 2021 Etymology: magma + [???] Evo line: Complete Origin: Created by JaneJewel for the April 2020 Around The World Fakeathon Day 4 prompt, Mexico
cobblemon.species.queenival.name: Queenival
cobblemon.species.queenival.desc: Added Oct 27 2021 Etymology: queen + carnival Evo line: TBD Origin: Created by JaneJewel for the April 2020 Around The World Fakeathon Day 5 prompt, Brazil
cobblemon.species.punky.name: Punky
cobblemon.species.punky.desc: Its comparison to Aipom has lead to many trainers and Mons being tricked and beaten up by this punk lookalike.
cobblemon.species.slamb.name: Slamb
cobblemon.species.slamb.desc: Added Oct 27 2021 Evo line: Open to suggestions and submissions Origin: Created by JaneJewel for the April 2020 Around The World Fakeathon Day 24 prompt, Ancient Civilization
cobblemon.species.roselot.name: Roselot
cobblemon.species.roselot.desc: Added Oct 27 2021 Etymology: rose + Lancelot Evo line: Complete, although Jane had some ideas for a secondary form Origin: Created by JaneJewel for the April 2020 Around The World Fakeathon Day 8 prompt, United Kingdom
cobblemon.species.rosival.name: Rosival
cobblemon.species.rosival.desc: Added Oct 27 2021 Etymology: rose + Percival Evo line: Complete, although Jane had some ideas for a secondary form Origin: Created by JaneJewel for the April 2020 Around The World Fakeathon Day 8 prompt, United Kingdom
cobblemon.species.roswain.name: Roswain
cobblemon.species.roswain.desc: Added Oct 27 2021 Etymology: rose + Gawain Evo line: Complete, although Jane had some ideas for a secondary form Origin: Created by JaneJewel for the April 2020 Around The World Fakeathon Day 8 prompt, United Kingdom
cobblemon.species.snooz.name: Snooz
cobblemon.species.tenwreck.name: Tenwreck
cobblemon.species.tenwreck.desc: Added Oct 27 2021 Etymology: tenrec + wreck (from 'wrecking ball', but can also be interpreted as in 'nervous wreck') Evo line: Open to suggestions and submissions Origin: Created by JaneJewel for the April 2020 Around The World Fakeathon Day 13 prompt, Madagascar
cobblemon.species.volverdi.name: Volverdi
cobblemon.species.volverdi.desc: Added Oct 27 2021 Etymology: volvox (a kind of green algae) + verde
cobblemon.species.curstar.name: Curstar
cobblemon.species.curstar.desc: It can be found crawling on the ocean floor, its singular eye piercing through the darkness. Anything that touches its tendrils is stung and dragged to its mouth, where it is promptly devoured.
cobblemon.species.shihtzoof.name: Shihtzoof
cobblemon.species.shihtzoof.desc: Added Nov 1 2021 Habitat: cities and urban areas
cobblemon.species.priminpup.name: Priminpup
cobblemon.species.priminpup.desc: Added Nov 1 2021 Habitat: cities and urban areas
cobblemon.species.cucuppy.name: Cucuppy
cobblemon.species.cucuppy.desc: Added Nov 1 2021 Etymology: cucumber + puppy Habitat: Farm
cobblemon.species.gremelon.name: Gremelon
cobblemon.species.gremelon.desc: This Pokmon is incredibly sneaky, often pretending to be a normal melon, then popping out and tripping its victim using vines!
cobblemon.species.skoopy.name: Skoopy
cobblemon.species.skoopy.desc: These Pokemon love practicing their magic, often freezing anything they can find. Whilst their magic is annoying to some, it can be very useful during hot summer days.
cobblemon.species.thornip.name: Thornip
cobblemon.species.nostroot.name: Nostroot
cobblemon.species.nostroot.desc: The eye-irritating vapor this Pokemon emits is enough to drive even the most stoic person to tears. It will only grow where someone has grieved, fertilized by their sorrow.
cobblemon.species.khthonion.name: Khthonion
cobblemon.species.khthonion.desc: Buried in the soil, it scares passersby by wrapping its hand-like leaves around their legs. It smells foul and rotten, which attracts Bug Pokemon as unwitting pollinators.
cobblemon.species.sloggin.name: Sloggin
cobblemon.species.sloggin.desc: If it feels threatened, it will emit psychedelic flashes from its eyes to disorient the opponent. It seems that the strange appendage emerging from its shell is a kind of parasite that controls some of its movements.
cobblemon.species.lucidris.name: Lucidris
cobblemon.species.lucidris.desc: It entered a dormant state to outsmart the parasite feeding on its brainwaves. Now, the parasite defends Lucidris from predators until it is ready to evolve.
cobblemon.species.chlorodra.name: Chlorodra
cobblemon.species.chlorodra.desc: Its three heads circle listlessly, as if in a trance. Its true brain is hidden within the shell; if a head is torn off, it will simply grow back with no ill effects.
cobblemon.species.cocoward.name: Cocoward
cobblemon.species.cocoward.desc: Cocoward spend their days resting under palm trees. They're not very good fighters, so they often just run for the hills when they sense danger.
cobblemon.species.cocombat.name: Cocombat
cobblemon.species.cocombat.desc: Having evolved, Cocombat are much less cowardly than their unevolved forms. They are masterful fighters, agile and powerful.
cobblemon.species.lunectric.name: Lunectric
cobblemon.species.lunectric.desc: Added Jan 13 2022 Etymology: Luna+Electric Habitat: Forest
cobblemon.species.spikid.name: Spikid
cobblemon.species.spikid.desc: From birth, these Pokmon are stuffed inside a metal shell. They live alone and aren't used to humans, so it takes a patient trainer to raise one.
cobblemon.species.matchoppa.name: Matchoppa
cobblemon.species.matchoppa.desc: Added Oct 27 2021 Etymology: match + grasshopper Evo line: Open to Evolution Submissions
cobblemon.species.wotter.name: Wotter
cobblemon.species.cyclub.name: Cyclub
cobblemon.species.angeroid.name: Angeroid
cobblemon.species.angeroid.desc: Added Oct 27 2021 Created by JaneJewel for the April 2020 Around The World Fakeathon Day 27 prompt, Olympics
cobblemon.species.teleprog.name: Teleprog
cobblemon.species.clampere.name: Clampere
cobblemon.species.balbuni.name: Balbuni
cobblemon.species.criseti.name: Criseti
cobblemon.species.criseti.desc: Added Oct 27 2021 Etymology: TBD Evo line: TBD Stats etc are placeholder until we figure out what we wanna do with this thing
cobblemon.species.anseti.name: Anseti
cobblemon.species.macrochip.name: Macrochip
cobblemon.species.vipuny.name: Vipuny
cobblemon.species.vipuny.desc: It is hatched from 1 out of exactly 100 eggs laid by within a thick carpet of sea foam, which covers the young Vipuny for protection and buoyancy. Their natural defense is to wail loudly in hopes that it scares off its attacker.
cobblemon.species.vipentide.name: Vipentide
cobblemon.species.vipentide.desc: The incredibly thick spume that spews out from a Vipentide's nostrils can block the gills or nostrils of other aquatic Pokmon, and it acts as a durable foamy armor for Vipentide as it leaps out from beneath the waves. They have incredibly fierce battles with shivers of Sharpedo.
cobblemon.species.pterabonk.name: Pterabonk
cobblemon.species.smashzal.name: Smashzal
cobblemon.species.smashzal.desc: Added Dec 21 2021 Etymology: smash + quetzalcoatlus Evo line: Complete Habitat: Mountain/Volcano Notes: Either a standard mon or fossil. high phys atk
cobblemon.species.gossnow.name: Gossnow
cobblemon.species.gossnow.desc: Because this species of Pokmon prefers to live alone, it is quickly enraged when provoked. It is capable of breaking through thick ice and rocks with its pure strength.
cobblemon.species.curdwaul.name: Curdwaul
cobblemon.species.curdwaul.desc: Curdlewaul's fur is soft and porous, meaning it absorbs water and dirt with ease, much to the chagrin of their owners.
cobblemon.species.cubreeze.name: Cubreeze
cobblemon.species.cubreeze.desc: Cubreeze live in frigid mountains, away from human activity. Their white pelts allow them to easily blend in with its snow-white surroundings.
cobblemon.species.frosstitan.name: Frosstitan
cobblemon.species.frosstitan.desc: It is sometimes called 'Terror of the Mountain' because of its fearsome appearance and vicious nature. It finishes off its prey by forming a blade of ice around its arm and slicing it apart.
cobblemon.species.waddlur.name: Waddlur
cobblemon.species.waddlur.desc: Waddlur come down from the mountains at midnight to walk the streets of remote towns, either solitary or in small groups. Their outstretched arms give the image they are looking for a warm embrace. They always vanish before dawn.
cobblemon.species.cuddlur.name: Cuddlur
cobblemon.species.cuddlur.desc: This Mon wanders remote mountains and trails looking for lost hikers trapped in the cold. It brings them to their cave homes to keep them safe.
cobblemon.species.abysprit.name: Abysprit
cobblemon.species.marvelisk.name: Marvelisk
cobblemon.species.nuptielle.name: Nuptielle
cobblemon.species.nuptielle.desc: Added Oct 27 2021 Etymology: nuptial + -elle Evo line: Complete Origin: Created by JaneJewel for the April 2020 Around The World Fakeathon Day 30 prompt, Legendary
cobblemon.species.burielle.name: Burielle
cobblemon.species.burielle.desc: Added Oct 27 2021 Etymology: burial + -elle Evo line: Complete Origin: Created by JaneJewel for the April 2020 Around The World Fakeathon Day 30 prompt, Legendary
cobblemon.species.aristocalf.name: Aristocalf
cobblemon.species.aristocalf.desc: Having rejected their royal lineage in search of enlightenment, Aristocalf are often shunned by Majestapir and as a result become estranged. They live solitary, yet happier lives free from their establishment.
cobblemon.species.majestapir.name: Majestapir
cobblemon.species.majestapir.desc: Upon reaching enlightenment and evolving, Majestapir return to help lead their original establishment or start their own with their offspring.
cobblemon.species.shrubbie.name: Shrubbie
cobblemon.species.herbelle.name: Herbelle
cobblemon.species.herbelle.desc: I said maybe, you're gonna be the one that saves me And after all, you're my wonderwall.
cobblemon.species.miralide.name: Miralide
cobblemon.species.miralide.desc: Miralide is proud of its appearance and is not afraid to show it. A walk on a field or in the forest will leave a trail of flowers full of vibrant colors.
cobblemon.species.radarent.name: Radarent
cobblemon.species.radarent.desc: Radarents best friend is the soil where it burries itself and is also a place to ambush foes with surprise attacks. They don't place nice with other Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.sparkadillo.name: Sparkadillo
cobblemon.species.armadealo.name: Armadealo
cobblemon.species.armadealo.desc: Hired during ancient times as scouts and mercenaries by wealthy families. Breaking a deal with an Armadealo would mean putting your own life at risk.
cobblemon.species.chompper.name: Chompper
cobblemon.species.chompper.desc: Chompper is easily frightened and freezes itself during panic attacks. Surviving only on a meager diet of frost and snow forces this Pokemon to constantly keep on eating.
cobblemon.species.crunchawtle.name: Crunchawtle
cobblemon.species.crunchawtle.desc: - Tackle Normal - Withdraw Water 6 Water GunSTAB Water 10 Bite Dark 14 Mist Ice 18 Water PulseSTAB Water 22 Ice FangSTAB Ice 26 Stockpile Normal 30 Razor ShellSTAB Water 35 Crunch Dark 39 Icicle SpearSTAB Ice 45 LiquidationSTAB Water 49 Iron Defense Steel 54 Icicle CrashSTAB Ice 58 Hydro PumpSTAB Water 63 Shell Smash Normal
cobblemon.species.tormightier.name: Tormightier
cobblemon.species.tormightier.desc: Toemightier's diet consists of large quantities of H2O and important minerals. Whether it's solid, liquid or gas, the leftover water turns into giant icicle spears whom work as missiles, firing off out of the shell on its back.
cobblemon.species.sengishrew.name: Sengishrew
cobblemon.species.plagarata.name: Plagarata
cobblemon.species.pomfly.name: Pomfly
cobblemon.species.snoutfly.name: Snoutfly
cobblemon.species.cockatoto.name: Cockatoto
cobblemon.species.cockatoto.desc: hippowdonatoto work in great numbers and are notrious to steal berries. When threatened, it mimics the foe in order to escape.
cobblemon.species.cockapoll.name: Cockapoll
cobblemon.species.cockapoll.desc: rayquazaapoll knows a lot about responsibility but rarely shows what it has been taught. Leading groups of cleffaatoto during great berry heists, wooperapoll is usually the worst of the bunch.
cobblemon.species.sheagull.name: Sheagull
cobblemon.species.sheagull.desc: Sheagull is an occupied monarch, being both a ruling queen while giving out flight classes to any bird Pokmon. Her nature is nurturing and kind hearted.
cobblemon.species.pharature.name: Pharature
cobblemon.species.pharature.desc: Pharature is rarely around its young ones. Instead, this large bird soars the sky by itself, covering parts of the sun with its massive wingspread. This Pokmon is also the family emblem of the royal family of Ionia and is commonly seen on post cards as stamps.
cobblemon.species.gnurogo.name: Gnurogo
cobblemon.species.woomask.name: Woomask
cobblemon.species.woomask.desc: Whenever a child gets lost in the wilderness, never to return, a Woomask may be found. If found, the finder must bring this mask Pokmon to the closest village. Then, the story has to be told to all children around so that they can bring this Pokmon through the land in the future to come.
cobblemon.species.madogo.name: Madogo
cobblemon.species.madogo.desc: On the vast and dry plains of the Ionian savannahs, this form of Madogo may be found. It is worshipped by different bushmen and shamans and it aids them in battle if their bond is strong enough. Madogo (Savannah form) has the ability to scare away evil spirits, even itself if corrupted.
cobblemon.species.sigiping.name: Sigiping
cobblemon.species.meaniechu.name: Meaniechu
cobblemon.species.meaniechu.desc: Raised in a lab, this Pokmon has become both strong and vengeful. Its sinister nature has given it the name Meaniechu. Its orb tail can break a steel cage with ease.
cobblemon.species.grubdew.name: Grubdew
cobblemon.species.grubdew.desc: The so called Gildoo Root is a quite common plant of the Ionos region. The plant itself varies in size and has a brown, wooden stem and green leaves with a yellow midrib. Grubdew has adapted to the same environment where this plant grows, having half of its body resembling the Gildoo. This camouflage protects it from other Pokmon, such as rayquazaatoto and goomyapoll.
cobblemon.species.lohopper.name: Lohopper
cobblemon.species.lohopper.desc: Lophopper work in great numbers. They practice stealth tactics and locate themselves using sound and by guidance of the stars. Their primary target is usually on peoples crops. Despite being skillful thieves, they will not escape being caught stealing. Instead, they offer a fair fight and will accept defeat if proven hors de combat.
cobblemon.species.wisopotron.name: Wisopotron
cobblemon.species.wisopotron.desc: Awake at night only to study the stars. Wisopotron always fall asleep twenty minutes after dawn with its face facing towards the sun. The back of this Pokmon is always hidden in the shadows and is a way of balancing its body heat. It is also covered with polypores which functions in a similar way as elytrons, offering excellent defense. The star shaped head along with its long neck works as an offensive weapon, much like a morning star.
cobblemon.species.dizzpin.name: Dizzpin
cobblemon.species.dizzpin.desc: Dizzpin are manmade Pokmon created to fight in small arenas. It's a game of speed, balance, confusion and who hits the hardest. A prize is commonly rewarded to the winning team.
cobblemon.species.mobono.name: Mobono
cobblemon.species.shinpanzee.name: Shinpanzee
cobblemon.species.suastalk.name: Suastalk
cobblemon.species.suastalk.desc: Stalking both people and Pokmon, it never means any harm. Suastalk is however easily caught sneaking around due to its terrible stench of fermented berries.
cobblemon.species.spikish.name: Spikish
cobblemon.species.spikish.desc: Being the most common water living Pokmon in Ionia, Spikish also causes problems. The spiky fins on its body leaves rather itchy rashes and scratches.
cobblemon.species.nommogo.name: Nommogo
cobblemon.species.felipom.name: Felipom
cobblemon.species.felipom.desc: In ancient times long before modern medicine was invented, Felipom would work as assistances in traditional apothecary shops. They are always happy to serve.
cobblemon.species.larveye.name: Larveye
cobblemon.species.eyecoon.name: Eyecoon
cobblemon.species.motholus.name: Motholus
cobblemon.species.motholus.desc: Despite being primarily a nocturnal Pokmon, Motholus is awake during any time of the day. The forest floor in the dark and dense forests where it resides has never seen the light of day. Traveling through the very same forests will certainly make you go astray and eyes will be watching you as you loose your sense of direction.
cobblemon.species.golfish.name: Golfish
cobblemon.species.golfish.desc: It can usually be sold for 5000 Pokmon Dollars in any Pok Mart.
cobblemon.species.jewereel.name: Jewereel
cobblemon.species.bubupole.name: Bubupole
cobblemon.species.bubupole.desc: Bubupole resides in craters with boiling hot water. In case of a steam eruption, they become extremely hot and usually land in the ocean. Its caudal fin controls the air flow while being airborn.
cobblemon.species.geohertoad.name: Geohertoad
cobblemon.species.geohertoad.desc: Its body is covered by lightweight lava rock, making it possible for Geohertoad to ascend to the surface. Beware, S.S. Cactus.
cobblemon.species.phrynotoad.name: Phrynotoad
cobblemon.species.phrynotoad.desc: When threatened, Phrynotoad fires off a terrible red liquid, coming from its eyes. Nothing like it has ever been witnessed in the world of Pokmon before.
cobblemon.species.jokaite.name: Jokaite
cobblemon.species.lannatee.name: Lannatee
cobblemon.species.acheeva.name: Acheeva
cobblemon.species.acheeva.desc: Outrunning an Acheeva would be considered a new Pokmon World record. Reaching such high speed has an advantage when hunting down a slower foe, such as Blitzle and Blazelle.
cobblemon.species.phantrella.name: Phantrella
cobblemon.species.phantrella.desc: Whether the sun is shining or the rain is pouring down, this Pokmon will do anything in order to protect you from the elements. The ferulle on its snout is rather small however and may not work as intended.
cobblemon.species.rockadoo.name: Rockadoo
cobblemon.species.rockadoo.desc: Being the most recent fossil Pokmon, humans once lived among it. Some blame nature to be the cause of Rockadoo's extinction. Some blame the negligence of the humans.
cobblemon.species.stiltiwalka.name: Stiltiwalka
cobblemon.species.stiltiwalka.desc: It gathers in small numbers during colorful festivals. Stiltiwalka heals the sick and brings good fortune to events to come. Looking at this Pokmon puts an instant smile of the beholder.
cobblemon.species.leaplip.name: Leaplip
cobblemon.species.loafey.name: Loafey
cobblemon.species.leonier.name: Leonier
cobblemon.species.leonet.name: Leonet
cobblemon.species.posschest.name: Posschest
cobblemon.species.figurina.name: Figurina
cobblemon.species.cordachin.name: Cordachin
cobblemon.species.cordachin.desc: Once part of a great ocean, Cordachin has adapted to life above the sea and is able to live without water for a long period of time. This Pokmon's tail mimics the motion of seagrass as it burrows its face underneath the sand; working as a camouflage. A camouflage that serves a lesser purpose today due to climate change. Cordachin has a great fear of getting eaten by a certain species of Pokmon. This may be one of many reasons for its great migration to South Ionos, away from the biting cold.
cobblemon.species.spothyena.name: Spothyena
cobblemon.species.spothyena.desc: Spothyena hunt in moderately sized packs. They are usually impatient and fight with each other over the smallest of things, mainly food.
cobblemon.species.khaheena.name: Khaheena
cobblemon.species.khaheena.desc: Unlike its pre-evolution Spothyena and its male counterpart Gormhyena, Khaheena are solitary hunters. Even though they blend in perfectly in a sandstorm, Khaheena thrives during full moon.
cobblemon.species.gormhyena.name: Gormhyena
cobblemon.species.gormhyena.desc: This lazy Pokmon rather order food from its pre evolved form than to go on a hunt itself. Whenever Gormhyena is brought any food it never shares it with the rest of the pack. This always results in a fight.
cobblemon.species.clubit.name: Clubit
cobblemon.species.swingit.name: Swingit
cobblemon.species.bonkeet.name: Bonkeet
cobblemon.species.kaidalope.name: Kaidalope
cobblemon.species.faigalope.name: Faigalope
cobblemon.species.kubite.name: Kubite
cobblemon.species.rokubandy.name: Rokubandy
cobblemon.species.sunling.name: Sunling
cobblemon.species.sunatee.name: Sunatee
cobblemon.species.exploroid.name: Exploroid
cobblemon.species.deoxavir.name: Deoxavir
cobblemon.species.minore.name: Minore
cobblemon.species.orbiter.name: Orbiter
cobblemon.species.charger.name: Charger
cobblemon.species.relido.name: Relido
cobblemon.species.primecleon.name: Primecleon
cobblemon.species.aquapo.name: Aquapo
cobblemon.species.aquadon.name: Aquadon
cobblemon.species.tinosaur.name: Tinosaur
cobblemon.species.eruptor.name: Eruptor
cobblemon.species.heloisk.name: Heloisk
cobblemon.species.mumby.name: Mumby
cobblemon.species.pharumm.name: Pharumm
cobblemon.species.caconie.name: Caconie
cobblemon.species.tennestrian.name: Tennestrian
cobblemon.species.tennestrian.desc: Ancient paintings has shown different Pokmon of matching size wearing this kind of armor, such as Machop. Many examples were made long ago, before the Ionian war. It used to be polished and clean but after thousands of years it has gotten rusty and covered in dust and sand. It is said that a restless spirit lives inside the armor itself, perhaps from a Pokmon that once wore the armor in battle.
cobblemon.species.knightmor.name: Knightmor
cobblemon.species.knightmor.desc: The body of Knightmor is nothing more than a vessel, a home for a wandering spirit; lost in time, lost at war. It is believed that this armor once belonged to a Pokmon over 3,000 years ago. The armature itself may be found in armories inside great castles. Examples are extremely rare however and a matching set is nearly impossible to find.
cobblemon.species.eevvee.name: Eevvee
cobblemon.species.eevvee.desc: Around 3,000 years ago, Eevvee was claimed as the true ancestor of Eevee by the royal families of Ionos. The people of the region later found out that it was the other way around. The true intentions of this Pokmon was to control certain events in history; such as war, plagues and even during times of peace. The origins of Eevvee still remains a mystery.
cobblemon.species.pacemeon.name: Pacemeon
cobblemon.species.pacemeon.desc: Pacemeon rarely moves an inch due to its lazy yet peaceful nature. It was first seen around 3,000 years ago during an era of peace and verdure. Only a just king or queen will earn its respect.
cobblemon.species.pestileon.name: Pestileon
cobblemon.species.pestileon.desc: If you ever stumble across a Pestileon in the desert night or inside an old crypt, you are in bad luck. This Pokmon will always point you in the wrong direction with its long, pointy ears. Spending too much time with Pestileon will make you very sick. It is highly associated with plagues and is often the cause behind them.
cobblemon.species.duelleon.name: Duelleon
cobblemon.species.duelleon.desc: Duelleon was raised for battle and stood on the front lines during the great Ionian war. Its weapon and armor is one with its body. The cause of this is unknown but legends say that Duelleon evolved next to human elite soldiers during the time of war.
cobblemon.species.pupshi.name: Pupshi
cobblemon.species.pupshi.desc: Pupshi enjoys sunbathing on top of cliffs and on old ruins. It may not fear heights but it is terrified of the dark. To journey through the desert nights, it sparks a small fire to light up its surroundings.
cobblemon.species.typhur.name: Typhur
cobblemon.species.typhur.desc: It always watches its back inside crypts and pyramids as it feels the presence of ghost Pokmon. Typhur is even scared of its own shadow, spitting fire against it.
cobblemon.species.typhoonos.name: Typhoonos
cobblemon.species.typhoonos.desc: Typherior has been granted the gift of spirit fire. Blue flames that gives off a cold sensation rather than hot. If a trainer befriends a Typherior, it may surrender on causing chaos and mayhem to the world of Pokmon.
cobblemon.species.pottlin.name: Pottlin
cobblemon.species.pottyrm.name: Pottyrm
cobblemon.species.xinigen.name: Xinigen
cobblemon.species.xinigen.desc: Xinigen moves wherever the wind blows and its intentions are as pure as the oxygen it provides the air with. That is if anybody doesn't pose a threat towards the breathable air that most Pokmon are dependent on. This legendary Pokmon may turn vengeful towards those who harm the clean air of the Pokmon World. This is shown through Xinigen's actions as it stalks quietly behind the enemies of the climate. When not travelling alone it finds good company in Sigilyph.
cobblemon.species.puffjinn.name: Puffjinn
cobblemon.species.puffjinn.desc: Puffjin can move the largest of clouds with a single breath. This legendary Pokmon serves one great purpose, to give the Pokmon World a big hug whenever it needs it. Not a warm but a cold one. The temperature is rising and some Pokmon are in danger due to climate change. Puffjin would never hurt another Pokmon unless it has no other choice. It'll only answer to wishes that grants positive changes.
cobblemon.species.minjin.name: Minjin
cobblemon.species.minjin.desc: A close relative to Chingling and Chimecho. Minjin was chosen by another legendary Pokmon of extraordinary power to provide the air of Ionos with the remaining natural gases that makes up the atmosphere. Despite being small in size it can create incredibly loud noises, often when angered or feeling threatened. The sounds this Pokmon makes is created when it splits its body into two separate parts, collecting massive amounts of air between each part and relases it all at once with a vocal blast
cobblemon.species.cerbenos.name: Cerbenos
cobblemon.species.drahoggon.name: Drahoggon
cobblemon.species.drahoggon.desc: Drahoggon represents the wild nature of every Pokmon. It's always on a rampage and has never been seen standing still.
cobblemon.species.oldeture.name: Oldeture
cobblemon.species.faunler.name: Faunler
cobblemon.species.satyrnus.name: Satyrnus
cobblemon.species.tauracho.name: Tauracho
cobblemon.species.kinbat.name: Kinbat
cobblemon.species.garpyre.name: Garpyre
cobblemon.species.duabat.name: Duabat
cobblemon.species.duabat.desc: Duabat improves its stealth by covering itself in a dark cloud of smoke. Its diet consists of different minerals that sharpens Duabats bladed wings.
cobblemon.species.fillybrum.name: Fillybrum
cobblemon.species.corashu.name: Corashu
cobblemon.species.corashu.desc: Corashu (Normal Form) is still getting used to dry land. Its insides contains water, making it possible to survive far away from any natural water source. While exploring more effectively, it transforms into an odd shaped coral, hovering around at high speeds.
cobblemon.species.campullion.name: Campullion
cobblemon.species.tarsiboo.name: Tarsiboo
cobblemon.species.tarsiboo.desc: Tarsiboo is always awake at night only to play Peekaboo.
cobblemon.species.peerhini.name: Peerhini
cobblemon.species.velitite.name: Velitite
cobblemon.species.onyssilade.name: Onyssilade
cobblemon.species.mushi.name: Mushi
cobblemon.species.mushi.desc: Mushi was first discovered on the outside of a mothership with an interior covered in alien fungi and vegetation. Its curious nature brings it closer to humans and other Pokmon. Mushi is unaware that itself is poisonous. Therefore, this fungi Pokmon keeps on smiling as it infects its surroundings.
cobblemon.species.mutungus.name: Mutungus
cobblemon.species.mutungus.desc: When a Mushi evolves into a Mutungus it does so forcefully. This is due to strong levels of radiation. The source of the high levels of radiation are unknown but scientists believe that it comes from outer space. Certain groups of people believe that a very powerful Pokmon is the source of these both invisible and dangerous forces.
cobblemon.species.mushshi.name: Mush-Shi
cobblemon.species.mimicorn.name: Mimicorn
cobblemon.species.mimicorn.desc: The decay product from the berries swallowed by Mimicorn eventually turns into filthy projectiles. The stem on its head works as a small cannon.
cobblemon.species.grumchick.name: Grumchick
cobblemon.species.grumchick.desc: Grumchick constantly fights brutally with its siblings. The one whos proven to be the strongest is worthy to stay with its parents.
cobblemon.species.horribill.name: Horribill
cobblemon.species.horribill.desc: If two or more Grumchicks are born, Horribill will only raise one of them. This results in leaving the weaker chicks to their own faith.
cobblemon.species.moschievous.name: Moschievous
cobblemon.species.embush.name: Embush
cobblemon.species.embush.desc: Embush is still getting used to the said-to-be sacred fire burning on its body. It is constantly running around due to its eternal pain. Coming from around a corner and being approached by this Pokmon may seem like an ambush but is most likely yet another panic attack.
cobblemon.species.yatatree.name: Yatatree
cobblemon.species.humini.name: Humini
cobblemon.species.bellagon.name: Bellagon
cobblemon.species.bellagon.desc: - AbsorbSTAB Grass - Agility Psychic - Gust Flying - Grassy Terrain Grass 8 Quick Attack Normal 16 Teeter Dance Normal 20 Air Cutter Flying 25 Feather Dance Flying 35 Wing Attack Flying 43 Petal DanceSTAB Grass 48 Dragon Dance Dragon 54 Dragon RushSTAB Dragon 59 Acrobatics Flying 68 Extreme Speed Normal
cobblemon.species.palazy.name: Smokebreak
cobblemon.species.palegon.name: Palegon
cobblemon.species.palegon.desc: Some Pokmon never see the light of day. One such Pokmon is Palegon, a cave dwelling, fire breathing lizard. A dragon whom is cold on the outside yet warm on the inside. At least the fire that burns within it. Palegon will only accept the strongest of trainers.
cobblemon.species.scubargon.name: Scubargon
cobblemon.species.sermurgon.name: Sermurgon
cobblemon.species.clownemone.name: Buggisk
cobblemon.species.clownfisk.name: Clownfisk
cobblemon.species.sprawniple.name: Sprawniple
cobblemon.species.sprawniple.desc: It investigates gruesome scenes in the depths of the ocean by itself. Outside of work, they are seen in large numbers.
cobblemon.species.angligh.name: Angligh
cobblemon.species.tranoler.name: Tranoler
cobblemon.species.chatart.name: Chatart
cobblemon.species.minkin.name: Minkin
cobblemon.species.minkin.desc: Minkin's cry and purring soothes the Pokmon of the night and its baby doll eyes can make even the most fearsome foe friendly towards it. The tiny legs on its body makes the kids giggle.
cobblemon.species.rivacal.name: Rivacal
cobblemon.species.rivacal.desc: Rivacal aids Pokmon in need. Whether they are hurt or have fainted, it will be there in an instant. Some people say that it arrived to the Pokmon World by during a night full of shooting stars.
cobblemon.species.bultin.name: Bultin
cobblemon.species.clusturb.name: Clusturb
cobblemon.species.shortulp.name: Shortulp
cobblemon.species.antello.name: Antello
cobblemon.species.porygony.name: Porygon-Y
cobblemon.species.fefae.name: Fefae
cobblemon.species.safauna.name: Safauna
cobblemon.species.nimbat.name: Nimbat
cobblemon.species.nimbat.desc: Cloubat lives inside mountainous caves where thunder can be heard. They charge themselves by gathering electricity stored inside dark clouds, or by using their tail and muzzle together like an outlet while asleep. Their sense of smell and memory is said to be excellent.
cobblemon.species.marbel.name: Marbel
cobblemon.species.marbel.desc: It is extremely difficult to tell if Marbel is a statue or in fact a Pokmon. Some believe that it is both. It changes its pose when nobody is watching. Legends say that this Pokmon will only wake up and learn how to walk on certain days of the Ionan calendar.
cobblemon.species.marbelous.name: Marbelous
cobblemon.species.marbelous.desc: This Pokmon lingers in the past and imagines itself as a guard of royal a palace. Truth is however that Marbelous hobbles among the ruins of destroyed buildings from a long time ago, all by itself. The marble shield on its right side has the shape of a wheel of cheese and doesn't need carrying.
cobblemon.species.destructos.name: Destructos
cobblemon.species.destructos.desc: Destructos is a force to be reckoned with. Each step that this ancient Pokmon takes causes small earthquakes. Only the finest marble pillar is chosen as its weapon.
cobblemon.species.bubill.name: Bubill
cobblemon.species.bubill.desc: Whenever children are taken away by Daimonize and dragged to the underworld, they eventually turn into Bubill. A mean spirited Pokmon that doesn't play well with others. The intense and fiery glare of Bubill can burn rocks and trees to cinder and ash.
cobblemon.species.daimonize.name: Daimonize
cobblemon.species.daimonize.desc: Despite being smaller than its distant relative, they're equally as strong. Daimonize (Coniferous form) can cause ashy weather conditions that is often believed to be snowfall.
cobblemon.species.gildthera.name: Gildthera
cobblemon.species.pythion.name: Pythion
cobblemon.species.taurion.name: Taurion
cobblemon.species.regishard.name: Regishard
cobblemon.species.regishard.desc: Regishard's codes were once found in the Toxic Jungles of the southern part of Ionios. Being nearly impossible to encrypt, scientists succeeded to reveal a 'formula for a darker future' in its data. Nobody does however know the true intentions of this Legendary Golem from far beyond.
cobblemon.species.nightrogen.name: Nightrogen
cobblemon.species.nightrogen.desc: Nightrogen (UB - 60 Pulse) appears to have the ability to support the air with the majority of breathable particles for all people and Pokmon. During nighttime when everybody is asleep, UB-60 sends out electric pulses through its kind spirited mind, like calm waves of a sparkling ocean. The same pulses fills the air with nitrogen.
cobblemon.species.snipsnap.name: Snipsnap
cobblemon.species.snipsnap.desc: Snipsnap uses its large claws to cut down branches with fresh foliage to eat. When it grinds its pincers together, it generates a weak static charge.
cobblemon.species.crable.name: Crable
cobblemon.species.crable.desc: It rubs its needle-covered arms together to build up charge. This also causes its needles to stand on end, making contact with it prickly and painful.
cobblemon.species.lobstrike.name: Lobstrike
cobblemon.species.lobstrike.desc: It can release enough electricity through its claws to power a car. Long ago, it was thought that thunder was the sound of a massive Lobstrike snapping its claws.
cobblemon.species.impyre.name: Impyre
cobblemon.species.impyre.desc: It's always snuggling up with its Trainer for their body heat. It's advised to give it a hot water bottle and a blanket if it has to be on its own.
cobblemon.species.incubat.name: Incubat
cobblemon.species.incubat.desc: It perches on tall buildings, staring down menacingly to inspire fear. It's known for treachery and trickery, but it's forever loyal to a Trainer that's earned its respect.
cobblemon.species.nocturnace.name: Nocturnace
cobblemon.species.nocturnace.desc: The flames it spews from its nose are pitch-black and agonizing. Superstitious types believe that it has dark powers it uses to compel others into doing its bidding.
cobblemon.species.scuddle.name: Scuddle
cobblemon.species.scuddle.desc: It's somewhat clumsy, so it spills the water it carries quite often. Plants that are accidentally watered this way grow much larger than normal.
cobblemon.species.bubbeetle.name: Bubbeetle
cobblemon.species.bubbeetle.desc: Its water is always pure enough to drink. If its supply ever runs low, it becomes stressed and upset, so Trainers must take care to monitor its water level.
cobblemon.species.cascarapace.name: Cascarapace
cobblemon.species.cascarapace.desc: It has a miniature ecosystem thriving on its back. The oldest wild Cascarapace have plants growing on them that have never been seen anywhere else.
cobblemon.species.fervole.name: Fervole
cobblemon.species.fervole.desc: Common in northern Novrai, this small Pokemon spends its life surrounded by others of its kind. They must be kept in pairs when owned as pets.
cobblemon.species.volentine.name: Volentine
cobblemon.species.volentine.desc: In spring, pairs of Volentine run gleefully through the tall grass, laughing and squeaking. It eats mostly root vegetables, but has an affinity for chocolates as well.
cobblemon.species.sidepeck.name: Sidepeck
cobblemon.species.sidepeck.desc: It tries to save small Bug-types from high places, such as tree branches. Unfortunately, it always forgets its goal and ends up eating them itself.
cobblemon.species.justork.name: Justork
cobblemon.species.justork.desc: It lives in urban areas, brooding on the tallest buildings. It soars down when it sees danger, but in its haste to show off it often misses the perpetrator.
cobblemon.species.superheron.name: Superheron
cobblemon.species.superheron.desc: Its hearing is keen, letting it sense distress from far away. It always fights for justice and protects anyone that cannot protect themselves.
cobblemon.species.dusby.name: Dusby
cobblemon.species.dusby.desc: Colonies of them can be found living underneath beds in unswept rooms. It is skittish and flees as soon as it is seen, leaving only a trail of dust behind it.
cobblemon.species.dusturby.name: Dusturby
cobblemon.species.dusturby.desc: It has grown large and fearsome after gorging itself on dirt and dust. Parents warn that if children do not tidy their rooms, a Dusturby may emerge from under their beds to gobble them.
cobblemon.species.gourmaggot.name: Gourmaggot
cobblemon.species.gourmaggot.desc: It spends most of its time eating whatever's around. It isn't picky at all, and will happily chow down on leaves, carrion, mushrooms, and even dirt.
cobblemon.species.pheromage.name: Pheromage
cobblemon.species.pheromage.desc: Fancy chefs keep a few in their kitchens and serve some of their cheese as an appetizer. Pheromage doesn't mind, as long as it gets plenty of food in return.
cobblemon.species.winture.name: Winture
cobblemon.species.winture.desc: From birth, this Pokemon is full of curiosity and starts exploring. After only a week, it can scale a cliff as fast as a professional rock climber.
cobblemon.species.expolar.name: Expolar
cobblemon.species.expolar.desc: It's always looking for a harder challenge to conquer. Some humans have climbed mountains only to find troops of Expolar that have lived there for decades.
cobblemon.species.bijarre.name: Bijarre
cobblemon.species.bijarre.desc: It gains the memories of the deceased person whose remains it holds. Oddly, it also seems to adopt some aspects of their personality.
cobblemon.species.phantique.name: Phantique
cobblemon.species.phantique.desc: If its clay pot is shattered, it is banished permanently to the spirit world. Sometimes, museums will put this Pokemon in their exhibits.
cobblemon.species.glaburrow.name: Glaburrow
cobblemon.species.glaburrow.desc: Its skin is thick and pliable, so it can escape from even a cave-in unharmed. It digs elaborate tunnel systems that can support whole ecosystems.
cobblemon.species.glaborehol.name: Glaborehol
cobblemon.species.glaborehol.desc: With its sharp teeth and many limbs, it can bore through solid rock. Often, a Glaborehol will dig out a primary tunnel, and Glaburrow will follow to create smaller offshoots.
cobblemon.species.neurymph.name: Neurymph
cobblemon.species.neurymph.desc: It sends signals to others by emitting subtle psychic pulses. Neurymph eggs are commonly laid upon the back of a Cascarapace.
cobblemon.species.cognisalis.name: Cognisalis
cobblemon.species.cognisalis.desc: Training a Cognisalis for too long without evolving it can cause memory loss. In some cases, one may even forget that it has an evolution at all.
cobblemon.species.memosquito.name: Memosquito
cobblemon.species.memosquito.desc: It leaves an itchy spot after biting. If someone tries to recall a memory that it's eaten, the itchiness intensifies, causing them to scratch their head.
cobblemon.species.wibow.name: Wibow
cobblemon.species.wibow.desc: Wibow hurls itself at its prey's neck to drain their body fluids. Its abdomen is so adhesive that victims have no choice but to let it eat its fill.
cobblemon.species.tarantailor.name: Tarantailor
cobblemon.species.tarantailor.desc: It sits on its Trainer's head as a sign of affection. Unfortunately, it leaves behind a sticky residue that's a nightmare to wash out of hair.
cobblemon.species.peculine.name: Peculine
cobblemon.species.peculine.desc: A bizarre creature that displays traits from several unrelated groups of Pokemon. It's very rare in the wild, but valued by collectors.
cobblemon.species.quezabeast.name: Quezabeast
cobblemon.species.quezabeast.desc: It was known historically as a herald of great change. It battles alongside revolutionaries and uses its strange powers to confound foes.
cobblemon.species.nectair.name: Nectair
cobblemon.species.nectair.desc: It resembles Novraian Cherubi so it can sneak up on them and feed on their sweet juices. It beats its wings over a hundred times per second.
cobblemon.species.soarup.name: Soarup
cobblemon.species.soarup.desc: It can be trained to regurgitate the sap it drains from trees. The sap is then boiled down into a delectable syrup that people and Pokemon love.
cobblemon.species.vileech.name: Vileech
cobblemon.species.vileech.desc: If you must travel through its habitat at night, rub garlic on any exposed skin. It can't stand the scent and will stay far away instead of biting.
cobblemon.species.encreech.name: Encreech
cobblemon.species.encreech.desc: It's rumored that anyone bitten by an Encreech will degrade into a pile of Vileech during the next full moon if the wound is left untreated.
cobblemon.species.eggoo.name: Yolkoo
cobblemon.species.eggoo.desc: It's actually a larva that mimics an egg, usually placed in another Pokemon's nest. It's a natural bully and pushes other Pokemon around while crying loudly for food.
cobblemon.species.cantankoo.name: Cantankoo
cobblemon.species.cantankoo.desc: It's so lazy that it places its offspring in other Pokemon's nests. It will usually push one of the eggs out of the nest so it appears nothing has changed.
cobblemon.species.whispore.name: Whispore
cobblemon.species.whispore.desc: It murmurs strange incantations as it absorbs decaying matter. It has a fondness for collecting flowers from where it feeds.
cobblemon.species.mysoleum.name: Mysoleum
cobblemon.species.mysoleum.desc: Each time it consumes a corpse, a new fruit sprouts. When the last person mourning the individual finally moves on, the fruit bursts into spores.
cobblemon.species.gorgarden.name: Gorgarden
cobblemon.species.gorgarden.desc: Although it appears innocuous, if its population is left unchecked it can quickly overrun forests. It collects flowers it likes and weaves them into its vines.
cobblemon.species.kudzusa.name: Kudzusa
cobblemon.species.kudzusa.desc: It spreads its vines far and wide, strangling the landscape until everything resembles leaf-covered statues. It can only be defeated by attacking its head.
cobblemon.species.bonsquire.name: Bonsquire
cobblemon.species.bonsquire.desc: It feeds on the glowing embers and kindling left from unattended campfires. During the dry season, its numbers increase dramatically.
cobblemon.species.campsire.name: Campsire
cobblemon.species.campsire.desc: It covers itself in a fireproof material to protect itself from weather. It burns swaths of forests to the ground to create ash-filled clearings in which to raise its young.
cobblemon.species.sockback.name: Sockback
cobblemon.species.sockback.desc: An artificial Pokemon designed to help train other Pokemon for battle. It can stand up to even the strongest beatings without falling over.
cobblemon.species.blockstack.name: Blockstack
cobblemon.species.blockstack.desc: When helping to train stronger Pokemon, Sockback evolves into Blockstack. Now it fights back with its rotating arms, helping other Pokemon learn to dodge attacks.
cobblemon.species.platypull.name: Platypull
cobblemon.species.platypull.desc: It produces such a strong magnetic field that bits of metal are attracted to it. When it dives underwater, it even sometimes unearths valuable ore.
cobblemon.species.magnetreme.name: Magnetreme
cobblemon.species.magnetreme.desc: It bends the metal it attracts into protective body armor. It's always looking for new pieces of metal to reinforce its armor or to replace worn-out parts.
cobblemon.species.narysite.name: Narysite
cobblemon.species.narysite.desc: What appear to be its nostrils are actually the eyes of its symbiotic worm. The worm has incredible eyesight even underground, and helps the body to navigate when digging.
cobblemon.species.condyceps.name: Condyceps
cobblemon.species.condyceps.desc: It burrows just under the surface of the earth, letting the worm stretch above ground to graze on tall plants. Scientists still debate which of the two is the true host.
cobblemon.species.dekoi.name: Dekoi
cobblemon.species.dekoi.desc: It wears the skin of its Magikarp prey as a disguise. Sometimes it's fished up by accident, but it's usually thrown back.
cobblemon.species.imitacean.name: Imitacean
cobblemon.species.imitacean.desc: Somehow, its evolution caused its Magikarp disguise to change and fuse with it. It now shares over 95% of its DNA with Gyarados.
cobblemon.species.snoozea.name: Snoozea
cobblemon.species.snoozea.desc: It drifts across the surface of the ocean, basking in sunlight. At night, it sinks deep below the waves, though nobody knows where.
cobblemon.species.sosola.name: Sosola
cobblemon.species.sosola.desc: It lies flat on its back to absorb lots of sunlight. In the wild, it only evolves during the summer solstice, the longest day of the year.
cobblemon.species.atlaxocean.name: Atlaxocean
cobblemon.species.atlaxocean.desc: Its tailfin glows with collected sunlight. In the evenings, it dives down deep and brings light to abyssal plants to help them grow.
cobblemon.species.eyeti.name: Eyeti
cobblemon.species.eyeti.desc: It floats up to the surface from the deepest parts of the ocean, examining life on land. No one knows what information it gathers before returning to the sea.
cobblemon.species.cerebarrel.name: Cerebarrel
cobblemon.species.cerebarrel.desc: The probes at its sides act of their own accord, but the main body can see through their eyes. It's been seen swimming through the air, miles away from any body of water.
cobblemon.species.infestinal.name: Infestinal
cobblemon.species.infestinal.desc: It roots itself inside a rock and never leaves. At the bottom of the ocean, hundreds of Infestinal gather around underwater volcanoes, feeding on chemical eruptions.
cobblemon.species.horrendible.name: Horrendible
cobblemon.species.horrendible.desc: It buries itself so deep underground that its full body length has never been seen. When something brushes against its antennae, it snaps its massive jaws shut and injects venom.
cobblemon.species.slugic.name: Slugic
cobblemon.species.slugic.desc: It grows and sheds many shells throughout its life. When it's threatened, it can pull itself entirely into its shell and disappear, reappearing in one of its old, abandoned shells.
cobblemon.species.noudini.name: Noudini
cobblemon.species.noudini.desc: It can cast a wide array of magical spells using its coral-branch wand, but for some reason all of these spells involve sprays of sticky slime.
cobblemon.species.candleru.name: Candleru
cobblemon.species.candleru.desc: Its head is coated in wax that can burn even underwater. It's oddly compelled to light itself on fire, so it follows Trainers with Fire-type Pokemon, hoping to join them.
cobblemon.species.smeltdown.name: Smeltdown
cobblemon.species.smeltdown.desc: A Candleru lucky enough to be set aflame evolves into Smeltdown. Its powerful flames cannot be extinguished by water, making it a dangerous and unusual predator.
cobblemon.species.exfinguish.name: Exfinguish
cobblemon.species.exfinguish.desc: Older Candleru gradually lose their capacity to catch fire, and eventually evolve into Exfinguish. Merely being in this Pokemon's presence is enough to snuff out most flames.
cobblemon.species.marimigo.name: Marimigo
cobblemon.species.marimigo.desc: A docile Pokemon that loves to cuddle. It sleeps at the bottom of cold lakes, spreading a wide network of roots across the floor.
cobblemon.species.knapback.name: Knapback
cobblemon.species.knapback.desc: When it finds something it likes, it keeps it inside its shell. This shell is hollow and soft, so it serves as storage rather than protection.
cobblemon.species.bulkpack.name: Bulkpack
cobblemon.species.bulkpack.desc: It builds muscle by carrying heavy objects like rocks inside its shell. However, sometimes it may forget to store any actual supplies.
cobblemon.species.heftersack.name: Heftersack
cobblemon.species.heftersack.desc: It keeps a massive supply of food in the many pockets of its shell. It's so well-stocked that it can survive for a year off of only what it carries around with it.
cobblemon.species.puppanzee.name: Puppanzee
cobblemon.species.puppanzee.desc: Groups of Puppanzee swing through the treetops, slamming into one another. It's sometimes mistaken for a toy, but children can be hurt trying to play with it.
cobblemon.species.gorilloquy.name: Gorilloquy
cobblemon.species.gorilloquy.desc: It moves the false Puppanzee on its arms so skillfully they seem to be alive. It loves confounding its foes with this technique before pummeling them.
cobblemon.species.drumble.name: Drumble
cobblemon.species.drumble.desc: An odd Pokemon that can be seen sitting in treetops, grazing on leaves. It clumsily falls from its perches often, but its hard scales keep it safe.
cobblemon.species.draggop.name: Draggop
cobblemon.species.draggop.desc: It can no longer live in the trees, but it still has a powerful leap. It pounces on its prey, but since its prey consists of shrubs and bushes, this is largely for show.
cobblemon.species.draborate.name: Draborate
cobblemon.species.draborate.desc: Though weighed down by its magnificent shell and horns, it can move in surprisingly fast bursts. These decorations are only for protection and display, as it is still a docile herbivore.
cobblemon.species.atmosoft.name: Atmosoft
cobblemon.species.atmosoft.desc: Its body is mostly composed of water. It is so lightweight that even the slightest breeze can send it flying through the air.
cobblemon.species.nimbluff.name: Nimbluff
cobblemon.species.nimbluff.desc: Its temperament has shifted, and now it is reckless and aggressive. It stores up electricity in its body, then releases it in a huge spark when bashing itself against others.
cobblemon.species.stormendous.name: Stormendous
cobblemon.species.stormendous.desc: Having reined in its bad attitude, Stormendous is a peaceful and kindhearted Pokemon that brings rain to dry areas and clears up the skies during downpours.
cobblemon.species.chillow.name: Chillow
cobblemon.species.chillow.desc: Its rear is intensely cold. When it falls asleep, it buries itself face-down in the snow, so only its coldest half is exposed to enemies.
cobblemon.species.mattreeze.name: Mattreeze
cobblemon.species.mattreeze.desc: It fancies itself a hero and tries to rescue explorers lost in frigid wastelands. It may carry off Expolar that it locates, dropping them off by the nearest town.
cobblemon.species.kitterwaul.name: Kitterwaul
cobblemon.species.kitterwaul.desc: Some say that seeing a Kitterwaul's piercing yellow eyes gazing at you from afar is a sign of bad luck, but really they're just shy. Their amorphous bodies can shift like shadows.
cobblemon.species.impawzible.name: Impawzible
cobblemon.species.impawzible.desc: It stretches out its neck and tail to follow humans around. When the moon is bright, its starry veil begins to glow and it sings a strange, yowling song into the night sky.
cobblemon.species.gliderweb.name: Gliderweb
cobblemon.species.gliderweb.desc: The patterns on its inflated abdomen frighten away predators. As it drifts, it dangles a line of sticky silk below it, hoping to catch prey.
cobblemon.species.sunglew.name: Sunglew
cobblemon.species.sunglew.desc: The stalk growing from its head is covered in droplets of sweet but sticky nectar. It uses the stalk to catch its prey, which it then consumes at its leisure.
cobblemon.species.drozerain.name: Drozerain
cobblemon.species.drozerain.desc: Its four heavy, sticky arms give it an advantage when fighting most other Pokemon. As soon as its foe is stuck, it will wrap them in a crushing bear hug to defeat them.
cobblemon.species.mushmettle.name: Mushmettle
cobblemon.species.mushmettle.desc: It's actually a fungal Pokemon, with a soft body full of spores. It was born from a branch carrying certain spores being struck by lightning and catching fire.
cobblemon.species.smashkebab.name: Smashkebab
cobblemon.species.smashkebab.desc: When it pummels a foe with its fiery punches, it gives off huge amounts of smoke. Its enemies smell delicious for hours after it defeats them.
cobblemon.species.puppond.name: Puppond
cobblemon.species.puppond.desc: Originally, it was trained to herd fish into a net so they could be easily scooped out of the water. It's a loyal pet for those who don't mind the wet dog smell.
cobblemon.species.pembrook.name: Pembrook
cobblemon.species.pembrook.desc: A brave Pokemon commonly raised by lifeguards. It's a powerful swimmer that can sense distress in the water and quickly save people from drowning.
cobblemon.species.ratten.name: Ratten
cobblemon.species.ratten.desc: It can lie completely still for days on end, not even breathing. But the moment someone touches it, it springs to life with a shout, then runs away.
cobblemon.species.possessum.name: Possessum
cobblemon.species.possessum.desc: Flies are attracted to its horrible odor, giving it a convenient source of prey. Its body falls apart when attacked, but it can rebuild itself without any issue.
cobblemon.species.splattod.name: Splattod
cobblemon.species.splattod.desc: It marks its territory with a spray of colorful toxins. These toxins remain potent even after drying, so it's a pest in urban areas.
cobblemon.species.vandibal.name: Vandibal
cobblemon.species.vandibal.desc: It always lives among individuals of different colors. The toxins they spray were once used to make Repels, but this practice was discontinued due to environmental concerns.
cobblemon.species.jalopig.name: Jalopig
cobblemon.species.jalopig.desc: It races down the streets of Novrai, running over anything in its path. Trainers who aren't cautious may be sent flying after a collision with a Jalopig.
cobblemon.species.hotrog.name: Hotrog
cobblemon.species.hotrog.desc: A naturally competitive creature, it races others of its kind to see who's the fastest. This behavior has been adapted into one of Novrai's most beloved sports.
cobblemon.species.grenaize.name: Grenaize
cobblemon.species.grenaize.desc: It can spontaneously raise its body temperature, causing itself to explode. It loves nothing more than waking up its Trainer by blowing up in their face.
cobblemon.species.blastalk.name: Blastalk
cobblemon.species.blastalk.desc: It has become docile as it stores up energy for evolution. If it's disturbed, it can still explode, but this is strictly a last resort for it.
cobblemon.species.coboom.name: Coboom
cobblemon.species.coboom.desc: Its evolution almost always comes with a violent explosion. Farmers employ it to scare birds away from their crops using its deafening detonations.
cobblemon.species.dimwatt.name: Dimwatt
cobblemon.species.dimwatt.desc: It's usually slow-witted, but sometimes it is struck by a flash of inspiration. When this happens, its bulb glows brightly.
cobblemon.species.bulbright.name: Bulbright
cobblemon.species.bulbright.desc: It draws energy from new ideas, so it's most at home around big cities with inventors and artists. It can deliver small jolts to forgetful people to jog their memories.
cobblemon.species.brillumint.name: Brillumint
cobblemon.species.brillumint.desc: Those exposed to a Brillumint's light often report moments of sudden insight, letting them see a seemingly unsolvable problem from a new perspective.
cobblemon.species.alkaalite.name: Alkaalite
cobblemon.species.alkaalite.desc: It can punch over fifty times per second, but only for a short while before it gets tired. It may transmit energy to another member of its species via a firm handshake.
cobblemon.species.oblittery.name: Oblittery
cobblemon.species.oblittery.desc: Its aggressive tendencies are multiplied tenfold when it's overloaded with electricity. It may intentionally break electrical devices, trying to provoke confrontations.
cobblemon.species.durassault.name: Durassault
cobblemon.species.durassault.desc: In its chest is a powerful dynamo that provides it with the energy to attack. In a pinch, this dynamo goes into overdrive, giving it a tremendous power-up.
cobblemon.species.kookout.name: Kookout
cobblemon.species.kookout.desc: Its body is filled with a massive amount of pressure, making it volatile. If struck hard enough, the top of its head goes flying, exposing its soft internal organs to predators.
cobblemon.species.ovection.name: Ovection
cobblemon.species.ovection.desc: Ovection grows delicious foods inside itself, which are cooked to perfection by its internal temperature. Hungry Pokemon flock to its distinctive scent to get a taste.
cobblemon.species.tunnowl.name: Tunnowl
cobblemon.species.tunnowl.desc: Though capable of flight, it prefers to run at high speeds to evade enemies. It can't dig very well yet, so it lives in tunnels made by Onix and Narysite.
cobblemon.species.prospecktor.name: Prospecktor
cobblemon.species.prospecktor.desc: It carves minerals from the caves it lives in to supplement its diet. It will often repurpose abandoned minecarts as nests in which to lay its eggs.
cobblemon.species.raptorado.name: Raptorado
cobblemon.species.raptorado.desc: A proud, show-offish Pokemon that collects nuggets of pure gold to decorate its nests. Some Raptorado will steal gold from others' nests to add to their own.
cobblemon.species.playmight.name: Playmight
cobblemon.species.playmight.desc: It brutally smashes rocks into smaller, geometric pieces, then uses them to assemble complex structures. Each part of its body is made of a different mineral.
cobblemon.species.khanstruct.name: Khanstruct
cobblemon.species.khanstruct.desc: When a Khanstruct stands guard, nothing will pass by without its notice. It litters its territory with sharp, jagged chunks of rock to discourage trespassers on foot.
cobblemon.species.graemblin.name: Graemblin
cobblemon.species.graemblin.desc: It has a single eye and a single tooth, both of which may suddenly fall out of its head. It becomes meek and desperate if either of these are stolen from it.
cobblemon.species.gangraeae.name: Gangraeae
cobblemon.species.gangraeae.desc: The three heads bicker constantly, fighting each other for their shared eye and tooth. The only thing that can quell their squabbling is a common enemy to defeat.
cobblemon.species.seekore.name: Seekore
cobblemon.species.seekore.desc: A strange Pokemon, believed to have been created by humans long ago. It dwells inside caves, using its sturdy metal claws to scgoomy and pry iron loose.
cobblemon.species.ransaxe.name: Ransaxe
cobblemon.species.ransaxe.desc: Singlemindedly dedicated to excavating precious metals, just one Ransaxe can deplete a mine of all its ore. It is a brute in battle as well, using its sharp legs to attack foes mercilessly.
cobblemon.species.rasgold.name: Rasgold
cobblemon.species.rasgold.desc: It appears to be made of solid gold, but analysis reveals its composition to be closer to copper. It's said it was created by a greedy legendary Pokemon to guard its treasure hoard.
cobblemon.species.caughtton.name: Caughtton
cobblemon.species.caughtton.desc: A social species that greets others of its kind by rubbing up against each other affectionately. This builds static electricity in its body, which it then uses to defend itself against attackers.
cobblemon.species.amalgarment.name: Amalgarment
cobblemon.species.amalgarment.desc: It's made up of Caughtton stuck together through built-up static charge. Pokemon resistant to electricity may use it as a place to sleep, due to how soft and warm it is.
cobblemon.species.peepsqueak.name: Peepsqueak
cobblemon.species.peepsqueak.desc: It's full of lighter-than-air gases which let it float through the sky. It's a common sight at carnivals, but it's terrified of darts.
cobblemon.species.malloon.name: Malloon
cobblemon.species.malloon.desc: A gentle, gregarious Pokemon which is loved by many throughout Novrai. Great flocks of them bob up and down through the sky, unbothered even during harsh lightning storms.
cobblemon.species.itachill.name: Itachill
cobblemon.species.itachill.desc: It's native to the coldest parts of Novrai, but migrates south during the summer. Groups of them huddle together to sleep to maximize the cold produced by their fur.
cobblemon.species.itaffura.name: Itaffura
cobblemon.species.itaffura.desc: Itaffura uses its long, furry tail to wrap up baby Itachill and keep them cool. Clothing woven from its fur is known for keeping the wearer warm in the winter and cool in the summer.
cobblemon.species.slippetal.name: Slippetal
cobblemon.species.slippetal.desc: It mates for life, and wraps a vine tightly around its partner, never letting go. Typically docile and passive, it will flail wildly if any attempt is made to separate the two.
cobblemon.species.pistiletto.name: Pistiletto
cobblemon.species.pistiletto.desc: Two Slippetal have fused into a single being, so they never have to be apart. It sheds the glass rose it grows once a year, and these roses are traditional wedding gifts to ensure marital bliss.
cobblemon.species.athlace.name: Athlace
cobblemon.species.athlace.desc: It bashes its head against rocks and boulders to toughen itself up. To relax, it splashes around in mud puddles with others of its kind.
cobblemon.species.athcleat.name: Athcleat
cobblemon.species.athcleat.desc: It balances round rocks on its nose, then launches them at foes with tremendous force. Once it has chosen a mate, the two will work together for the rest of their lives.
cobblemon.species.acipeasi.name: Acipeasi
cobblemon.species.acipeasi.desc: It defends itself by blowing raspberries, showering its opponents in acidic, electrified juice. This juice is used as a garnish in many dishes, but it must be diluted due to how sour it is.
cobblemon.species.zestatic.name: Zestatic
cobblemon.species.zestatic.desc: It grinds its two halves against each other to power up the battery in its core. A high-sugar diet makes its juice more palatable to humans, but also leads to sluggishness and other issues.
cobblemon.species.fawntom.name: Fawntom
cobblemon.species.fawntom.desc: In the middle of the night, it can be seen stalking through the woods, its movements jerky and unnatural. It grazes exclusively on dead grass.
cobblemon.species.morboose.name: Morboose
cobblemon.species.morboose.desc: Its glowing antlers attract wandering spirits which then fall under its command. A foe that endures the onslaught of angry souls will find itself staring down a furious, charging Morboose.
cobblemon.species.verminion.name: Verminion
cobblemon.species.verminion.desc: Alone, it's a relatively harmless and docile creature. If too many gather in the same area, they will begin to swarm, and they can strip all the foliage from an area in a matter of hours.
cobblemon.species.abdominion.name: Abdominion
cobblemon.species.abdominion.desc: Feared by ancient civilizations as a harbinger of destruction and plague, it's always followed by a swarm of Verminion. Wherever it lands, it goes on a rampage, devouring everything it can find.
cobblemon.species.miscuit.name: Miscuit
cobblemon.species.miscuit.desc: It appears to hungry travellers and offers pieces of its body to eat. Then it disappears, leaving behind a tantalizing trail of crumbs that leads the poor souls to their doom.
cobblemon.species.maliscuit.name: Maliscuit
cobblemon.species.maliscuit.desc: The souls of those who follow Miscuit are inevitably drawn to and trapped within a Maliscuit. A single piece of its body contains enough sugar to knock an adult into a coma.
cobblemon.species.bananza.name: Bananza
cobblemon.species.bananza.desc: Its skin is tough and rubbery, but also a serious slipping hazard. Unwary Trainers may slip on one of the mush puddles it leaves behind, and then be swarmed by Bananza that want to play.
cobblemon.species.morostache.name: Morostache
cobblemon.species.morostache.desc: A parasitic Pokemon that attaches itself above the mouths of larger creatures, stealing pieces of food with its hairy whiskers as they eat. Once it falls asleep, though, it can be easily removed.
cobblemon.species.impostache.name: Impostache
cobblemon.species.impostache.desc: It coils its body around trees so that at night, intruders on its territory see a large, scary face glaring down at them. Legend tells of an old, bearded man who transformed into an Impostache to enact trickery.
cobblemon.species.morosquatch.name: Morosquatch
cobblemon.species.morosquatch.desc: Despite its imposing appearance, it's a timid creature that feeds on rotting wood and leaves and prefers to avoid being seen. Tales of hairy forest giants are common in the areas to which it's native.
cobblemon.species.herbald.name: Herbald
cobblemon.species.herbald.desc: It lives in the same areas as Tangela, and seems jealous of its long, flowing vines. Its soil quality is so poor that only a truly miraculous seed can grow within it.
cobblemon.species.toupary.name: Toupeary
cobblemon.species.toupary.desc: It's overjoyed by the mess of vines and leaves that have sprouted from its head. The improvement in its disposition seems to have made its soil more fertile, too, and now many other plants can thrive within it.
cobblemon.species.fistiscuff.name: Fistiscuff
cobblemon.species.fistiscuff.desc: It has tremendous strength, but it will never attack an opponent unless hit first. If it sees another Pokemon being bullied, it will take it upon itself to break up the conflict.
cobblemon.species.elegent.name: Elegent
cobblemon.species.elegent.desc: A skilled, nimble Pokemon that fights by slapping its opponents across the face with its tough hands. It will always give its foes a chance to strike back, however, due to its strong sense of decorum.
cobblemon.species.sacretary.name: Sacretary
cobblemon.species.sacretary.desc: Its blood is poisonous, but grants those who drink it enhanced agility and power. When it must defend its territory, it pierces its own tail with its beak and laps at the wound.
cobblemon.species.glumbrella.name: Glumbrella
cobblemon.species.glumbrella.desc: Its body is so light that it is often carried away by strong winds. It refuses to bond with others for fear of being blown away and leaving them.
cobblemon.species.pourasoul.name: Pourasoul
cobblemon.species.pourasoul.desc: It drifts listlessly through the sky, bringing dark clouds and stormy weather. Its appearance is said to be an omen of ill fortune, which serves only to worsen its mood.
cobblemon.species.spookebal.name: Spookebal
cobblemon.species.spookebal.desc: Thought to be the spirit of a Pokemon that perished while inside its Poke Ball. It wears its original Poke Ball as a helmet, hoping to lure in its former Trainer.
cobblemon.species.wrassure.name: Wrassure
cobblemon.species.wrassure.desc: A helpful Pokemon that feeds on grime accumulated by others. Many aquatic Pokemon trust them, and will seek them out to get a cleaning.
cobblemon.species.wrassuage.name: Wrassuage
cobblemon.species.wrassuage.desc: Not only does it keep other Pokemon clean, it also heals their wounds. They are sometimes employed to clean dead skin cells off of spa-goers.
cobblemon.species.wrassassin.name: Wrassassin
cobblemon.species.wrassassin.desc: Pretending to offer cleanings, it instead bites other Pokemon to drain their energy. It attacks Wrassure, causing them to evolve into more Wrassassin.
cobblemon.species.baytate.name: Baytate
cobblemon.species.baytate.desc: It attaches discarded Poke Balls to the end of its horn. When other Pokemon investigate the object, the ball opens to reveal a sharp hook.
cobblemon.species.perilscope.name: Perilscope
cobblemon.species.perilscope.desc: With its many eyes, it can constantly monitor its surroundings. The eye atop its head can emit an eerie light that paralyzes anything it touches, even falling rocks or rising bubbles.
cobblemon.species.nemosis.name: Nemosis
cobblemon.species.nemosis.desc: The tentacles on its back were once a separate symbiotic organism, but over time the two fused together. Its body is covered in a special film so it doesn't shock itself.
cobblemon.species.anembidex.name: Anembidex
cobblemon.species.anembidex.desc: Four of its tentacles have become hands, increasing their utility in grabbing prey. It communicates with others of its kind using a complex language of hand signals and electrical pulses.
cobblemon.species.jigglwiggl.name: Jigglwiggl
cobblemon.species.jigglwiggl.desc: An odd, fungal Pokemon that lives under the sea. Its body is sweet, but contains spores that begin to grow into new Jigglwiggl once ingested.
cobblemon.species.bogglwoggl.name: Bogglwoggl
cobblemon.species.bogglwoggl.desc: Its body is incapable of feeling pain and has incredible restorative abilities. Even if a predator devours half its body mass, it will fully regrow in less than a day.
cobblemon.species.spectracle.name: Spectracle
cobblemon.species.spectracle.desc: An intelligent Pokemon that can shift not only its body color, but its typing as well. Its incredible unpredictability makes it a fearsome hunter in the wild.
cobblemon.species.scargot.name: Scargot
cobblemon.species.scargot.desc: Naturally territorial, intruders on its turf will be subjected to blasts of flame and lightning from its shell. It has been domesticated to mark off-limits areas in urban environments.
cobblemon.species.xtrac.name: X-Trac
cobblemon.species.xtrac.desc: The result of a chemistry experiment gone awry. It mixes the goop in its body with other chemicals, not minding if it catches fire or explodes.
cobblemon.species.xparament.name: X-Parament
cobblemon.species.xparament.desc: Its many eyes let it keep perfect track of several tests at once. Its slime is an incredible catalyst for many reactions, so most labs keep a few on hand at all times.
cobblemon.species.widgix.name: Widgix
cobblemon.species.widgix.desc: Born from junk piles, it's a naturally inquisitive Pokemon. It collects small pieces of metal and assembles them into impressive if non-functional creations.
cobblemon.species.damastrophe.name: Damastrophe
cobblemon.species.damastrophe.desc: It roams junkyards, building complex machines. One was rumored to have created a perpetual motion machine, but it was disassembled by a rival Damastrophe before it could be studied.
cobblemon.species.encryptid.name: Encryptid
cobblemon.species.encryptid.desc: It lurks around database centers, and some theorize that it absorbs data from the servers for nutrition. Attempts to seal it away in a secure hard drive have failed.
cobblemon.species.upchick.name: Upchick
cobblemon.species.upchick.desc: Its head is smooth and bare so it can more easily devour carrion. If other scavengers try to claim its prize, it spits out chunks of half-digested meat to keep them at bay.
cobblemon.species.carriannon.name: Carriannon
cobblemon.species.carriannon.desc: Its tube-like beak lets it fire its own stomach contents at rivals. It always takes care to sterilize its feathers by dousing them in stomach acid after a meal.
cobblemon.species.kuloff.name: Kuloff
cobblemon.species.kuloff.desc: Although it is always dripping water, its body never seems to fully melt, even in the extreme temperatures of the deserts to which it's native.
cobblemon.species.kuldown.name: Kuldown
cobblemon.species.kuldown.desc: It sprays cold, hydrating mist to keep itself and others cool in the desert. Many lost wanderers would have succumbed to thirst if not for this kind Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.ampaconda.name: Ampaconda
cobblemon.species.ampaconda.desc: It swims through desert sand as though it is water. After coiling around its prey and shocking them into submission, it swallows them whole, using its powerful bites only to defend itself.
cobblemon.species.spiraclean.name: Spiraclean
cobblemon.species.spiraclean.desc: Spiraclean sucks up sand as it crawls across the desert and filters out any edible morsels. Once it's reached its maximum capacity, it spews out the cleaned sand and continues on its way.
cobblemon.species.ambug.name: Ambug
cobblemon.species.ambug.desc: The bug inside has been restored to life, but it is still immobile within the hardened amber. Its potent psychic powers let it survive even though it cannot breathe or eat.
cobblemon.species.carambug.name: Carambug
cobblemon.species.carambug.desc: The amber has melted into a viscous liquid still under control of the tiny bug. Though it is large and appears intimidating, it acts similarly to most weak, colonial Bug-type Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.spinostern.name: Spinostern
cobblemon.species.spinostern.desc: An aquatic predator that swam in Novrai's oceans long ago. It floated just below the surface, letting its sail absorb sunlight as it closed in on its prey.
cobblemon.species.overroard.name: Overroard
cobblemon.species.overroard.desc: Smaller Pokemon would once ride on its back to cross bodies of water. It went extinct when temperatures rose, causing chunks of glaciers to break off and float into its habitat.
cobblemon.species.cambryo.name: Cambryo
cobblemon.species.cambryo.desc: A very early Pokemon with a simple body plan. The bubble on its front end is filled with a mysterious gas, and it bursts when attacked to cause vivid hallucinations.
cobblemon.species.palaeodox.name: Palaeodox
cobblemon.species.palaeodox.desc: It continuously expels a gas that seems to warp the fabric of reality around it. Some believe that in order to feed, it erases its prey from the timeline completely.
cobblemon.species.granvas.name: Granvas
cobblemon.species.granvas.desc: It came into existence around the same time as the earliest humans. The markings on its face change hue to show its emotions.
cobblemon.species.mezosaic.name: Mezosaic
cobblemon.species.mezosaic.desc: No one is sure if Mezosaic was created by primitive artists, or if it inspired early humans to create art. It seems to have some sort of connection with Unown.
cobblemon.species.fosteraptor.name: Fosteraptor
cobblemon.species.fosteraptor.desc: It took eggs from abandoned nests and raised them as its own. It went extinct because it spent so much time tending to other Pokemon's eggs that it never laid any of its own.
cobblemon.species.itcheep.name: Itcheep
cobblemon.species.itcheep.desc: The red spots on its feathers are patches of infectious germs. Itcheep is unaffected by them, but they quickly spread to sicken anything else that touches them.
cobblemon.species.poxadoodle.name: Poxadoodle
cobblemon.species.poxadoodle.desc: It hosts symbiotic germs in its massive, slimy crest, spreading them on everything it touches. Predators keep far away from its distinctive, red-spotted nest.
cobblemon.species.minsect.name: Minsect
cobblemon.species.minsect.desc: Its shell is impenetrable when it curls up into a ball. Dust collected from its shell has a distinct, refreshing taste that's frequently used as flavoring.
cobblemon.species.crawlycane.name: Crawlycane
cobblemon.species.crawlycane.desc: The oil it sprays from its abdomen tastes wonderful to humans but repulsive to predators. It hangs upside-down from trees to hibernate, and trees covered in Crawlycane are a classic symbol of winter.
cobblemon.species.shivrr.name: Shivrr
cobblemon.species.shivrr.desc: It is always melting, no matter what the temperature is. It appears unexpectedly, usually in early spring when the snow begins to thaw.
cobblemon.species.icecreep.name: Icecreep
cobblemon.species.icecreep.desc: The scarf around its neck is soaking wet and frigid, so touching one is an unpleasant experience. It uses the scarf to bind up prey and drain their life force, leaving them frozen.
cobblemon.species.quaintbrush.name: Quaintbrush
cobblemon.species.quaintbrush.desc: The fluid it leaks changes color depending on its current emotional state. Its entire body has an oddly malleable, almost liquid consistency.
cobblemon.species.blendulum.name: Blendulum
cobblemon.species.blendulum.desc: It mixes the colorful liquids it seeps into beautiful works of abstract art. Some think that the strange landscapes it paints are actually how it perceives the world.
cobblemon.species.thinkblot.name: Thinkblot
