cobblemon.species.thinkblot.desc: Its dripping body shifts rapidly in response to the brain waves of those around it. Its strange liquid leaves permanent stains on clothes.
cobblemon.species.rorschade.name: Rorschade
cobblemon.species.rorschade.desc: It can instantly collapse itself into a puddle of darkness when threatened. They say it can predict someone's future based on which of its facial patterns they see first.
cobblemon.species.scholarva.name: Scholarva
cobblemon.species.scholarva.desc: It sheds its skin frequently and stores layers of it on its back. Ancient humans would harvest this shed skin and use it as material on which to write.
cobblemon.species.intellibee.name: Intellibee
cobblemon.species.intellibee.desc: By hosting colonies of Unown within its wings, it gains access to their powers. It's smart enough to converse with humans, using its stinger to write messages.
cobblemon.species.kreakup.name: Kreakup
cobblemon.species.kreakup.desc: Thanks to the water it carries around, its steps are tottering and unstable. The older the Kreakup, the sweeter the water inside its head tastes.
cobblemon.species.krackpot.name: Krackpot
cobblemon.species.krackpot.desc: Each Krackpot has a very particular taste in leaves. If it's fed a leaf that it dislikes, it will throw a massive tantrum, spouting boiling water and jets of flame everywhere.
cobblemon.species.haloe.name: Haloe
cobblemon.species.haloe.desc: It carries an orb of pure water that it uses to keep itself hydrated during droughts. This water is also very soothing to burns, but Haloe will never offer it to someone it does not trust.
cobblemon.species.aloverity.name: Aloverity
cobblemon.species.aloverity.desc: The flower on its head contains water that soothes burns as well as headaches. It lives near lakes to ensure it has constant access to clean water, as otherwise it may wilt.
cobblemon.species.diretom.name: Diretom
cobblemon.species.diretom.desc: When a fresh source of nutrients pours into a body of water, Diretom populations explode. It releases poison from its body that, in large numbers, can contaminate an entire lake.
cobblemon.species.eruptide.name: Eruptide
cobblemon.species.eruptide.desc: The sludge dripping from its body is as hot as lava, and highly toxic. When this sludge dissolves, it turns the water red and chokes out most other forms of life.
cobblemon.species.plectric.name: Plectric
cobblemon.species.plectric.desc: It attaches itself to rocks to feed on algae, forming a static seal that makes it impossible to pry off. It also gets metaphorically attached to other Pokemon, particularly Dark-types.
cobblemon.species.sharcastric.name: Sharcastric
cobblemon.species.sharcastric.desc: Electricity pulses through its mouth, lighting up its cheek patterns to lure in prey. If two of them meet, each will try to intimidate the other by displaying their multicolored maws.
cobblemon.species.roenin.name: Roenin
cobblemon.species.roenin.desc: Its fins are sharp, and it uses them to chop up aquatic plants to eat. As it grows older, it develops a strong desire to wander from its home.
cobblemon.species.salmurai.name: Salmurai
cobblemon.species.salmurai.desc: It travels endlessly through rivers and seas, swiftly defeating anything in its path. It may choose to partner with a Trainer, but the arrangement is always temporary.
cobblemon.species.harminth.name: Harminth
cobblemon.species.harminth.desc: It taps the halves of its shell together in a steady, constant rhythm when it's relaxed. When it feels threatened, it squirts bright red acid from its three exposed valves.
cobblemon.species.sweeptite.name: Sweeptite
cobblemon.species.sweeptite.desc: Sweeptite crawl along the ground, eating dust collected in their fur. These Pokemon are pleasant to have around and eager to help with cleaning.
cobblemon.species.dustrega.name: Dustrega
cobblemon.species.dustrega.desc: Dustrega soar through the sky at night, spreading mysterious dust on the land below. This dust causes severe allergic reactions and inhibits the growth of plants.
cobblemon.species.librareek.name: Librareek
cobblemon.species.librareek.desc: A social and gregarious Ghost-type, it emerges from bookshelves after dark. It uses its pencil-like horn as its primary weapon.
cobblemon.species.calligrave.name: Calligrave
cobblemon.species.calligrave.desc: It can bite hard enough to remove a person's hand, but becomes docile when its yellow limb is gripped. It records conversations it hears while asleep on its paper-like tongue.
cobblemon.species.authorror.name: Authorror
cobblemon.species.authorror.desc: Its floating books are filled with teeth and snap menacingly at intruders. It's said that every living person has a full document of their life and death written in an Authorror's book somewhere.
cobblemon.species.ghostage.name: Ghostage
cobblemon.species.ghostage.desc: The back of its body is sticky, letting it adhere to any surface. When inanimate objects move on their own, it's often because a Ghostage is possessing them.
cobblemon.species.paranormail.name: Paranormail
cobblemon.species.paranormail.desc: Some believe it to be the restless spirit of a letter that was never mailed. It soars through the night sky, said to be looking for its long-gone recipient.
cobblemon.species.deliveerie.name: Deliveerie
cobblemon.species.deliveerie.desc: The packages forming its body rattle with mysterious contents. It flies from destination to destination and leaves behind cursed items, even during harsh weather.
cobblemon.species.romirror.name: Romirror
cobblemon.species.romirror.desc: Romirror is a vain Pokemon obsessed with keeping itself clean and free of cracks. Its brain cells are distributed across its shiny, reflective surface.
cobblemon.species.resufflect.name: Resufflect
cobblemon.species.resufflect.desc: A Romirror that shatters becomes a Resufflect. It attempts to bite down using its sharp-edged jaws, but even if its victim escapes, they will be cursed with bad luck.
cobblemon.species.meduzap.name: Meduzap
cobblemon.species.meduzap.desc: Though its body is soft like jelly, it has a composition similar to rock. Looking into its eyes leaves you with the feeling of pins and needles for hours.
cobblemon.species.gorgowatt.name: Gorgowatt
cobblemon.species.gorgowatt.desc: When the eyes on its tentacles glow, its victims begin turning into stone. It waits patiently until they're completely immobilized before eating.
cobblemon.species.brawnze.name: Brawnze
cobblemon.species.brawnze.desc: The more battles a Brawnze has won, the shinier its body becomes. Weak Brawnze may try to polish themselves with their tails to appear stronger.
cobblemon.species.silvictor.name: Silvictor
cobblemon.species.silvictor.desc: It trains day and night, working constantly to maximize its power. When two Silvictor meet, they will attack each other without a second thought.
cobblemon.species.goalden.name: Goalden
cobblemon.species.goalden.desc: It evolves only when it pushes itself to its absolute limit. Legend says a team of Goalden led by a noble heroine once defeated an entire army in less than a day.
cobblemon.species.protauri.name: Protauri
cobblemon.species.protauri.desc: Though it is shy, it can be seen at night looking up at the stars. It will often follow around Clefairy, though scientists are unsure why.
cobblemon.species.stargazaur.name: Stargazaur
cobblemon.species.stargazaur.desc: The patterns around its eyes glow brightly when it is happy. It eagerly works with astronomers to track the movements of stars and planets.
cobblemon.species.kaijupiter.name: Kaijupiter
cobblemon.species.kaijupiter.desc: It looks intimidating, but it is really a gentle Pokemon that loves to share the information it gathers each night about the movements of celestial bodies with like-minded humans.
cobblemon.species.recorvid.name: Recorvid
cobblemon.species.recorvid.desc: It has a picture-perfect memory. If you mistreat a Recorvid, it will never forget, and it will inform all its friends to stay away from you, too.
cobblemon.species.survulture.name: Survulture
cobblemon.species.survulture.desc: It keeps careful watch of its prey for weeks, memorizing its schedule before striking. Its three legs give it stability on any type of terrain.
cobblemon.species.culprint.name: Culprint
cobblemon.species.culprint.desc: Anything it sees, it tries to steal, leaving behind a distinctive, oily marking. A Culprint once single-handedly heisted a Poke Mart's entire supply of Burn Heals.
cobblemon.species.underhandit.name: Underhandit
cobblemon.species.underhandit.desc: It produces a red-hot oil from its skin, which coats anything it touches. This oil causes excruciating burns, so reclaiming items it's stolen is a difficult task.
cobblemon.species.eggad.name: Eggad
cobblemon.species.eggad.desc: Eggad clings tightly to its eggshell for its entire life. It secretes a chemical that strengthens the shell, and it squeezes itself inside to protect itself from attack.
cobblemon.species.ornamelt.name: Ornamelt
cobblemon.species.ornamelt.desc: Ornamelt's eggshell has been reinforced with a resilient metal alloy. It uses sticky slime to attach jewels and gold trim to its shell in order to attract potential mates.
cobblemon.species.djironn.name: Djironn
cobblemon.species.djironn.desc: It melts down metal and uses it to build an iron lamp in which to live. Its body naturally produces a lot of soot, so the lamp is often quite dirty.
cobblemon.species.forgenie.name: Forgenie
cobblemon.species.forgenie.desc: Weapons made by a Forgenie never dull or rust. Its oven has a surface temperature of over 600F, but it will become eternally loyal to anyone that touches it with their bare hand.
cobblemon.species.riskard.name: Riskard
cobblemon.species.riskard.desc: A discarded playing card that took on a life of its own. It's naturally attracted to lucky people, but its presence seems to cause misfortune.
cobblemon.species.dektout.name: Dektout
cobblemon.species.dektout.desc: It hates to lose, and it never plays fair. With a strange power, it sees into the hearts of its opponents and manipulates them to achieve victory.
cobblemon.species.puriphin.name: Puriphin
cobblemon.species.puriphin.desc: It feeds on microplastics and other impurities. Over the course of a few days, even heavily polluted water becomes potable within its body.
cobblemon.species.dumpback.name: Dumpback
cobblemon.species.dumpback.desc: It gulps down huge mouthfuls of garbage-filled water, then sprays it back out clean and pure. Its presence helps polluted ecosystems recover.
cobblemon.species.allywag.name: Allywag
cobblemon.species.allywag.desc: When it spies a human, it tries to entice them into following it. Without fail, it leads them into an ambush and takes their valuables.
cobblemon.species.avigate.name: Avigate
cobblemon.species.avigate.desc: It's said that if you follow an Avigate while sailing, it will lead you to great riches. More often, though, it will rob sailors of their supplies.
cobblemon.species.scurvessel.name: Scurvessel
cobblemon.species.scurvessel.desc: Never approach a Scurvessel in the open water. If it spots a boat carrying goods, it will attack by firing ballistics until the vessel sinks, then take the goods for itself.
cobblemon.species.dodojo.name: Dodojo
cobblemon.species.dodojo.desc: A recently extinct Pokemon whose fighting spirit was so tenacious that it refused to pass on. Its bones now serve as weapons for it.
cobblemon.species.taekwondodo.name: Taekwondodo
cobblemon.species.taekwondodo.desc: The closer it is to being defeated, the more determined it becomes. It puts a strange curse on those who overcome it, ensuring it will always get a rematch.
cobblemon.species.karroot.name: Karroot
cobblemon.species.karroot.desc: Its strange eyes are incredibly powerful, giving it perfect vision even in the dark. A single bite of its body will cause you to glow orange for several days.
cobblemon.species.kerratic.name: Kerratic
cobblemon.species.kerratic.desc: It can see through solid objects, letting it dig up underground plants and evade predators. It is highly aggressive towards anything it believes is trying to hide from it.
cobblemon.species.gluctose.name: Gluctose
cobblemon.species.gluctose.desc: Its shed skin has long been harvested as a sweet food source by the people of Novrai, but industrialization has led to overexploitation of this slow-moving Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.onychew.name: Onychew
cobblemon.species.onychew.desc: It synthesizes sweet, sticky sugar strands within its body. It fires these delectable threads at prey to bind them up in an instant.
cobblemon.species.gummiwyrm.name: Gummiwyrm
cobblemon.species.gummiwyrm.desc: It wraps young Gluctose in a cocoon of ultra-sugary silk. Predators that try to bite through the silk will lose their teeth long before reaching the Gluctose inside.
cobblemon.species.foolmingo.name: Foolmingo
cobblemon.species.foolmingo.desc: It pretends to be a bird Pokemon, but it can't fly. Some people will scatter imitation birdseed on their lawns to attract Foolmingo.
cobblemon.species.pitcharade.name: Pitcharade
cobblemon.species.pitcharade.desc: The fire-like flower on its tongue glows and emits real heat to attract Bug-type Pokemon. Once they're within range, it strikes and devours them.
cobblemon.species.bonfird.name: Bonfird
cobblemon.species.bonfird.desc: When it fans out its tailfeathers, it sends sparks flying everywhere. It has a vain personality and doesn't get along with others.
cobblemon.species.conflagrace.name: Conflagrace
cobblemon.species.conflagrace.desc: Its draconic heritage shines through in its brilliant blue flames. This serves only to increase its arrogance, and it will set fire to anything it dislikes without hesitation.
cobblemon.species.kappow.name: Kappow
cobblemon.species.kappow.desc: Its tough scales render it impervious to the lava in which it lives. It cannot actually produce its own heat, so it must carry lava around in its shell.
cobblemon.species.kappatoa.name: Kappatoa
cobblemon.species.kappatoa.desc: The lava it carries in its shell never cools or hardens. But it may expel all of it during a harsh battle, forcing it to retreat into its volcano home.
cobblemon.species.slithm.name: Slithm
cobblemon.species.slithm.desc: Its shell is hollow and makes a loud noise when struck. In exchange for providing it with shelter and water, it allows people to bang its shell to create music.
cobblemon.species.spiroll.name: Spiroll
cobblemon.species.spiroll.desc: It crawls backwards with its shell in front of it. To frighten potential foes, it strikes the shell with its sturdy, toughened eyestalks.
cobblemon.species.percusshell.name: Percusshell
cobblemon.species.percusshell.desc: When it strikes one of its many shells with its eyestalks, the resulting noise can cause earthquakes. Each shell makes a slightly different sound when hit.
cobblemon.species.gnomad.name: Gnomad
cobblemon.species.gnomad.desc: Though rarely seen, its presence revitalizes soil and helps plants flourish. It's highly sought after, but only shows itself to those who care for nature.
cobblemon.species.gnoblety.name: Gnoblety
cobblemon.species.gnoblety.desc: A wanderer by nature, it roams from place to place under the cover of night, carrying mysterious seeds. Plants sprout from the soil on which it walks.
cobblemon.species.gnotorious.name: Gnotorious
cobblemon.species.gnotorious.desc: Those who pollute the environment will face its earth-shaking wrath. Even when it's on a rampage, it leaves any plants in its path totally unhurt.
cobblemon.species.ohman.name: Ohman
cobblemon.species.ohman.desc: When it's afraid, its electricity-producing organ goes into overdrive. This stimulates its muscles, causing it to dart away in a flash.
cobblemon.species.ohmigosh.name: Ohmigosh
cobblemon.species.ohmigosh.desc: It will always flee rather than putting up a fight. If it's frightened, it will blind its assailant with an intense flash of light before disappearing with a shriek.
cobblemon.species.papernova.name: Papernova
cobblemon.species.papernova.desc: Under its thin skin, it contains flammable, lighter-than-air gases. A group of them, usually seen drifting serenely through the night sky, is called a constellation.
cobblemon.species.orbitgami.name: Orbitgami
cobblemon.species.orbitgami.desc: Its body can open up to release a plume of harsh flame. It's normally gentle, however, and emits a comforting warmth and soft light as it floats about.
cobblemon.species.elepath.name: Elepath
cobblemon.species.elepath.desc: It hones its psychic powers by balancing itself atop a ball of mud. As it ages, the chemical composition of the mud changes to become smooth and hard.
cobblemon.species.wackyderm.name: Wackyderm
cobblemon.species.wackyderm.desc: The mouth at the end of its trunk usually speaks in gibberish, but it has sometimes been known to communicate in human language. However, it only ever tells lies.
cobblemon.species.varanox.name: Varanox
cobblemon.species.varanox.desc: Its noxious breath is a result of its diet. If its awful stench isn't enough to ward off enemies, it lunges forward to unleash a venomous bite.
cobblemon.species.halitox.name: Halitox
cobblemon.species.halitox.desc: It harbors over a hundred million kinds of infectious bacteria in its mouth. The more disgusting its breath is, the worse its venom is, and the more respect it gets from its peers.
cobblemon.species.juroxic.name: Juroxic
cobblemon.species.juroxic.desc: Its breath is so repulsive and toxic that even Juroxic itself cannot safely inhale it. The frills around its neck rotate to blow its horrendous breath at its enemies.
cobblemon.species.snowitall.name: Snowitall
cobblemon.species.snowitall.desc: Its body is squishy and delicate, so it uses a layer of ice to protect itself. It loves problem-solving and is naturally attracted to intelligent Trainers.
cobblemon.species.subzerebrum.name: Subzerebrum
cobblemon.species.subzerebrum.desc: It telepathically manipulates hands made of ice to interact with its surroundings. In warmer temperatures, its intelligence seems to suffer.
cobblemon.species.amygdalanche.name: Amygdalanche
cobblemon.species.amygdalanche.desc: As the temperature around it drops, its psychic powers grow ever stronger. It spends its time meditating in the iciest, most secluded caverns of Novrai.
cobblemon.species.pinguin.name: Pinguin
cobblemon.species.pinguin.desc: The shafts of its feathers are reinforced with steel. They're thick and cuddly when rubbed in one direction, but painfully sharp in the other.
cobblemon.species.pingushion.name: Pingushion
cobblemon.species.pingushion.desc: The metal spines that cover its body are actually specialized feathers. In non-polar temperatures, it can easily overheat, so Trainers must stay vigilant.
cobblemon.species.arctire.name: Arctire
cobblemon.species.arctire.desc: It falls at high speeds from the peaks of snow-capped mountains. It gathers rocks and snow as it rolls, continuously growing bigger and stronger.
cobblemon.species.iccelerate.name: Iccelerate
cobblemon.species.iccelerate.desc: It races up and down the sides of mountains, accumulating material for its body. Some daredevils even try to ride on its back, though this often goes poorly.
cobblemon.species.psyclops.name: Psyclops
cobblemon.species.psyclops.desc: With its one great eye, it can immediately pinpoint its enemies' weak points. Unfortunately, its eye also serves as its own easily-targeted weak point.
cobblemon.species.psyphemus.name: Psyphemus
cobblemon.species.psyphemus.desc: It has no need for depth perception thanks to its telekinetic abilities. Though strong, it is not especially intelligent, and a clever opponent can easily outwit it.
cobblemon.species.ballistyke.name: Ballistyke
cobblemon.species.ballistyke.desc: Its icy body is loaded with volatile compounds. It must live in cold areas, as even a little bit of heat could cause it to explode violently.
cobblemon.species.celestorch.name: Celestorch
cobblemon.species.celestorch.desc: Once thought to be a celestial phenomenon, it's now known that if the sky lights up with color outside of an aurora, it's usually this Pokemon rocketing around in the atmosphere.
cobblemon.species.whirlpoon.name: Whirlpoon
cobblemon.species.whirlpoon.desc: Staring into the darkness of its helmet instills a great unease about sailing for several days afterwards. It's often seen living alongside Dhelmise.
cobblemon.species.sirenaut.name: Sirenaut
cobblemon.species.sirenaut.desc: Its alluring song guides ships off-course, where it tears them apart with its wicked claws and drags those aboard into the water. Together, it and Lapras are called the scourges of the sea.
cobblemon.species.bristletoe.name: Bristletoe
cobblemon.species.bristletoe.desc: It lives deep in the coldest waters of the ocean to keep its body temperature low. When two of them meet, the red organs on their backs will light up, and they will embrace.
cobblemon.species.jollychaete.name: Jollychaete
cobblemon.species.jollychaete.desc: The patterns of its blinking lights have a strange effect on other Pokemon, causing them to be more generous and leave morsels of food for it beneath its coiled bristles.
cobblemon.species.germelt.name: Germelt
cobblemon.species.germelt.desc: A strange species of Pokemon uncovered during excavations of an iceberg. It's highly infectious, but the ice that coats it seems to slow it down and keep it docile.
cobblemon.species.contagice.name: Contagice
cobblemon.species.contagice.desc: Its slimy body leaves behind a film that freezes into slippery and near-invisible patches of ice. It absorbs melting ice into its body, but seawater causes it to shrivel up.
cobblemon.species.brumalaise.name: Brumalaise
cobblemon.species.brumalaise.desc: A single brush from its pseudopod can spread disease that causes shivering and sniffling. It can't hold its shape when it's warm and turns to goo, but it can reform again in the cold.
cobblemon.species.wyrmonger.name: Wyrmonger
cobblemon.species.wyrmonger.desc: It was constructed as the ultimate weapon of destruction, but sealed away for fear of its power. Time has worn away its violent nature.
cobblemon.species.kerohelion.name: Kerohelion
cobblemon.species.kerohelion.desc: It was constructed long ago and imbued with mild power over the flow of time. Sunlight gives it energy, so it was sealed away in a cave to keep it from escaping.
cobblemon.species.cadavillar.name: Cadavillar
cobblemon.species.cadavillar.desc: Formed by the fearful souls of weak Bug-type Pokemon, it clings to a set of bones, which it collects from other corpses and reassembles into a familiar form.
cobblemon.species.entomortis.name: Entomortis
cobblemon.species.entomortis.desc: Having overcome its fears, it absorbs ambient souls into itself to keep them safe. It's often referred to as the guardian of the spirit realm, and other Ghost-type Pokemon revere it.
cobblemon.species.xlixir.name: X-Lixir
cobblemon.species.xlixir.desc: The poisonous chemicals within the bottles froth and bubble aggressively. It's said to have some sort of relationship to X-Trac, but no one knows what that might be.
cobblemon.species.relmirror.name: Relmirror
cobblemon.species.relmirror.desc: It's said to be a Romirror that was once owned by a powerful queen. It answers any question posed to it truthfully, but the knowledge always comes at a terrible cost.
cobblemon.species.gronegardian.name: Gronegardian
cobblemon.species.gronegardian.desc: The herbs and roots overflowing from its body possess tremendous healing properties. Some claim to have spied it deep in the forest, communing with groups of Gorgarden.
cobblemon.species.magemeltre.name: Magemeltre
cobblemon.species.magemeltre.desc: It's thought to be a Mushmettle that was transformed by an obscure ritual long ago. Gouts of flame and bolts of psychic energy blast forth from its body uncontrollably.
cobblemon.species.krailstorm.name: Krailstorm
cobblemon.species.krailstorm.desc: A Kreakup owned by a great king is said to have been turned into this Pokemon. Cracks in its body rapidly freeze over, but the water within it somehow remains liquid.
cobblemon.species.surusen.name: Surusen
cobblemon.species.surusen.desc: Unable to accept its passing, it sealed itself away deep inside a cave, where it built itself a new body of rock. It sits silent and motionless, utterly ignoring any attempts to get its attention.
cobblemon.species.ikarma.name: Ikarma
cobblemon.species.ikarma.desc: It was so furious at its demise that it rampaged through a city and razed it to the ground. When its anger was spent, it faded into a deep sleep, but it would take only the slightest provocation to enrage it again.
cobblemon.species.nedareap.name: Nedareap
cobblemon.species.nedareap.desc: It appears to people and Pokemon and promises to grant wishes in exchange for possessing their bodies. However, it is never satisfied with its new form, and disappears before holding up its end of the deal.
cobblemon.species.utsoul.name: Utsoul
cobblemon.species.utsoul.desc: Devastated by the loss of its life, it fled and isolated itself within a cavern where no one could reach it. When rain pours from above, if you listen close, some say you can hear its wailing.
cobblemon.species.anaither.name: Anaither
cobblemon.species.anaither.desc: When it and its siblings perished in a terrible disaster, it was the only one able to find peace and move on. Many who have lost loved ones will try to call upon it, seeking guidance or comfort.
cobblemon.species.mizevaris.name: Mizevaris
cobblemon.species.mizevaris.desc: It greedily hoards gold, jewels, and any other valuables it comes across. It's said to have imbued some of its life force into nuggets of fool's gold to act as defenders of its treasure.
cobblemon.species.chondrius.name: Chondrius
cobblemon.species.chondrius.desc: It presents itself as a weak and injured Pokemon and hypnotizes its victims into caring for it. All the while, it silently infects them with disease, then disappears.
cobblemon.species.astroyatlas.name: Astroyatlas
cobblemon.species.astroyatlas.desc: This legendary Pokemon is said to hold galaxies within its wings. In ancient times, people would worship it and use its starry wings as a map, but now, sightings of it have become less and less common.
cobblemon.species.migreat.name: Migreat
cobblemon.species.migreat.desc: It appears in the Novrai region during the summer solstice, then flies off to a distant region. It never stops to land or rest, but spends its entire life in flight.
cobblemon.species.fawnlora.name: Fawnlora
cobblemon.species.fawnlora.desc: Due to their perfect camouflage, it is hard to estimate how many Fawnlora exist in the wild, or how close to extinction they may be. It's said a forest is blessed if it contains one.
cobblemon.species.botaneer.name: Botaneer
cobblemon.species.botaneer.desc: The flowerbuds growing from their ears generally emit a sweet fragrance, but when angered, Botaneer can use them to create a foul aroma to discourage enemies. Only the richest families keep herds of Botaneer, as a way to flaunt their wealth.
cobblemon.species.forelk.name: Forelk
cobblemon.species.forelk.desc: Only the most skilled trainer is capable of evolving a Botaneer. If mistreated, they will wither and fall ill, making them near impossible to train. They are sometimes kept at Shrines and Temples, and can live up to 100 years.
cobblemon.species.baneep.name: Baneep
cobblemon.species.baneep.desc: Baneep prefer to live in thick canopies, protected from wind. They are a very affectionate species, doting and caring for one another.
cobblemon.species.bannawk.name: Bannawk
cobblemon.species.bannawk.desc: Generally the leaders of a flock of Baneep, they never hesitate to attack with a barrage of seeds if threatened.
cobblemon.species.phoenan.name: Phoenan
cobblemon.species.phoenan.desc: Their helmet is perfect for dive bombing - either to attack or to knock fruit and nuts out of trees. They are very intelligent.
cobblemon.species.instick.name: Instick
cobblemon.species.instick.desc: Instick are unaware that they're prey to most larger Pokemon, and have to rely on their parents to guide them to safety. They love to eat the greenest leaves off of bushes.
cobblemon.species.inscepter.name: Inscepter
cobblemon.species.inscepter.desc: Typically hiding from predators with it's camouflage, Inscepter try to feast on insects even tinier than it. Though it can eat leaves, it finds bugs tastier.
cobblemon.species.chloradise.name: Chloradise
cobblemon.species.chloradise.desc: Chloradise hide behind brushes and trees, waiting for their victims to walk past them for an easy catch. With insane precision and speed, they can cut through entire logs by sharpening their hand-leaves.
cobblemon.species.nawdile.name: Nawdile
cobblemon.species.nawdile.desc: Nawdile are very sly and sneaky. On sunny days Nawdile like to lay in the sun for hours, absorbing the sun's energy. But be careful not to disturb them or they will come biting at you.
cobblemon.species.aliblador.name: Aliblador
cobblemon.species.aliblador.desc: Aliblador may seem lazy and slow, but it can become quite vicious in a matter of seconds if provoked. On lazy days, Aliblador like to bask in the sun, usually near the beaches.
cobblemon.species.razorvile.name: Razorvile
cobblemon.species.razorvile.desc: Upon evolution its blades developed into sharp blades made up of the same material found in the tusks of Haxorus. It can slice through steel beams with ease. Their tails are very powerful and can crush large boulders.
cobblemon.species.scorchet.name: Scorchet
cobblemon.species.scorchet.desc: Small and nimble, Scorchet often make their homes inside fallen logs. When enraged, their ears will flare with fire.
cobblemon.species.torchet.name: Torchet
cobblemon.species.torchet.desc: Torchet is often found consuming berries or even taking them from other Pokemon. After eating, it tends to doze off and become exceedingly warm around the body.
cobblemon.species.regalient.name: Regalient
cobblemon.species.regalient.desc: Rarely found, and only at high altitudes, Regalient and have little regard for strangers and must be approached with extreme caution. If angered, they can use their whiskers like whips to lash and burn their victims at the same time.
cobblemon.species.vulkidna.name: Vulkidna
cobblemon.species.vulkidna.desc: Vulkidna make their homes near volcanic sites, where the earth is often dry and devoid of life. They bury down into the warm soil, and can lie there dormant for years until the volcano is active again.
cobblemon.species.heatreme.name: Heatreme
cobblemon.species.heatreme.desc: The orb of lava on a Hetreme's back is always overflowing and renewing itself to stop it from drying out. When a nearby volcano is about to erupt they go into a rampage.
cobblemon.species.ekiama.name: Ekiama
cobblemon.species.ekiama.desc: Ekiama reside in volcanoes, and typically will never leave unless they need to search for food. They shoot out toxic fumes from their snout.
cobblemon.species.ruflame.name: Ruflame
cobblemon.species.ruflame.desc: Ruflame's ability to regenerate lost body parts is considered by most to be a phenomenon. It is subject to many investigations, in attempts to discover any applications its abilities may have in human medicine.
cobblemon.species.reparch.name: Reparch
cobblemon.species.reparch.desc: Becoming more mischievous, Reparch love to play tricks on trainers, especially their own. It's blood is so hot, it's known to cause burns upon touch.
cobblemon.species.slymander.name: Slymander
cobblemon.species.slymander.desc: Its blood is like liquid-fire, which bursts into flames whenever it comes in contact with oxygen in the air. It constantly has to keep pumping blood to the pads around its body to avoid overheating.
cobblemon.species.barkindle.name: Barkindle
cobblemon.species.barkindle.desc: Barkindle's body is very warm to hug, meaning kids and other Pokemon love to snuggle up to it. When angry, it will heat up and its tail will burn hot.
cobblemon.species.wolflaze.name: Wolflaze
cobblemon.species.wolflaze.desc: Their bodies are warm to touch, but when sick or angered, they are capable of causing serious burns. In battle, its wrists and tail flame up.
cobblemon.species.wolverize.name: Wolverize
cobblemon.species.wolverize.desc: The temperature of a Wolverize's flame can reach up to 2000 Fahrenheit. They are known for their remarkable displays of fire.
cobblemon.species.finjoy.name: Finjoy
cobblemon.species.finjoy.desc: They like to go where people are, and are often found on busy beaches. To entertain, they love doing tricks with beachballs and creating bubble shows.
cobblemon.species.finlock.name: Finlock
cobblemon.species.finlock.desc: Finlock are generally just getting to grips with their psychic powers, making them unpredictable and dangerous to be around. They have developed the ability to teleport to avoid capture.
cobblemon.species.gandolph.name: Gandolph
cobblemon.species.gandolph.desc: One of the most intelligent Pokemon in existence, they exhibit an extreme psychic ability. To avoid being seen, they create complicated illusions and psychic barriers across the sea.
cobblemon.species.pumpel.name: Pumpel
cobblemon.species.pumpel.desc: Whenever a Pumpeel finds water, it drinks it up, and stores it on its back. It can traverse hot deserts for weeks, and has been known to provide water for lost travelers from its hose-like tail.
cobblemon.species.hydrank.name: Hydrank
cobblemon.species.hydrank.desc: Hydrank are kept and utilised in many arid countries to grow food where it would be otherwise impossible. They are often referred to as 'a gardener's best friend'.
cobblemon.species.hydromedary.name: Hydromedary
cobblemon.species.hydromedary.desc: Storing enough water to last its lifetime, Hydromedary continuously pump water through their bodies to cool them in the intense heat of their homelands. It is said they leave an oasis behind them wherever they go.
cobblemon.species.caimar.name: Caimar
cobblemon.species.caimar.desc: Caimar's blood is unusually warm, so it is attracted to cold water currents. Commonly born in Arctic waters, they swim through harsh currents to the tropics, where food is plentiful.
cobblemon.species.torpeed.name: Torpeed
cobblemon.species.torpeed.desc: Torpeed's body is streamlined for fast swimming, even against strong currents. It is capable of harnessing the cold energy found in the icicles on its back.
cobblemon.species.damasoar.name: Damasoar
cobblemon.species.damasoar.desc: Damasoar live in Arctic waters, where they cut through ice sheets in search of prey. They incorporate the ice they break off into their own frozen armour.
cobblemon.species.watuber.name: Watuber
cobblemon.species.watuber.desc: Watuber are very playful and often like to amuse themselves in pools and near shores. Because they're not very good swimmers, they often borrow tubes and floaters.
cobblemon.species.berswade.name: Berswade
cobblemon.species.berswade.desc: Berswade swim everyday to workout their muscles. They like to join swimming athletes in their training and later train with boxers.
cobblemon.species.chambrawl.name: Chambrawl
cobblemon.species.chambrawl.desc: Chambrawl do intense training for hours and hours a day. Their fists are powerful enough to break through boulders and bend steel.
cobblemon.species.roachem.name: Roachem
cobblemon.species.roachem.desc: Although one of the smallest Pokemon, Roachem refuse to go down easily. They gorge on waste and use numbers to take down their foes.
cobblemon.species.enkroach.name: Enkroach
cobblemon.species.enkroach.desc: They gather in large numbers at night, scavenging waste from loose garbage bags. When caught, they swarm around the threat, buzzing their wings in an attempt to scare and confuse the attacker.
cobblemon.species.squabling.name: Squabling
cobblemon.species.squabling.desc: Squabling form nests all over cities and anywhere humans are found. It builds up its body using shredded newspaper or whatever else it may find.
cobblemon.species.suburvian.name: Suburvian
cobblemon.species.suburvian.desc: Suburvian are commonly know to steal any food they see. They are quick to anger and attack agitators.
cobblemon.species.horrendove.name: Horrendove
cobblemon.species.horrendove.desc: A Horrendove can be in charge of a hundred Squabling and Suburvian. They pump their throats up and the one with the biggest and most colourful display will become the leader.
cobblemon.species.rattoi.name: Rattoi
cobblemon.species.rattoi.desc: Rattoi constantly squeak, which funnily enough is a defense mechanism against predators who think they're eating actual toys instead of a Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.skweakrat.name: Skweakrat
cobblemon.species.skweakrat.desc: Skweakrat have incredibly springy bodies, allowing them to jump to incredible heights. They'll use this to their advantage when looking for food or escaping prey.
cobblemon.species.elastikrat.name: Elastikrat
cobblemon.species.elastikrat.desc: Their tough and very elastic skin can stretch up to 20 times their size. It can absorb and endure many rough hits.
cobblemon.species.foutune.name: Foutune
cobblemon.species.foutune.desc: Foutune can produce beautiful songs by blowing air through the hollow channels inside it's body. They will never sing under the care of a bad trainer.
cobblemon.species.harmorial.name: Harmorial
cobblemon.species.harmorial.desc: Harmorial's are said to produce the purest water in the world, which is also rumored to have special healing qualities. The three Foutune unite together in song and produce beautiful melodies that sound through the halls of many palaces in Atlas.
cobblemon.species.vermini.name: Vermini
cobblemon.species.vermini.desc: Vermini dig small tunnels underground, usually below cities. Occasionally, the rumbling caused by a large colony of Vermini moving together can be mistaken for a minor earthquake.
cobblemon.species.vermpent.name: Vermpent
cobblemon.species.vermpent.desc: The three drill-like mouth-parts merge to create a single tool, used to tear through earth and leave behind giant circular tunnels. They're attracted to vibrations above ground.
cobblemon.species.seedent.name: Seedent
cobblemon.species.seedent.desc: They can carry large loads of food in their big cheeks, which are conserved for long periods to be eaten in times of scarcity.
cobblemon.species.nuttone.name: Nuttone
cobblemon.species.nuttone.desc: Nuttone hastily devour stockpiled food before the winter months, increasing their weight to 2 to 3 times their average. They then retire to their burrows until spring returns, where their voracious appetites awaken.
cobblemon.species.flutterbi.name: Flutterbi
cobblemon.species.flutterbi.desc: Flutterbi create beautiful swarms of colours in meadows and are a sign of the seasons. Though common and weak, they are great for educating children about Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.stellarva.name: Stellarva
cobblemon.species.stellarva.desc: Stellarva light up the night like a starry sky. They use their glowing lights to communicate with each other and create beautiful spectacles.
cobblemon.species.crescoon.name: Crescoon
cobblemon.species.crescoon.desc: Crescoon recede high up in the canopy to avoid being seen. At night they can be seen cradling back and forth and glowing softly. The brighter their light, the closer to evolution they are.
cobblemon.species.moothnite.name: Moothnite
cobblemon.species.moothnite.desc: Moothnite use their wings and psychic powers to confuse their foes. They adore bright lights and go around stealing their energy, and it's said that when a light flickers or goes out, there may be a Moothnite nearby.
cobblemon.species.bullirt.name: Bullirt
cobblemon.species.bullirt.desc: When approached they can be aggressive, and will often use dirty tactics like kicking sand in their enemies' eyes to win scuffles. They never back down from a challenge.
cobblemon.species.dirterrier.name: Dirterrier
cobblemon.species.dirterrier.desc: Their pent-up rage is uncontrollable. They are known to disobey their trainers and sometimes bite back when commanded. When trained right, they are extremely loyal.
cobblemon.species.kitture.name: Kitture
cobblemon.species.kitture.desc: Though not known for making trouble, Kitture can make accidents when attempting to get the attention from their owners. This makes them expensive to own, typically.
cobblemon.species.fashewn.name: Fashewn
cobblemon.species.fashewn.desc: Often too pompous for it's own good, these fluffy Pokemon love to strut down long stretches of land. Be it a farm, city, or even graveyard, Fashewn's love to show off.
cobblemon.species.lightwin.name: Lightwin
cobblemon.species.lightwin.desc: There is always one awake and one asleep. Whilst one twin sleeps and recharges its energy, the other shines brightly.
cobblemon.species.hoowhip.name: Hoowhip
cobblemon.species.hoowhip.desc: It sprinkles a dust that puts children to sleep at night. It is said that once hundreds of Hoowhip gathered in a single city, and its inhabitants slept for a whole month.
cobblemon.species.maidnite.name: Maidnite
cobblemon.species.maidnite.desc: Mothers always closed their home's windows in the past to protect their children from the intense stare of this pokemon. At exact midnight it searches for sleeping prey.
cobblemon.species.lickypop.name: Lickypop
cobblemon.species.lickypop.desc: Lickypop lives near carnivals and follows kids wherever they go. It secretes a sticky and sweet goo that is used to decorate Poffins and PokePuffs.
cobblemon.species.caramelix.name: Caramelix
cobblemon.species.caramelix.desc: It produces an extremely sweet liquid that humans love. A single lick is said to make children addicted.
cobblemon.species.slithair.name: Slithair
cobblemon.species.slithair.desc: Slithair glide through the night skies, using noxious smoke as cloud cover. When they spot prey from above, they dive down the from the skies, incapacitating their victims with a quick venomous bite. It's said that in other regions, Nebulent will evolve into a different Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.nunette.name: Nunette
cobblemon.species.nunette.desc: Nunette spend their lives looking for places of purity where they will sit together in silence and focus their psychic powers. They have the ability to look past people's appearances and into their hearts.
cobblemon.species.sisanne.name: Sisanne
cobblemon.species.sisanne.desc: Their third eye allows them to see all around them at any time, even whilst asleep. They avoid noise by all means and live in utmost silence.
cobblemon.species.manna.name: Manna
cobblemon.species.manna.desc: A peaceful aura follows them wherever they go. They will often live their entire lives with their eyes shut, though no one knows how.
cobblemon.species.lemb.name: Lemb
cobblemon.species.lemb.desc: Lemb are known for pointing their butts in the air as they feed on grassy meadows which also serves as a form of camouflage. When it is spring, they leap and bounce everywhere they go with joy.
cobblemon.species.vegelamb.name: Vegelamb
cobblemon.species.vegelamb.desc: Vegelamb will always carry a berry on its head, though no one knows why. The coiled horns above their ears are used to headbutt any challengers within the herd.
cobblemon.species.geomoss.name: Geomoss
cobblemon.species.geomoss.desc: A Geomoss' head acts like a sundial. They are known as the clocks of nature.
cobblemon.species.dialith.name: Dialith
cobblemon.species.dialith.desc: When laying directly on it's back in direct sunlight, it can clearly display the time with shadows. Funnily enough, it loves to sunbathe.
cobblemon.species.solmec.name: Solmec
cobblemon.species.solmec.desc: Solmec's massive bodies are covered in ancient markings, all of which are theorized to be used in an ancient calendar.
cobblemon.species.akakira.name: Akakira
cobblemon.species.akakira.desc: Although very playful, they live on treetops and are rarely seen. The energy made in its cheeks' electric pouches keeps them warm all winter long.
cobblemon.species.barilbil.name: Barilbil
cobblemon.species.barilbil.desc: Barilbil has become a self-sustaining species, that has evolved to the point where it grows enough food on its back to survive off. However, they must eat food off the backs of other Barilbil, as they cannot reach their own supply.
cobblemon.species.haibril.name: Haibril
cobblemon.species.haibril.desc: Haibril are irritable Pokemon on average, and often become absolutely livid at the most minor inconveniences. They are often found locking horns during combat in farms and fields. | Movepool needs adjusting.
cobblemon.species.yolken.name: Yolken
cobblemon.species.yolken.desc: Yolken live very close to one another to constantly exchange body heat, as they hate being cold. The orange marking on its stomach darkens as it gets closer to evolution.
cobblemon.species.roostegg.name: Roostegg
cobblemon.species.roostegg.desc: Roostegg, upon evolution, grows furious and temperamental. They love to create a ruckus, but despite their new rowdy personality, they still protect their Yolken with their life.
cobblemon.species.secheel.name: Secheel
cobblemon.species.secheel.desc: Its mouth acts like a suction pad, which will attach to its prey and won't release until it has sucked enough blood to satisfy it. Inside its body, it will turn the blood into poison.
cobblemon.species.lannelid.name: Lannelid
cobblemon.species.lannelid.desc: You can tell how recently Lannelid has fed by its size, though when it has gone unfed, it can stretch its body to fit through a hole the width of a pencil. They thrive in stagnant water, however, they often poison the entire pool of any other life.
cobblemon.species.nyglow.name: Nyglow
cobblemon.species.nyglow.desc: During moonless nights, groups of Nyglow gather around lakes, gracefully flying in pairs to create majestic light displays.
cobblemon.species.nyglare.name: Nyglare
cobblemon.species.nyglare.desc: Using their powerful wings, Nyglare are able to fly at great speeds to catch their prey. Once caught, they use their powerful glare to paralyze their prey through relentless intimidation.
cobblemon.species.neonite.name: Neonite
cobblemon.species.neonite.desc: Neonite live in warm tropical rivers, and are popular as pets because of their bright scales. By flashing their scales at once, they can blind predators and safely escape.
cobblemon.species.tankton.name: Tankton
cobblemon.species.tankton.desc: Steel-hard scales have protected this Pokemon since prehistoric times. A single ram from its head is enough to sink any boat.
cobblemon.species.crocodily.name: Crocodily
cobblemon.species.crocodily.desc: It floats disguised and motionless underwater, awaiting its prey. It is often mistaken for a lily-pad, as its headpiece is the most convincing aspect of its camouflage.
cobblemon.species.logrodile.name: Logrodile
cobblemon.species.logrodile.desc: Logrodile floats, masquerading logs in the murky waters of swamps. When prey approaches, it bites them viciously with strong jaws that can tear through rocks and mulch bones.
cobblemon.species.jawligator.name: Jawligator
cobblemon.species.jawligator.desc: Jawligator has so much strength in its jaws that it can detach limbs with a single bite. It rolls around while dragging prey underwater to drown them.
cobblemon.species.squirest.name: Squirest
cobblemon.species.squirest.desc: Squirest are believed to be the ghosts of young squires who never made it to the battlefield to fight, so they are constantly picking fights to improve themselves. Though eager, most are not very strong.
cobblemon.species.phantomail.name: Phantomail
cobblemon.species.phantomail.desc: Phantomail are said to be the reanimated remains of fallen knights who had a strong sense of duty, but were not buried. Only their armour and souls remain as they continue to fight even as ghosts.
cobblemon.species.pitchzall.name: Pitchzall
cobblemon.species.pitchzall.desc: Though small, they train all night in parks and playgrounds to improve their throws. Their head is as tough as steel.
cobblemon.species.strikezall.name: Strikezall
cobblemon.species.strikezall.desc: A very competitive Pokemon, they are always training and working at improving their skills. Some have been known to wield more than one steel bat, which they use with ease and skill both on the battlefield and the sports field.
cobblemon.species.moppup.name: Moppup
cobblemon.species.shampooch.name: Shampooch
cobblemon.species.shampooch.desc: - Odor Sleuth Normal - TackleSTAB Normal - Play Nice Normal 5 Lick Ghost 10 Aqua SlapSTAB Water 14 Life Dew Water 18 Bubble BeamSTAB Water 22 CovetSTAB Normal 26 Soak Water 31 Muddy WaterSTAB Water 35 Body SlamSTAB Normal 40 LiquidationSTAB Water 46 Play Rough Fairy 53 Double-EdgeSTAB Normal
cobblemon.species.skibis.name: Skibis
cobblemon.species.flamingant.name: Flamingant
cobblemon.species.flamingant.desc: Flamingant are elegant, frail Pokemon that work on their dancing routine day and night until its perfected. They prefer to entertain rather than fight.
cobblemon.species.birchee.name: Birchee
cobblemon.species.birchee.desc: Often referred to as 'grove-tender's miracle', for its incredible effects on surrounding flora. Forests populated by them exhibit rapid growth that far exceeds neighboring woods.
cobblemon.species.birchop.name: Birchop
cobblemon.species.birchop.desc: Birchop are great assistants to many gardeners as they help plant and tend plants. The leaf on its head allows it to detect any changes in its environment.
cobblemon.species.birchard.name: Birchard
cobblemon.species.birchard.desc: A very hearty Pokemon that enjoys the company of others. Upon evolution, it's body has petrified to withstand damage from harsh weather effects or attacks. Its hollow body serves as a shelter to any Pokemon or Trainer in need.
cobblemon.species.silkch.name: Silkch
cobblemon.species.silkch.desc: Silkch are constantly falling over and bumping themselves, so they wrap themselves in silk bandages.
cobblemon.species.cachoe.name: Cachoe
cobblemon.species.cachoe.desc: Cachoe's head and tail mimic eyes, but are only for display. The real body has turned to liquid inside its silky cocoon, awaiting evolution.
cobblemon.species.silxie.name: Silxie
cobblemon.species.silxie.desc: They have been cultivated in Asia for centuries for their high quality silk. Some have been bred so that they cannot fly.
cobblemon.species.dustar.name: Dustar
cobblemon.species.dustar.desc: Sailors have used Dustar throughout history to navigate the seas. They are sometimes found underwater where they crashed from outer space.
cobblemon.species.okeniandustar.name: OkenianDustar
cobblemon.species.okeniandustar.desc: They crash from outer space into various parts of the world. This Pokemon is impish and mean, but its said that there's another kind of Dustar which are good-natured.
cobblemon.species.clustar.name: Clustar
cobblemon.species.clustar.desc: The opposite forces each star emits is what keeps it levitating. If one of the two loses its glow, the other will lend its energy so that they can mantain balance.
cobblemon.species.astervoid.name: Astervoid
cobblemon.species.astervoid.desc: During evolution, only the sturdiest of the two bodies that made Clustar remains. When Astervoid becomes upset, anything that enters its cosmic ring gets shredded immediately.
cobblemon.species.compella.name: Compella
cobblemon.species.compella.desc: All three stars can point North when asked to by their trainer. They gather in large numbers in the night skies and imitate real stars.
cobblemon.species.esterite.name: Esterite
cobblemon.species.esterite.desc: Esterite is known for its use as a compass. Its head rotates so the biggest spike points the direction its Trainer wants to go. Its Saturn-like ring is constantly spinning.
cobblemon.species.badgrow.name: Badgrow
cobblemon.species.badgrow.desc: Badgrow are scavengers by day, hunters by night. Though they don't like to hunt in packs, they'll team up if one is in danger.
cobblemon.species.wreclaw.name: Wreclaw
cobblemon.species.wreclaw.desc: Wreclaw abandon their daytime persona and adopt their nighttime ferocity completely. They're feared predators of the forests they reside in, and will hunt whatever dares cross their path.
cobblemon.species.criminook.name: Criminook
cobblemon.species.criminook.desc: With their sly and sneaky tactics, Criminook like to steal at night from the homes of people. They take great pleasure in swindling the shiniest items they can find.
cobblemon.species.bandicrook.name: Bandicrook
cobblemon.species.bandicrook.desc: Highly experienced in the art of theft, Bandicrook will steal at any time of day or night, leaving no trace of their presence.
cobblemon.species.dartibi.name: Dartibi
cobblemon.species.dartibi.desc: Groups of Dartibi secretly invade the nests of Twirpant to place their eggs together with Twirpant eggs. Then the newly hatched Dartibi will devour the eggs in the nest. The Dartibi then take over the nest and make it as their own. Despite its body being under-developed, Dartibi will try and fight any challenger. They constantly try to get stronger.
cobblemon.species.revolpod.name: Revolpod
cobblemon.species.revolpod.desc: Inside Revolpod's shell its body is changing. They can rotate at high speeds, and with sufficient torque, they can shatter stone like glass.
cobblemon.species.gigadozer.name: Gigadozer
cobblemon.species.gigadozer.desc: With their new and improved bodies, Gigadozer like to show off their strength by challenging and defeating the most powerful opponents they can find. They take great pride in proving they are the best.
cobblemon.species.coralony.name: Coralony
cobblemon.species.coralony.desc: The three different species of Coralony are constantly fighting for dominance over the group, but there can only ever be one leader. They make up the greatest barrier reefs in the world.
cobblemon.species.barreef.name: Barreef
cobblemon.species.barreef.desc: Its body is made up of dozens of different coral Pokemon, hosting an entire miniature ecosystem. They spend their lives asleep, half buried in the seabed, only moving in search of purer waters.
cobblemon.species.musshield.name: Musshield
cobblemon.species.musshield.desc: Musshield are incredibly weak. They are one of the most commonly fished Pokemon, as they cover large portions of the sea floor.
cobblemon.species.anenemy.name: Anenemy
cobblemon.species.anenemy.desc: Upon evolution it becomes too big for its shell. It now uses its discarded shells as shields to defend itself from predators.
cobblemon.species.shoaly.name: Shoaly
cobblemon.species.shoaly.desc: Shoaly are always born in groups of three and depend on each other for safety. They form large shoals in the open sea and use their patterns to confuse predators.
cobblemon.species.tanchor.name: Tanchor
cobblemon.species.tanchor.desc: Tanchor are prized among sport fishers for their fight and speed. Only the strongest and fastest Shoaly lives to reach evolution out of the three that are born together.
cobblemon.species.petat.name: Petat
cobblemon.species.petat.desc: Its body emits a sweet and tangy aroma that entrances anyone who comes near it. Only found in tropical areas, they are found relaxing on beaches and drink different human beverages to cool down.
cobblemon.species.pangai.name: Pangai
cobblemon.species.pangai.desc: Growing slimmer upon evolution, Pangai tend to become more social and branch out from their original tropical locals. They have the power to hypnotize onlookers with it's fluid dancing and intoxicating aroma.
cobblemon.species.tamarawk.name: Tamarawk
cobblemon.species.tamarawk.desc: Tamarawk travel in large herds through canyons and mountain ranges. Their stampedes have been known to start earthquakes and avalanches.
cobblemon.species.bouldalo.name: Bouldalo
cobblemon.species.bouldalo.desc: Bouldalo are fierce, loving to climb mountain ranges and facing horrible weather conditions. While they dislike the cold, they brave it for the sake of proving themselves.
cobblemon.species.cindera.name: Cindera
cobblemon.species.cindera.desc: It rarely surfaces, as its thin body would quickly harden if exposed too long. Wherever it surfaces it leaves a rocky-cone, and will often create them at frequented spots for easy access.
cobblemon.species.caldona.name: Caldona
cobblemon.species.caldona.desc: Unlike Cindera, with a body temperature of around 2000 F, it is capable of leaving its base for short periods of time. With each step it leaves behind crystalline footprints that sell for a high price to mineral collectors.
cobblemon.species.stelnova.name: Stelnova
cobblemon.species.stelnova.desc: Its swollen bosom is indicative of it's internal pressure, and with a volatile temper Stelnova is a virtual time bomb. It lives at the top of a matriarchy in which Cindera are at the bottom.
cobblemon.species.bashbee.name: Bashbee
cobblemon.species.bashbee.desc: They spend all day collecting nectar, which they then wield as a mace-like weapon. If unable to find other Bashbee to create a colony with, they have been known to join the hives of Combee and Vespiquen instead.
cobblemon.species.woolam.name: Woolam
cobblemon.species.woolam.desc: Woolam are bred for their wool, which is used for knitting woven items like blankets, sweaters, and scarves. The quality of their wool is mostly dependent on their diet.
cobblemon.species.alpalaine.name: Alpalaine
cobblemon.species.alpalaine.desc: Alpalaine's wool is incredibly thick, which enables them to tolerate subfreezing temperatures. Their high quality wool is used particularly in winter apparel because it is extremely resistant to the effects of the cold and provides excellent warmth.
cobblemon.species.battenbae.name: Battenbae
cobblemon.species.battenbae.desc: Battenbae consume high amounts of sugar every day, as it retains their sickeningly sweet aroma that trainers love. If it eats too much, it's smell can become nauseating.
cobblemon.species.brickler.name: Brickler
cobblemon.species.hurdwall.name: Hurdwall
cobblemon.species.hurdwall.desc: Hurdwall take special phalanx-like positions with their kin, spending their days taking in the sun's rays and living peaceful lives... That is until they're confronted with something wanting to cut through them.
cobblemon.species.toxitube.name: Toxitube
cobblemon.species.toxitube.desc: Toxitube hide in discarded pipes to shield their fragile bodies. They blow out smoke constantly to intimidate predators. Even if it doesn't work, the gas is extremely toxic and will finish off any attacker.
cobblemon.species.gassaster.name: Gassaster
cobblemon.species.gassaster.desc: Gassaster scour junkyards and general polluted areas for trash. It's not very known what lies beneath it's gas-covered exterior, but many assume it to be extremely haunting. It's glowing eyes intimidate any Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.stalagrunt.name: Stalagrunt
cobblemon.species.stalagrunt.desc: Stalagrunt work tirelessly in the darkness of caves to aid a leading Stalagang to expand territory. They have brash attitudes, especially when fighting against stronger opponents.
cobblemon.species.stalagang.name: Stalagang
cobblemon.species.stalagang.desc: The three toughest Stalagrunt are chosen to become a Stalagang. After evolving, their newly fused, icy bodies have strange properties. Stalagang are know for dirty tactics, and will drop down from the cave ceilings to attack.
cobblemon.species.freezef.name: Freezef
cobblemon.species.freezef.desc: They gather outside in the mornings, and spend the rest of the day hiding. Being part plant, they need sunlight to survive, but they also run the danger of melting.
cobblemon.species.treezen.name: Treezen
cobblemon.species.treezen.desc: Treezen's permanently frozen leaves dazzle many scientists. They can quickly scare off enemies with a single glance.
cobblemon.species.echidnum.name: Echidnum
cobblemon.species.echidnum.desc: Due to its happy and lovable disposition, Echidnum are always looking for a hug. It never seems to learn however, no matter how many times it hugs someone, that touching its quills gives a nasty static shock.
cobblemon.species.thundret.name: Thundret
cobblemon.species.thundret.desc: When it runs its quills rub together, violently charging up large amounts of static electricity. When levels get too high it must discharge it, but even though it never seems to notice, it is usually on nearby people or Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.sandshar.name: Sandshar
cobblemon.species.sandshar.desc: Sandshar are highly drowsy Pokemon, which reside docile in a blanket of sand upon the sea bed. They will briefly leave it in order to escape a predator, but otherwise will remain still and unresponsive.
cobblemon.species.sharkastle.name: Sharkastle
cobblemon.species.sharkastle.desc: Sharkastle will remain still on the seabed. If theatened or disturbed, it will fire sand out of the cannons on its back, a main reason why divers tend to avoid it.
cobblemon.species.wisper.name: Wisper
cobblemon.species.wisper.desc: Wisper enjoy luring travellers to their deaths by creating a path of flickering lights, leading them into swamps and off the edges of cliffs.
cobblemon.species.wispette.name: Wispette
cobblemon.species.wispette.desc: Wispettes haunt abandoned mansions with their eerie glow. Rumors say that the heat they let off are the burning souls of the underworld.
cobblemon.species.bubbauld.name: Bubbauld
cobblemon.species.bubbauld.desc: Everything they can find Bubbauld pick up and throw into their bubbling pot with their long arms. Once enough ingredients mix, the potion becomes potent enough to knock out an adult.
cobblemon.species.bauldron.name: Bauldron
cobblemon.species.ghoulotine.name: Ghoulotine
cobblemon.species.ghoulotine.desc: With its strong biting power, it can tear through flesh with its razor sharp teeth. Urban legends talk of a begrudging man who cursed a mirror to seek vengeance on two-faced people.
cobblemon.species.guilloceive.name: Guilloceive
cobblemon.species.guilloceive.desc: According to myth, it was a cursed mirror which its master ordered to seek vengeance on people hiding behind a fake personality. Guilloceive has the ability to see one's true self. Looking into it is said to reflect the true inner self of an individual, and if that individual is hiding behind a lie, Guilloceive will curse them with bad luck.
cobblemon.species.needow.name: Needow
cobblemon.species.needow.desc: Commonly found in old homes and ruins, they gather in the dark to collect buttons, but disappear during the day. If you feel a sharp, stabbing pain, there may be a Needow on you.
cobblemon.species.needoon.name: Needoon
cobblemon.species.needoon.desc: Wrapped in a sturdy silk, it's main form of defense is to roll around failing it's body, trying to hit it's predators with it's sharp needles.
cobblemon.species.needella.name: Needella
cobblemon.species.needella.desc: Needella are evil Pokemon that thrive off of the hope of others. It has the power to steal the soul of it's victims and trap it in a web.
cobblemon.species.polynett.name: Polynett
cobblemon.species.polynett.desc: It drifts languidly in the ocean in big groups. When a small Pokemon approaches it quickly captures it with its tentacles.
cobblemon.species.dhiomanpolynett.name: DhiomanPolynett
cobblemon.species.polyzap.name: Polyzap
cobblemon.species.polyzap.desc: If given the chance to trap their pray with their net-like appendages, Polyzap will electrocute them into unconsciousness. After rendering their prey defenseless, Polyzap coat their pray with a gel that allows them to consume them with electrical charges.
cobblemon.species.jollancer.name: Jollancer
cobblemon.species.jollancer.desc: Jollancer find themselves floating above the ocean, only diving when preparing to skewer it's target. People in Atlas will always check the sea for black sails before going swimming.
cobblemon.species.krillzaingel.name: Krillzaingel
cobblemon.species.krillzaingel.desc: Krillzaingel are admired by many motor enthusiasts due to it's sleek, aerodynamic design. No one dares ride them due to the extreme heat let off by their exoskeleton.
cobblemon.species.algrain.name: Algrain
cobblemon.species.algrain.desc: Large gardens of Algrain cover the ocean surface. They use their vines to entangle and strangle anyone who gets too close. They can split to replicate themselves, without the need for a mate.
cobblemon.species.kelpush.name: Kelpush
cobblemon.species.kelpush.desc: Its ability to absorb water is impeccable, and often times can triple it's weight with liquid. Without water, it can be carried around with relative ease.
cobblemon.species.kelprash.name: Kelprash
cobblemon.species.kelprash.desc: Kelprash furiously whip around during hotter seasons, making them a threat to vacationers. A strong slap from a Kelprash, even underwater, is capable of breaking solid rock.
cobblemon.species.gemmo.name: Gemmo
cobblemon.species.gemmo.desc: - Minimize Normal - Rock Polish Rock - Power GemSTAB Rock - Flash Cannon Steel - Gem CrashSTAB Rock - Dazzling Gleam Fairy - Rainbow Rush Fairy
cobblemon.species.barrose.name: Barrose
cobblemon.species.barrose.desc: Barrose live in dry regions, with little water, thus, when the rain does fall, they store as much as they can in their thick trunks. The flower atop its head has a spicy fragrance.
cobblemon.species.baobloat.name: Baobloat
cobblemon.species.baobloat.desc: Though it may look more like a rock, it is actually a type of plant. Its enormous trunk can hold as much as 3000 gallons of water, whilst the giant flower on its head attracts pollinators of all different species.
cobblemon.species.festiata.name: Festiata
cobblemon.species.festiata.desc: Festiata seek joy and happiness wherever they go, but have a deathly fear of sticks. Their insides are said to be delicious.
cobblemon.species.luchaburro.name: Luchaburro
cobblemon.species.luchaburro.desc: After consistent beatings to try and release their sweet treats that reside inside of their body, Festita grow furious. Learning to wield the weapon that they were abused with, Luchaburro now seek vengeance against those who had attacked it when it was defenseless.
cobblemon.species.osstrike.name: Osstrike
cobblemon.species.osstrike.desc: Osstrike are quick to anger, and will pulverize the nearest living thing when enraged. Extremely territorial, they even sanction land from other fellow Osstrike from time to time.
cobblemon.species.prickub.name: Prickub
cobblemon.species.prickub.desc: False Swipe Normal Facade Normal Nature Power Normal Frustration Normal Hidden Power Normal Return Normal Heartfelt Pulse Normal Round Normal Echoed Voice Normal Infestation Bug Energy BallSTAB Grass Grass KnotSTAB Grass Solar BeamSTAB Grass Bullet SeedSTAB Grass Giga DrainSTAB Grass Shadow Claw Ghost Thief Dark Brutal Swing Dark Poison Jab Poison Sand Shot Ground Love Lariat Fairy Attract Normal Protect Normal Rest Psychic Sleep Talk Normal Substitute Normal Swagger Normal Work Up Normal Reflect Psychic Light Screen Psychic Rain Dance Water Sunny Day Fire Sandstorm Rock Roar Normal Bulk Up Fighting Taunt Dark Toxic Poison Grassy Terrain Grass
cobblemon.species.hiberneedle.name: Hiberneedle
cobblemon.species.hiberneedle.desc: False Swipe Normal Facade Normal Nature Power Normal Frustration Normal Giga Impact Normal Hidden Power Normal Return Normal Heartfelt Pulse Normal Round Normal Echoed Voice Normal Brick BreakSTAB Fighting Focus BlastSTAB Fighting Drain PunchSTAB Fighting Infestation Bug Energy BallSTAB Grass Grass KnotSTAB Grass Solar BeamSTAB Grass Bullet SeedSTAB Grass Giga DrainSTAB Grass Fire Punch Fire Thunder Punch Electric Bolt In Steel Shadow Claw Ghost Malice Strike Ghost Thief Dark Brutal Swing Dark Poison Jab Poison Ice Punch Ice Sand Shot Ground Love Lariat Fairy Attract Normal Protect Normal Rest Psychic Sleep Talk Normal Substitute Normal Swagger Normal Work Up Normal Reflect Psychic Light Screen Psychic Rain Dance Water Sunny Day Fire Sandstorm Rock Roar Normal Bulk Up Fighting Swords Dance Normal Taunt Dark Toxic Poison Grassy Terrain Grass
cobblemon.species.thorlock.name: Thorlock
cobblemon.species.thorlock.desc: It hides itself in the sand, awaiting unsuspecting travelers to step on it. It is known by many as 'the devil of the desert'.
cobblemon.species.sandevil.name: Sandevil
cobblemon.species.sandevil.desc: Sandevil's hide under the sand, awaiting their prey. Upon being stepped on, they lash out at their wounded victim with impressive speed and ferocity. (http://fav.me/d4ramdz)
cobblemon.species.sandemonium.name: Sandemonium
cobblemon.species.sandemonium.desc: Sandemonium take long naps in sandstorms, typically getting covered and becoming massive mounds of sand before bursting awake. They crush anything alive with reckless abandon.
cobblemon.species.cheecub.name: Cheecub
cobblemon.species.cheecub.desc: Cheecubs have a consistent need to move around at high speeds, otherwise they will start building up incredible amounts of static. It's possible for Cheecub to charge up enough electricity to power a small town.
cobblemon.species.speeda.name: Speeda
cobblemon.species.princeo.name: Princeo
cobblemon.species.princeo.desc: Typically found near their parents, Princeo are cowardly due to their small stature, though through proper raising, they learn to become strong and brave.
cobblemon.species.reileo.name: Reileo
cobblemon.species.reileo.desc: Carrying themselves with a royal aura and a posse of underlings, Reileo are savage beasts of savannahs all around Atlas. They often sleep in the sun when left undisturbed.
cobblemon.species.sandan.name: Sandan
cobblemon.species.sandan.desc: Sandan stand on shorelines by the hundreds. Approaching sailors would often mistake their silhouettes for aggressive island dwellers amassing into an army.
cobblemon.species.sandtome.name: Sandtome
cobblemon.species.sandtome.desc: Their origin unknown, Sandtome are dwellers of the desert. They prefer to isolate from other Pokemon and stay in packs. They dislike water more than anything else.
cobblemon.species.phantrait.name: Phantrait
cobblemon.species.phantrait.desc: Phantrait are weak spirits that require a vessel to exist. They cling onto objects they can find and hide in them, often to reappear and scare people.
cobblemon.species.vanitom.name: Vanitom
cobblemon.species.vanitom.desc: The spirit is now strong enough to exit the painting. By pretending to cry they haunt old mansions, and are often seen as a pest, leaving wet paint throughout expensive halls.
cobblemon.species.velosoil.name: Velosoil
cobblemon.species.velosoil.desc: Eating minerals from rock formations is part of their healthy diet. It can chew a tunnel all the way through earth's mantle due to it's tough, heat-resistant skin. The eggs they hatch from are hard like rocks.
cobblemon.species.rapterra.name: Rapterra
cobblemon.species.rapterra.desc: Quick on it's feet, Rapterra can bash into things to deal major damage. They eat twice as much as their previous evolution.
cobblemon.species.titanodon.name: Titanodon
cobblemon.species.titanodon.desc: Titanodon is a very destructive Pokemon. It can destroy big buildings with ease and is always up for a challenge against other strong Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.whelter.name: Whelter
cobblemon.species.whelter.desc: Instead of flippers, Whelter's fins are more similar to flotation devices, helping them stay afloat without expending energy. They move slowly, filtering water through their mouth to feed.
cobblemon.species.refhuge.name: Refhuge
cobblemon.species.refhuge.desc: The largest fish pokemon, Refhuge is incredibly docile and has gained a reputation for ferrying people and Pokemon across wide expanses of water. Its red gills can light up to illuminate their paths, creating strange underwater roads at night.
cobblemon.species.gammar.name: Gammar
cobblemon.species.gammar.desc: Because it is only small, it takes shelter in coral patches and rock formations. When cornered, it will release a jolt of electricity allowing make its escape. It is famed for having such bright colours, and is a sought after prize for many Trainers who participate in Pokemon Beauty Contests.
cobblemon.species.zaptang.name: Zaptang
cobblemon.species.zaptang.desc: A social species, it feels more comfortable with its comrades. A shoal of them will combine their powers to paralyse large predators like Tanchor.
cobblemon.species.mimish.name: Mimish
cobblemon.species.eelord.name: Eelord
cobblemon.species.eelord.desc: Rumors say Eelord's blood can cure every disease. It has been hunted all over the world for its blood, and now only a few remain.
cobblemon.species.aquaro.name: Aquaro
cobblemon.species.aquaro.desc: The spiky barbs on its body are toxic, which it can use to defend itself when singled out. They flash their bright colours to warn others of the danger.
cobblemon.species.aquarcher.name: Aquarcher
cobblemon.species.aquarcher.desc: It can stretch and tense up its body to shoot high speed water from its mouth. They gather in hundreds and have been known to also shoot Aquaro when threatened.
cobblemon.species.icee.name: Icee
cobblemon.species.icee.desc: These Pokemon live in such large groups, sometimes they can cover cave floors entirely. They grab passerby's legs and freeze their toes when happy.
cobblemon.species.fraxeel.name: Fraxeel
cobblemon.species.fraxeel.desc: Fraxeel burst out of holes in the middle of the snow, immobilizing their prey with shock. Its teeth are so cold they freeze their victim's blood instantly.
cobblemon.species.colosseel.name: Colosseel
cobblemon.species.colosseel.desc: This Pokemon becomes so big upon evolving that it cannot leave its cave. It lures prey and finishes them with jaws large enough to tear through the hull of a cargo ship.
cobblemon.species.snowoof.name: Snowoof
cobblemon.species.snowoof.desc: Because they are only found in northern areas, Snowoof like to play and run around all day to keep their body heat at a suitable temperature. Their markings typically discern alphas from betas.
cobblemon.species.blizzund.name: Blizzund
cobblemon.species.blizzund.desc: Blizzunds develop a shield the rest of their body from multiple dangers when evolved, and while it seems impractical to let the head be exposed, they have also evolved to have very tough skulls.
cobblemon.species.hoofrost.name: Hoofrost
cobblemon.species.hoofrost.desc: When snowstorms hit, these Pokemon can be seen gathering in big herds so they don't get lost. Its rock-hard ice hooves are durable enough to climb up rocky mountains.
cobblemon.species.glacyak.name: Glacyak
cobblemon.species.glacyak.desc: Glacyak were once used as transportation by people centuries ago. They mastered their skill of quickly climbing up even the most rockiest and steepest of mountains. They are usually very friendly but when angered to a degree, they will rampage and destroy everything in its way.
cobblemon.species.ragtoc.name: Ragtoc
cobblemon.species.ragtoc.desc: It rhythmically shifts from side to side. If its rhythm is somehow interrupted, it can no longer maintain its energy. | Speed is bad, but I'd say it has a base special attack of 100 with special defense of 120 as well as defense.
cobblemon.species.chronotoc.name: Chronotoc
cobblemon.species.chronotoc.desc: Chronotol is said to be timeless, and its aura seems to affect its environment. Its concept of time is beyond human understanding.
cobblemon.species.herokolus.name: Herokolus
cobblemon.species.herokolus.desc: Herokolus train everyday so they can throw at their targets accurately. Its headpiece has special properties that help it to concentrate.
cobblemon.species.diskobolus.name: Diskobolus
cobblemon.species.diskobolus.desc: To improve its disc throwing skills, it carries a larger disc as it grows.
cobblemon.species.atolus.name: Atolus
cobblemon.species.atolus.desc: Everytime it wins a battle, it carries a larger rock. It is said that an Atolus once pushed a mountain to save a village.
cobblemon.species.sauntler.name: Sauntler
cobblemon.species.sauntler.desc: Sauntler are grave dwellers. They wander around cemeteries, visiting each grave to have a connection with lost spirits.
cobblemon.species.grevetiery.name: Grevetiery
cobblemon.species.grevetiery.desc: Grevetiery carried the task of gathering the lost dark spirits at graveyards and bringing them to the underworld.
cobblemon.species.necrogeist.name: Necrogeist
cobblemon.species.necrogeist.desc: Imbued with the souls of vengeful spirits, this Pokemon hunts down anyone who has ever attacked it before. It is said to be a servant to the Ruler of the Underworld.
cobblemon.species.shimm.name: Shimm
cobblemon.species.shimm.desc: Believed to be a magic box that was brought to life by a magician, pulling out the dagger from it will kill it.
cobblemon.species.zhimm.name: Zhimm
cobblemon.species.zhimm.desc: It has the ability to transfer magic between it's two bodies, which both have minds of their own. Zhimms love to do tricks on both young and old, but their blades have proven to be a bit dangerous.
cobblemon.species.shalazhimm.name: Shalazhimm
cobblemon.species.shalazhimm.desc: Shalazhimm are typically seen at any places emanating magic, as it feeds off of it. They're also typically found terrorizing magic shows, as they're upset by false acts of magician-ry.
cobblemon.species.fumystic.name: Fumystic
cobblemon.species.fumystic.desc: Born from a mystical fire, these Pokemon can be spotted roaming abandoned sites that possess enigmatic energy. They are regarded as lucky Pokemon since they will guide and protect lost travelers on their journey.
cobblemon.species.fumeseous.name: Fumeseous
cobblemon.species.fumeseous.desc: In ancient times, it is said that a person will be granted eternal protection if partnered with a Fumeseous. It can control fire fumes at will to do its every bidding.
cobblemon.species.vimana.name: Vimana
cobblemon.species.vimana.desc: Vimana love to fly over people who're in love. They gather together to sing happy tunes, which can calm even the most restless soul.
cobblemon.species.vimanzia.name: Vimanzia
cobblemon.species.vimanzia.desc: This Pokemon's appearance causes joy for everyone looking at it. Because of that, the pheromones Vimanzia pours out are known to help cure depression.
cobblemon.species.yokeye.name: Yokeye
cobblemon.species.yokeye.desc: Yokeye are some of the most playful and mischievous Pokemon in Atlas. There's never not a moment where it's playing some kind of game or trick.
cobblemon.species.ghouch.name: Ghouch
cobblemon.species.ghouch.desc: Though it's appearance isn't much of a change, there's terrible things brewing underneath the fabric cocoon. It's eye can see through walls if it focuses.
cobblemon.species.spireye.name: Spireye
cobblemon.species.spireye.desc: Spireye are always pestering the spirits that try to depart from the world, making them upset and creating poltergeists. It's three eyes can see the real world, the dream world, and the spirit world.
cobblemon.species.polypus.name: Polypus
cobblemon.species.polypus.desc: Clusters of Polypus stay within the reef that they are born in. When the reef is in danger, they leave to find a new home wherever the ocean currents take them.
cobblemon.species.scubella.name: Scubella
cobblemon.species.scubella.desc: Once evolved from Polypus, Scubella lift from the ocean surface and let the winds take them wherever it blows. They are also known to fall in the hands of strangers they are attracted to unexpectedly on their journeys.
cobblemon.species.galaguana.name: Galaguana
cobblemon.species.galaguana.desc: Galaguana reside on the soft, sandy shores of a single small island. They swim out into calm waters to relax and eat seaweed. They constantly lick their lips to keep them moist, which has resulted in some companies using their saliva in lip stick.
